title: El Jefe
line_text: INT. DAY. EL JEFE'S HOUSE -- DINING ROOM

title: El Jefe
line_text: Family dinner, to which all in El Jefe's sprawling family are called every Sunday, and at which attendance is non- negotiable.

title: El Jefe
line_text: The entire family (all fifteen of them) crowds around a large table, kids included, so El Jefe can see his many grandchildren.

title: El Jefe
line_text: PANNING among the family we pick out:

title: El Jefe
line_text: Bembe and Yuni have driven up from Tijuana.

title: El Jefe
line_text: Bembe sits beside his wife, LUPITA, 30s, a native Mexican.

title: El Jefe
line_text: Yuni sits across from them, recently escaped from a tortured marriage that produced no children.

title: El Jefe
line_text: GUSTAVO "TAVO" MEDINA, 30s, the middle child and the "brain," who Vee largely raised after their mother died, a computer and technology expert with the SDPD.

title: El Jefe
line_text: Beside him, his longtime partner, REFUGIO "CUCO" LOPEZ, also 30s, ebullient and irresistible, an SDPD forensics investigator.

title: El Jefe
line_text: LOURDES "LULU" MEDINA, 20s, the "beauty," is the only one who doesn't work in law enforcement, though she is dating TROY LINGLER, 20s, gym-built and crew-cut, a SWAT team officer.

title: El Jefe
line_text: Everything about Lulu is too much: too much makeup, too much cleavage, too loud, too needy.

title: El Jefe
line_text: Vee's seat at the table is conspicuously empty.

title: El Jefe
line_text: Julie has prepared a "decolonized" Mexican feast, which gets passed on heaping platters, family-style.

title: El Jefe
line_text: ...Shouldn't we wait for Vee before we say grace?

title: El Jefe
line_text: Find out how long she will be.

title: El Jefe
line_text: Tavo reaches for his wallet and puts a FIVE on the table...

title: El Jefe
line_text: Yuni jumps in and starts to load up his plate...

title: El Jefe
line_text: Notwithstanding his protests, El Jefe can't resist loading his plate as well...

title: El Jefe
line_text: She does have kind of a high- profile case she's working on.

title: El Jefe
line_text: In TJ we have these cases all the time.

title: El Jefe
line_text: Who wants to wait for Vee?

title: El Jefe
line_text: A look between Julie and El Jefe.

title: El Jefe
line_text: El Jefe smiles at Bembe's youngest son, ARMANDO, 3 and adorable.

title: El Jefe
line_text: and these Thy gifts, which we are about to receive from Thy bounty, through Christ our Lord.

title: El Jefe
line_text: Who wants to hear my news?

title: El Jefe
line_text: What kind of food is this?

title: El Jefe

title: El Jefe
line_text: Tavo and Cuco pick up on it.

title: El Jefe
line_text: Disgusted, Yuni throws his napkin at Bembe.

title: El Jefe
line_text: What had'I gotta do, take my top off?

title: El Jefe
line_text: Suddenly Vee hurries in, followed by Ash.

title: El Jefe
line_text: We got a break in the case.

line_text: We got video of the kidnapers from the morning of -- from a gas station.

title: El Jefe
line_text: Bembe and Yuni exchange a look.

title: El Jefe
line_text: Let's put it on a monitor.

title: El Jefe
line_text: Family comes first, but police work is family.

line_text: Suddenly Bembe, Yuni, Tavo, Cuco, Vee, and Ash clear out and head down the hall to El Jefe's study.

line_text: She smiles and shakes her head.

line_text: That's what the warming drawer is for.

title: The Revenge
line_text: Victoria sits at her vanity removing her diamonds.

line_text: Conrad steps in from the darkness of his office.

title: The Revenge
line_text: You didn't have to exile her.

line_text: You knew Lydia was my closest friend.

title: The Revenge
line_text: It was never meant to be an affair, it just...

title: The Revenge
line_text: For Godsake, is it physically impossible for you to take responsibility for your actions?

title: The Revenge
line_text: A problem you and I seem to share.

title: The Revenge
line_text: If you will remember, I gave up everything once to prove how much I loved you.

title: The Revenge
line_text: You did what you did to save yourself, as much as me.

title: The Revenge
line_text: You may have stayed in this marriage, but your heart stayed with him.

title: The Revenge
line_text: A choice I am reminded of everyday.

title: The Revenge

title: Hitchcock (film)

title: Hitchcock (film)
line_text: Now , Hitch , explain to me why I 'm watching Marion undress ?

title: Hitchcock (film)
line_text: I feel like I should take offense at that .

title: Hitchcock (film)
line_text: Hitch 's eyes light up at this display of mischief from her .

title: Hitchcock (film)
line_text: Perhaps as a boy , Norman secretly watched his mother preparing for her nightly bath .

title: Hitchcock (film)
line_text: Maybe there was a transom over the bathroom door ?

title: Hitchcock (film)
line_text: Yes-one he could access with a chair so long as he was stealthy .

title: Hitchcock (film)
line_text: Well , a boy 's first glimpse of a naked woman is usually his mother .

title: Hitchcock (film)
line_text: I 'm reliving the past , repeating a ritual with Marion ?

title: Hitchcock (film)
line_text: Tony flinches at Hitch 's brusque response .

title: Hitchcock (film)
line_text: They arrive at the set wall , where Hitch removes a painting to reveal the PEEPHOLE .

title: Hitchcock (film)
line_text: Why is the hole much larger on this side ?

title: Hitchcock (film)
line_text: All the better to see you at the greatest possible angle my dear .

title: Hitchcock (film)
line_text: Janet simply steps up and presses her face to the hole .

title: Hitchcock (film)
line_text: Hitch studies her profile , quietly thrilled at her curiosity .

title: Hitchcock (film)
line_text: Tony hangs back , watching Hitch watching her .

title: Hitchcock (film)
line_text: You really do your research , do n't you ?

title: Hitchcock (film)
line_text: It 's just my Jesuit work ethic .

title: Hitchcock (film)
line_text: He takes a quick peek through the hole now too .

title: Hitchcock (film)
line_text: then puts the painting carefully back into place over it .

title: Hitchcock (film)
line_text: I 'm only happy when I 'm working .

title: Halt & Catch Fire
line_text: INT. SENIOR VICE PRESIDENT'S OFFICE -- MORNING

title: Halt & Catch Fire
line_text: MacMillan, Clark sit in their respective chairs.

title: Halt & Catch Fire
line_text: They are joined by lawyer BARRY SHIELDS (50)  good suit, if a bit small.

title: Halt & Catch Fire
line_text: The man himself is small, balding, worried.

title: Halt & Catch Fire
line_text: He carries Clark and MacMillan's report.

title: Halt & Catch Fire
line_text: An' why the hell can't we just fire these pecker heads?

title: Halt & Catch Fire
line_text: Because then we are gonna lose this lawsuit.

title: Halt & Catch Fire
line_text: If you fire them and shelve their work, we are essentially admitting guilt.

title: Halt & Catch Fire
line_text: We do that, we tell IBM 'You are right, we are wrong.'

title: Halt & Catch Fire
line_text: But the damage is already done.

title: Halt & Catch Fire
line_text: We have got the entire IBM ROM BIOS layout on 150 pages of Cardiff Giant letterhead.

title: Halt & Catch Fire
line_text: Barry takes off his glasses, rubs the bridge of his nose.

title: Halt & Catch Fire
line_text: We say that Cardiff Giant, as a company, was pursuing PC development all along.

title: Halt & Catch Fire
line_text: I sure as hell don't see how that clears away the hornet's nest.

title: Halt & Catch Fire
line_text: We take Clark's findings on the BIOS chip.

title: Halt & Catch Fire
line_text: The performance, the system map, all of it.

title: Halt & Catch Fire
line_text: We hand over the report to an engineer and tell them to build something that operates and performs in the exact same way.

title: Halt & Catch Fire
line_text: We don't tell them how to do it, and we certainly don't tell them we learned how by pulling apart an IBM machine and looking inside with a flashlight, but--

title: Halt & Catch Fire
line_text: I don't think we have one engineer capable of building a BIOS from scratch other than

title: Halt & Catch Fire
line_text: Or any other engineer we currently employ.

title: Halt & Catch Fire
line_text: Someone who knows nothing about us or IBM, and has never seen the contents of this binder.

title: Halt & Catch Fire
line_text: At this point, we are all dirty and have to walk away.

title: Halt & Catch Fire
line_text: They have got to be as far away from this as humanly possible, and this report has to go in a locked drawer until the end of time.

title: Halt & Catch Fire
line_text: We get out of this by actually building a PC clone.

title: Halt & Catch Fire
line_text: So we basically have to open a whole new line of business.

title: Halt & Catch Fire
line_text: To legally be in the clear, yes.

title: Halt & Catch Fire
line_text: This is your brilliant idea to save our hides?

title: Halt & Catch Fire
line_text: Again, all eyes on Joe MacMillan.

title: Halt & Catch Fire
line_text: Eyeballs him with a West Texas stare for a moment.

title: Halt & Catch Fire
line_text: You know how many futures you are toyin' with, son?

title: Halt & Catch Fire
line_text: This is a systems software company.

title: Halt & Catch Fire
line_text: But before that, what was it?

title: Halt & Catch Fire
line_text: It's not about what it is today, it's about what it's going to be tomorrow.

title: Halt & Catch Fire
line_text: It may be your business, but Joe is talking about the future.

title: Halt & Catch Fire
line_text: Selling systems software, he probably would have made you a couple hundred thousand dollars this year.

title: Halt & Catch Fire
line_text: We just made you several million.

title: Halt & Catch Fire
line_text: Everyone turns to Clark, his voice surprising in this room.

title: Halt & Catch Fire
line_text: Bosworth appears as if he's about to bite through his own teeth.

title: Halt & Catch Fire
line_text: I don't know 'bout you boys, but this is best sales pitch I ever heard.

title: Halt & Catch Fire
line_text: Because in Texas, you put a man's livelihood on the line and don't come through...

title: Halt & Catch Fire
line_text: You won't be gettin' any new job, 'cause ain't nobody gonna able to find where you buried.

title: Halt & Catch Fire
line_text: So put me in charge of the PC division.

title: Halt & Catch Fire
line_text: If you want this to succeed, then I am in charge.

title: Halt & Catch Fire
line_text: I frankly don't trust anyone else to see it through and it was my idea to--

title: Halt & Catch Fire
line_text: I am saying you get both of us.

title: Halt & Catch Fire
line_text: Because this is no longer a business of numbers, quota, or revenue.

title: Halt & Catch Fire
line_text: This is the business of imagination.

title: Halt & Catch Fire
line_text: I cracked that ROM BIOS chip like it was the morning crossword.

line_text: I have a thousand reasons not to be here right now, and does Matt, so does Gwen, so does Gavin...

title: Black Bird

title: Black Bird
line_text: Jimmy enters to find US Attorney Edmund Beaumont and FBI Agent Janice Butkus sitting at a conference table.

title: Black Bird
line_text: On the table in front of Butkus is a BLACK BINDER.

title: Black Bird

title: Black Bird
line_text: She grimaces at the absurdity of the question.

title: Black Bird
line_text: We will let you know when we are done.

title: Black Bird
line_text: The Guards nod and vacate the room.

title: Black Bird
line_text: Jimmy finds himself looking into the playful eyes of Janice Butkus.

title: Black Bird
line_text: You can call me that or "Janice."

title: Black Bird
line_text: Jimmy covers a twitch of a smile.

title: Black Bird
line_text: Jimmy nods bitterly, looks into Beaumont's pitiless eyes.

title: Black Bird
line_text: Mr. Beaumont sandbagged me into accepting a five-year plea when he knew I had get ten.

title: Black Bird
line_text: Remorse for how I treated you?

title: Black Bird
line_text: You played chicken with us and you lost.

title: Black Bird
line_text: Beaumont gives Butkus a Get to it look.

title: Black Bird
line_text: He's only halfway sold on whatever brought them here.

title: Black Bird
line_text: I hear you are making a real go of prison.

title: Black Bird
line_text: No major beefs, seem to get along with most of the dominant gangs and successfully avoid the ones you don't know yet.

title: Black Bird
line_text: You use all your profits to buy

title: Black Bird
line_text: fresh vegetables and lean cuts of meat?

title: Black Bird
line_text: But you seem to have grabbed it by the balls.

title: Black Bird
line_text: What is this sideline by the way?

title: Black Bird
line_text: Must be a lot of, what do they call it in retail, breakage?

title: Black Bird
line_text: I turn my inventory over a lot.

title: Black Bird
line_text: That's what you called drugs too your "inventory."

title: Black Bird
line_text: At least on the tapes I heard.

title: Black Bird
line_text: I am not surprised you are thriving in here, Jimmy.

title: Black Bird
line_text: Because you are a charming guy.

title: Black Bird
line_text: I have heard you talk to Mexican cartel guys, Cabrini-Green bangers, Outfit goombahs in their track suits at the Elmwood Park Social Club, even that El Salvadoran chica you did a one-time deal with two years back.

title: Black Bird
line_text: Jimmy gives it a diffident shrug of confirmation.

title: Black Bird
line_text: And she was a killer, man.

title: Black Bird
line_text: Her name was Esmerelda Flores by the way.

title: Black Bird
line_text: Took two in the back of the head last summer.

title: Black Bird
line_text: But my point, Jimmy, is you get along with everyone.

title: Black Bird
line_text: I noticed something elseafter a certain point, they do most of the talking.

title: Black Bird
line_text: You have got your patter, your funny story or two, but then you settle back and just let them run their mouths.

title: Black Bird
line_text: Take mesomething in those soulful eyes of yours, the way you sit so still, so at peace with yourself, it just makes me want to babble, man.

title: Black Bird
line_text: Jimmy can't get a firm handle on her, (something Butkus counts on), and it rattles him.

title: Black Bird
line_text: You mentioned a point a while back.

title: Black Bird
line_text: Jimmy looks to Beaumont but Beaumont's eyes are dead.

title: Black Bird
line_text: Cuz we can let you get back to it.

title: Black Bird
line_text: You got porn to sell, veggies to procure, and only nine years and three months left on your sentence.

title: Black Bird
line_text: I don't want to hold you up.

title: Black Bird
line_text: Just fucking tell me why I am here.

title: Tall in the Saddle
line_text: CLOSE SHOT on a soiled and wrinkled envelope lying on a table .

title: Tall in the Saddle
line_text: It is addressed to : Mr. Rocklin c/o Santee Ranch .

title: Tall in the Saddle
line_text: The CAMERA PULLS BACK and Rocklin is revealed at the table , looking down at the letter .

title: Tall in the Saddle
line_text: His hat is tipped back on his head , and his sleeves are rolled up .

title: Tall in the Saddle
line_text: He is mixing dough in a bowl sitting on the table near the letter , and his hands are all gooey .

title: Tall in the Saddle
line_text: Dave is discovered in front of the fireplace where his outer shirt and socks are drying .

title: Tall in the Saddle
line_text: It is dark outside , but the storm has abated .

title: Tall in the Saddle
line_text: Rocklin goes to a shelf near the fireplace to get a pan .

title: Tall in the Saddle
line_text: Durn funny-that storm quittin ' just about the time I get here .

title: Tall in the Saddle
line_text: No funnier than you sloggin ' through it , just to deliver a letter from a woman .

title: Tall in the Saddle
line_text: Reckon I 'm gettin ' to be more of a fool the older I get .

title: Tall in the Saddle
line_text: Dave watches Rocklin at the table shaping the dough for biscuits and putting it in the pan .

title: Tall in the Saddle
line_text: When are we gonna get around to readin ' it ?

title: Tall in the Saddle
line_text: Rocklin can not help smiling a bit at the way Dave includes himself in .

title: Tall in the Saddle
line_text: Thought I 'd wait till morning -- might be bad news an ' I would n't be able to sleep .

title: Tall in the Saddle
line_text: Dave screws up his face in utter disgust and turns his attention to his drying clothes .

title: Tall in the Saddle
line_text: Rocklin , meanwhile , takes a flour sack from the table , wipes the dough from his hands and picks up the letter .

title: Tall in the Saddle
line_text: He goes over to the fireplace , opening the letter the while , and sits on the bench .

title: Tall in the Saddle
line_text: Dave , seeing this , edges discreetly around in back of Rocklin in order to see over his shoulder .

title: Tall in the Saddle
line_text: The letter open , Rocklin takes out a roll of bills along with the folded message .

title: Tall in the Saddle
line_text: He lays the envelope on the bench .

title: Tall in the Saddle
line_text: Rocklin places the money in his shirt pocket for the moment , and opens the folded message .

title: Tall in the Saddle
line_text: It begins with the usual Dear Mr. Rocklin .

title: Tall in the Saddle
line_text: Rocklin 's voice is heard over the insert as he reads from here .

title: Tall in the Saddle
line_text: Forgive me if this letter is a trifle incoherent , but I am terribly worried and unhappy .

title: Tall in the Saddle
line_text: Who would n't be-livin ' with that ole screech owl .

title: Tall in the Saddle
line_text: I am desperately in need of help and advice from someone whom I feel I can trust , and I am appealing to you , because I regard you in the same way my Uncle surely must have .

title: Tall in the Saddle
line_text: I heartily dislike and distrust Judge Garvey-

title: Tall in the Saddle
line_text: But my Aunt seems to have suddenly revised her opinion of him , and now wants me to place all my affairs in the Judge 's hands and return east .

title: Tall in the Saddle
line_text: Such is certainly not my wish .

title: Tall in the Saddle
line_text: Looks kinda like she 's formed an attachment .

title: Tall in the Saddle
line_text: I wanted so much to give ranch life a trial , but fear circumstances are against me , especially in view of the recent Indian trouble-

title: Tall in the Saddle
line_text: Good Lord , they ai n't been any Indian trouble around here in-

title: Tall in the Saddle
line_text: You want to hear the rest of this ?

title: Tall in the Saddle
line_text: I want to apologize for what took place this afternoon .

title: Tall in the Saddle
line_text: And I am returning the 150 , because I feel it is rightfully yours .

title: Tall in the Saddle
line_text: The letter finished , Rocklin regards it a moment , then slowly returns it to the envelope as he gazes thoughtfully into the fire .

title: Tall in the Saddle
line_text: Dave meantime straightens up-scratches his shaggy top , and turns his attention once more to his drying clothes .

title: Tall in the Saddle
line_text: Well-what do you make of it ?

title: Tall in the Saddle
line_text: Rocklin continues looking into the fire as he lays the letter back on the bench and takes out tobacco to roll a cigarette .

title: Tall in the Saddle
line_text: Somebody 's sure bustin ' to get her out of there .

title: Tall in the Saddle
line_text: Dave sits alongside Rocklin and begins putting on his socks .

title: Tall in the Saddle
line_text: Wonder why the old lady 's playin ' along ?

title: Tall in the Saddle
line_text: Got to admit though , I feel a mite sorry for the young un-nice little tyke .

title: Tall in the Saddle
line_text: Rocklin has been mulling things over .

title: Tall in the Saddle
line_text: Do n't know how I could help her-even if I wanted to-I do n't know any thing about this Garvey-or Caldwell-or-

title: Tall in the Saddle
line_text: Well , now-I could mebbe help you out some , there-Fact , I could tell you somethin' bout ole Red that might be interestin ' .

title: Tall in the Saddle
line_text: You must have known him pretty well-What kind of a man was he ?

title: Tall in the Saddle
line_text: Rocklin goes to the table and resumes molding biscuits .

title: Tall in the Saddle
line_text: Dave has his boots on and is putting on his outer shirt .

title: Tall in the Saddle
line_text: - The best-cantankerous cuss-but a real cowman , believe me-He was a big feller , like yourself-Fact , you coulda passed fer a blood relation , come to think of it .

title: Tall in the Saddle
line_text: (casually , as he busies himself with the biscuits .)

title: Tall in the Saddle
line_text: Was the Judge and Red friends ?

title: Tall in the Saddle
line_text: Besides which they was regular drinkin ' pals-played poker together most nights-tho ' they do say Red got the worst of it .

title: Tall in the Saddle
line_text: Oh , yeah-reckon a pretty poor one , tho '-still you 'd say him and Garvey was friends .

title: Tall in the Saddle
line_text: Anything ever happen to make you think they were n't ?

title: Tall in the Saddle
line_text: Rock-I 'm gon na tell you somethin' I ai n't never told anybody .

title: Rush Hour
line_text: Everybody is where we left them.

line_text: That act we do is just so his people don't know we are connected.

line_text: Lee stares at him, not taking it, then looks to Carter:

line_text: This has to be a mistake.

line_text: I assumed I had get a competent officer to assist in my investigation.

line_text: Okay, first off, I assist no one.

title: Rush Hour
line_text: I am the man in charge.

line_text: I am in charge of that bird.

title: Rush Hour

line_text: That's why the feds made me - asked me - why they asked me, nicely, to get you out of the way.

line_text: You give me the intel you have from the Chinese side, maybe I will let you work with me.

title: Rush Hour
line_text: You are unprofessional, careless, dishonest, apathetic--

title: Rush Hour
line_text: Are you reading from an invisible thesaurus right now?

line_text: Five minutes ago you didn't speak English.

title: Rush Hour
line_text: I work alone, too, so no hard feelings.

title: Rush Hour
line_text: Now you go solve your case.

title: Rush Hour

line_text: The house is packed, the party mostly outside on the deck, spilling down the stairs to the beach.

line_text: Abby is trying too hard with the other guests, smiling a little too broadly, her caftan a little too bright, her heels a little too high for the beach --

title: Goodfellas

title: The Last Temptation of Christ (film)
line_text: And showed you the way to his room .

line_text: He treated you like a royal visitor .

line_text: God brought you here , did n't he ?

line_text: All he brought here is my shame .

title: The Last Temptation of Christ (film)
line_text: He drives his nails into my heart .

line_text: He wants to push me over .

title: The Last Temptation of Christ (film)
line_text: But he did n't touch my lips with burning coals .

line_text: What does He want from me ?

line_text: Ca n't he see what 's inside me ?

title: The Last Temptation of Christ (film)
line_text: I do n't have the courage .

title: The Last Temptation of Christ (film)
line_text: When I see a woman , I blush and look away .

title: The Last Temptation of Christ (film)
line_text: For God , I smother the lust , and that satisfies my pride .

title: The Last Temptation of Christ (film)
line_text: I never steal or fight , or kill .

title: The Last Temptation of Christ (film)
line_text: not because I do n't want to but because I 'm afraid .

title: The Last Temptation of Christ (film)
line_text: I want to rebel against everything , everybody .

title: The Last Temptation of Christ (film)
line_text: If you look inside me you see fear , that 's all .

title: The Last Temptation of Christ (film)
line_text: Fear is my mother , my father , my God .

title: The Last Temptation of Christ (film)
line_text: The more devils we have inside of us , the more chance we have to make angels .

title: The Last Temptation of Christ (film)
line_text: Angel ' is the name for the devils who repent .

title: The Last Temptation of Christ (film)
line_text: so , you have to have faith .

title: The Last Temptation of Christ (film)
line_text: Have you ever slept with a woman ?

title: The Last Temptation of Christ (film)
line_text: And you do n't want to ?

title: The Last Temptation of Christ (film)
line_text: Well , then what do you want ?

title: The Last Temptation of Christ (film)
line_text: Why do n't you answer me ?

title: The Last Temptation of Christ (film)
line_text: So you 'd better not ask me anything else , or I 'll start my blasphemies .

title: The Last Temptation of Christ (film)
line_text: There 's Lucifer inside of me saying , You 're not the son of the Carpenter , you 're the son of King David .

title: The Last Temptation of Christ (film)
line_text: You 're not a man , you 're the son of man .

title: The Last Temptation of Christ (film)
line_text: And further : the son of God .

title: The Last Temptation of Christ (film)
line_text: Do you want to ask me anything else ?

title: Return of the Jedi
line_text: The room is deserted , only the awful debris of the alien celebration giving mute witness to the activity here before .

title: Return of the Jedi
line_text: Several drunk creatures lie unconscious around the room , snoring loudly .

title: Return of the Jedi
line_text: A shadowy figure moves stealthily among the columns at the perimeter of the room and is revealed to be Boushh , the bounty hunter .

title: Return of the Jedi
line_text: He picks his way carefully through the snoring , drunken monsters .

title: Return of the Jedi
line_text: Han Solo , the frozen space pirate , hangs spotlighted on the wall , his coffin-like case suspended by a force field .

title: Return of the Jedi
line_text: The bounty hunter deactivates the force field by flipping a control switch to one side of the coffin .

title: Return of the Jedi
line_text: The heavy case slowly lowers to the floor of the alcove .

title: Return of the Jedi
line_text: Boushh steps up to the case , studying Han , then turns to the controls on the side of the coffin .

title: Return of the Jedi
line_text: He activates a series of switches and , after one last , hesitant look at Han , slides the decarbonization lever .

title: Return of the Jedi
line_text: The case begins to emit a sound as the hard shell covering the contours of Han 's face begins to melt away .

title: Return of the Jedi
line_text: The bounty hunter watches as Han 's body is freed of its metallic coat and his forearms and hands , previously raised in reflexive protest , drop slackly to his side .

title: Return of the Jedi
line_text: His face muscles relax from their mask of horror .

title: Return of the Jedi
line_text: Boushh 's ugly helmet leans close to Han 's face listening for the breath of life .

title: Return of the Jedi
line_text: Han 's eyes pop open with a start and he begins coughing .

title: Return of the Jedi
line_text: The bounty hunter steadies the staggering newborn .

title: Return of the Jedi
line_text: Han touches his face with his hand and moans .

title: Return of the Jedi
line_text: Your eyesight will return in time .

title: Return of the Jedi
line_text: The bounty hunter reaches up and lifts the helmet from his head , revealing the beautiful face of PRINCESS LEIA .

title: Return of the Jedi
line_text: I got ta get you out of here .

title: Return of the Jedi
line_text: As Leia helps her weakened lover to stand up , the relative quiet is pierced by an obscene HUTTESE CACKLE from the other side of the alcove .

title: Return of the Jedi
line_text: The curtain on the far side of the alcove opens , revealing Jabba the Hutt , surrounded by Bib and other aliens .

title: Return of the Jedi
line_text: He laughs again , and his gross cronies join in a cacophony of alien glee .

title: Return of the Jedi
line_text: Look , Jabba , I was just on my wayto pay you back , but I got a little sidetracked .

title: Return of the Jedi
line_text: It 's too late for that , Solo .

title: Return of the Jedi
line_text: You may have been a good smuggler , but now you 're Bantha fodder .

title: Return of the Jedi
line_text: The guards grab Han and start to lead him away .

title: Return of the Jedi
line_text: Han is dragged off , as Lando quickly moves forward and attempts to lead Leia away .

title: Return of the Jedi
line_text: Jabba chuckles as Lando and a second guard drag the beautiful young princess toward him .

title: Return of the Jedi
line_text: Threepio peeks from behind a monster and quickly turns away in disgust .

title: Return of the Jedi
line_text: Inexorably her lovely face moves to within a few inches of Jabba 's ugly blob of a head , and Leia turns away in disgust .

title: Return of the Jedi
line_text: Ohhh , I ca n't bear to watch .

line_text: Fight it , so it speeds faster on its way-

line_text: That 's what I was waiting for-

line_text: Suddenly : Nico springs to life (catching Noose man by surprise and jerking the cable from his grip)-grabbing Zagon with his taped hands by the throat , lifting him bodily , slamming him ferociously into the wall !

line_text: Zagon drops to the floor , half-conscious .

line_text: Nico spins instantly to find : the Shot-gun agent right behind him , raising his weapon to Nico 's face , about to pull the trigger .

line_text: Can you feel the chemicals , cherry ?

title: The Patriot (2000 film)
line_text: LORD CORNWALLIS , a proud man , comfortable with command , coldly notes one of his officers slapping another on the back .

title: The Patriot (2000 film)
line_text: MAJOR HUNTINGTON rolls out a map for Cornwallis .

title: The Patriot (2000 film)
line_text: The officers gather around the map .

title: The Patriot (2000 film)
line_text: Major , this is not an adequate map .

title: The Patriot (2000 film)
line_text: We have better coming on the trailing supply convoy from Charleston .

title: The Patriot (2000 film)
line_text: A useful place for our maps .

title: The Patriot (2000 film)
line_text: I 'm sorry , sir , it wo n't happen again .

title: The Patriot (2000 film)
line_text: Tarleton and Wilkins join them around the map .

title: The Patriot (2000 film)
line_text: We have a difficult campaign ahead of us .

title: The Patriot (2000 film)
line_text: We are in predominately hostile country and we can not rely on forage .

title: The Patriot (2000 film)
line_text: As we move north , the bulk of our supplies will reach us by sea , through Charleston , which will give us a long and vulnerable supply line , one that can only be secured if the locals are loyal to the crown .

title: The Patriot (2000 film)
line_text: Cornwallis turns to his field officers , paying particular attention to Tarleton .

title: The Patriot (2000 film)
line_text: Nonetheless , we must remember that this is a civil war .

title: The Patriot (2000 film)
line_text: These colonials are our brethren and when this conflict is over , we will be reestablishing commerce with them .

title: The Patriot (2000 film)
line_text: Surrendering troops will be given quarter and unwarranted assaults on civilians will cease .

title: The Patriot (2000 film)
line_text: I expect this war to be fought in a vigorous but civilized manner .

title: The Patriot (2000 film)
line_text: Cornwallis looks at his other officers .

title: The Patriot (2000 film)
line_text: Have I made myself clear , gentlemen ?

title: The Patriot (2000 film)
line_text: Cornwallis shifts his eyes back to Tarleton who was not among those who spoke .

title: The Patriot (2000 film)
line_text: Tarleton pointedly pauses a moment , then says :

title: The Patriot (2000 film)
line_text: Cornwallis turns his attention back to the map .

title: All American

title: Salamander
line_text: INT. PENTHOUSE OFFICE - MID-TOWN SKYSCRAPER - DAY

title: Salamander
line_text: Sunlight streams in through a wall of windows as Kant talks to a SLENDER MAN, (60s), hundred dollar haircut, bespoke suit, accustomed to being in charge.

title: Salamander
line_text: Across the vast office, a SECOND MAN  stands with his back to them, half out-of-focus, staring out the window at the city below, as Slender Man reacts to what Kant has come to tell them.

title: Salamander
line_text: There are millions of dollars in transferrable securities in that vault.

title: Salamander
line_text: Not to mention cash and jewels.

title: Salamander
line_text: Save for the Salamander boxes, the thieves ignored it all.

title: Salamander
line_text: Somehow they knew exactly what they were looking for.

title: Salamander
line_text: It's taking Slender Man a moment to get over his shock.

title: Salamander
line_text: Apparently the implications of this are devastating.

title: Salamander
line_text: I had assume an inside job, but I can't see how.

title: Salamander
line_text: Beside the three of us, no one even knew of their existence.

title: Salamander
line_text: Or who they were each linked to.

title: Salamander
line_text: And you are sure of that?

title: Salamander
line_text: You never mentioned them to anyone?

title: Salamander
line_text: One night when you were trying to impress her with how important you are.

title: Salamander
line_text: And finally all Slender Man can do is shake his head.

title: Salamander
line_text: Kant looks up as that Second Man turns from the window.

title: Salamander
line_text: His name is JOHN LAWRENCE (though we won't learn that until episode three).

title: Salamander
line_text: Per raw IQ, he's one of the five smartest men in the world, and one of the most ruthless.

title: Salamander
line_text: Lawrence's almost Zen-like self control doesn't hide how simply TERRIFYING this man is.

title: Salamander
line_text: We sit back and we watch.

title: Salamander
line_text: Whoever stole the contents of those boxes isn't interested in money.

title: Salamander
line_text: And now, in the span of twelve minutes you have given them the same access it took us two decades to acquire.

title: Salamander
line_text: In twelve minutes you have just given them the world.

title: Salamander
line_text: And as we wonder what he means by this, Kant just stares at Lawrence.

title: Salamander
line_text: Not certain he's going to leave this room alive.

title: Salamander
line_text: So we sit back, and we watch.

title: Salamander
line_text: We wait for that access to be exploited...

title: Salamander
line_text: That's how we discover who did this.

title: Salamander
line_text: And then we make them sorry they did.

title: Tremors
line_text: Harlan quietly leads Val and Mindy to a boulder.

title: Tremors
line_text: A few dozen yards ahead ARTHUR, ZOE

title: Tremors
line_text: They have been circle jerking like that for twenty minutes.

title: Tremors

title: Tremors
line_text: The boots cut down on vibration and helmets will keep your breathing in check so they won't hear

title: Tremors
line_text: He reaches past the protective clothing and grabs a shoulder- fired missile launcher.

title: Tremors
line_text: But Melvin's up before Val can stop him.

title: Tremors
line_text: He steps out in front of the boulder and calls out to the Deliberates

title: Tremors
line_text: Any of you freaks seen a big worm?

title: Tremors
line_text: The Deliberates all turn to see him.

title: Tremors
line_text: Or worried about the rocket launcher in his hands.

title: Tremors
line_text: He and the others step away and reveal they have been hiding a GRABOID HOLE.

title: Tremors
line_text: Covered with ripped clothing and fresh blood and guts.

title: Tremors
line_text: Val and the others behind the boulder know immediately what the hole is.

title: Tremors
line_text: And realize that goddamn, THE GRABOIDS ARE BACK.

title: Tremors
line_text: Instead, he moves out from behind the boulder and starts toward the Deliberates.

title: Tremors
line_text: You guys happen to know how recently that hole was made?

title: Tremors
line_text: Val! Couldn't pass up a chance to be the hero again, huh?

title: Tremors
line_text: Val glances to Zoe who shrugs.

title: Tremors
line_text: No idea why, but that can wait.

title: Tremors
line_text: Because right now I need you to slowly make your way to that boulder behind me.

title: Tremors
line_text: I will drive as many people back to town as I can then come back for the rest.

title: Tremors
line_text: The Graboids respond to sound and vibration.

title: Tremors
line_text: So step quietly and don't talk.

title: Tremors
line_text: Because if they know where you are they will kill you.

title: Tremors
line_text: We came to Perfection to help them.

title: Tremors
line_text: The Graboids were created to bring balance back to earth and you nearly stopped them from fulfilling their destiny.

title: Tremors
line_text: I want you to sacrifice yourself.

title: Tremors
line_text: It's the only restitution worthy of your brutality.

title: Tremors
line_text: I know you are stoned but the fire you are playing with is a cold- blooded monster that eats fire for breakfast

title: Tremors
line_text: Arthur pulls out a gun and FIRES A SHOT Next TO VAL'S HEAD.

title: Tremors
line_text: Mindy, Harlan and Melvin duck down behind the boulder.

title: Tremors
line_text: Arthur points the gun in his face.

title: Tremors
line_text: And everyone else get on the boulder.

title: Tremors
line_text: So you can watch Val's empty existence miraculously end with meaning.

title: Tremors
line_text: Val starts to take off his Graboid protective suit.

title: Tremors
line_text: Zoe and the Deliberates climb onto the boulder next to Harlan, Mindy and where Melvin discretely aims the launcher at Arthur.

title: Tremors
line_text: I am going to blow this idiot back to Burning Man.

title: Tremors
line_text: I am not hitting Val, I am saving the bastard.

title: Tremors
line_text: Val is out of his suit and pretends to struggle with his boots, but really signals to Melvin and shout/whispers

title: Tremors
line_text: You don't tell me what to do.

title: Tremors
line_text: Said louder than reason would recommend, his plan is now completely exposed.

title: Tremors
line_text: Mindy and Harlan look at him in disbelief.

title: Tremors
line_text: Arthur points the gun at Melvin who immediately complies.

title: Tremors
line_text: Arthur smiles and paces around Val.

title: Tremors
line_text: You are the monster here, Val.

title: Tremors
line_text: The persona you cling to is based on an act of genocide.

title: Tremors
line_text: And somehow you have deluded yourself into believing you are more powerful than nature.

title: Tremors
line_text: Which as we are about to see, isn't the case.

title: Tremors
line_text: He slips into Val's boots and puts the gun to his head and leads him forward.

title: L.A. Confidential (film)
line_text: The CHIEF sits behind a desk in a four-star uniform .

title: L.A. Confidential (film)
line_text: Dudley Smith sits to his left , D.A. Ellis Loew to his right .

title: L.A. Confidential (film)
line_text: Seen earlier at the Mickey Cohen press conference , Loew is the only civilian .

title: L.A. Confidential (film)
line_text: Bud White stands across from them .

title: L.A. Confidential (film)
line_text: Officer White , you 've refused to cooperate with Internal Affairs .

title: L.A. Confidential (film)
line_text: But you should know this is bigger than a police board .

title: L.A. Confidential (film)
line_text: Quite frankly , we need police witnesses to offset the damage done to the Department 's image .

title: L.A. Confidential (film)
line_text: Bud glances to a gray tinted mirror , then to the Chief .

title: L.A. Confidential (film)
line_text: The Chief sighs , looks to Loew .

title: L.A. Confidential (film)
line_text: Loew steps to Bud , holds up a newspaper with the cell block photo .

title: L.A. Confidential (film)
line_text: You and Officer Stensland brought the liquor into the precinct .

title: L.A. Confidential (film)
line_text: Do you see how appearing as a voluntary witness against him could offset the damage you 've done to yourself ?

title: L.A. Confidential (film)
line_text: I wo n't testify against my partner or anyone else .

title: L.A. Confidential (film)
line_text: Bud sets them on The Chief 's desk .

title: L.A. Confidential (film)
line_text: This is the new L.A.P.D. , White .

title: L.A. Confidential (film)
line_text: You 're suspended from duty and dismissed .

title: L.A. Confidential (film)
line_text: Turning , White shoots the mirror a stiff middle finger as he makes his way out .

title: L.A. Confidential (film)
line_text: OTHER SIDE OF GLASS , Exley watches , involuntarily leans back as Bud passes on the other side of the glass .

title: L.A. Confidential (film)
line_text: THE CHIEF 'S OFFICE , Dudley , Loew and The Chief wait as Exley enters .

title: L.A. Confidential (film)
line_text: Ed , your observations have been astute .

title: L.A. Confidential (film)
line_text: What 's your assessment of this situation ?

title: L.A. Confidential (film)
line_text: This was a full-fledged riot of policemen .

title: L.A. Confidential (film)
line_text: Shift the guilt to men whose pensions are secured .

title: L.A. Confidential (film)
line_text: Indict , try and convict Stensland and Bud White .

title: L.A. Confidential (film)
line_text: Feed them to the sharks , sir .

title: L.A. Confidential (film)
line_text: Straight D fitness reports from every C.O. he ever served under .

title: L.A. Confidential (film)
line_text: But White is a valuable officer .

title: L.A. Confidential (film)
line_text: He 's a man who can answer yes to those questions I ask you from time to time .

title: L.A. Confidential (film)
line_text: The Chief interrupts with his own concern .

title: L.A. Confidential (film)
line_text: I want to know who we give the public in contrast ?

title: L.A. Confidential (film)
line_text: Clean-cut , forthright men the public can admire .

title: L.A. Confidential (film)
line_text: I 'm not afraid to do what 's right .

title: L.A. Confidential (film)
line_text: Exley seizes the moment , going over Dudley 's head .

title: L.A. Confidential (film)
line_text: The Chief and Dudley exchange a look .

title: L.A. Confidential (film)
line_text: Your father did n't make lieutenant until he was 33 .

title: L.A. Confidential (film)
line_text: I also know that when he made lieutenant , it was as a detective .

title: L.A. Confidential (film)
line_text: Before we start polishing our laurels , it would look better if we had a corroborative witness .

title: L.A. Confidential (film)
line_text: That 'll be hard to come by .

title: L.A. Confidential (film)
line_text: He 's the technical advisor on Badge of Honor , ' sir .

title: L.A. Confidential (film)
line_text: That 's the way to get him .

title: L.A. Confidential (film)
line_text: As Exley starts out , Dudley pulls him aside , speaks low .

title: L.A. Confidential (film)
line_text: You 'll reap the benefits , but are you truly prepared to be despised within the department ?

title: L.A. Confidential (film)
line_text: JACK VINCENNES , Looking sharp , he strides down the hall , enters the .

title: L.A. Confidential (film)
line_text: Sergeant , we 'll get right to it .

title: L.A. Confidential (film)
line_text: Nine civilian witnesses have identified you as hitting Ezekiel Garcia .

title: L.A. Confidential (film)
line_text: But my office has a stellar witness who will tell the grand jury that you hit back only after being hit .

title: L.A. Confidential (film)
line_text: What do I have to do ?

title: L.A. Confidential (film)
line_text: Testify against the three officers who have already earned their pensions .

title: L.A. Confidential (film)
line_text: Our key witness will testify roundly , but you can plead ignorance to questions directed at the other men .

title: L.A. Confidential (film)
line_text: I 'll guarantee you a slap on the wrist .

title: L.A. Confidential (film)
line_text: A brief suspension followed by a temporary transfer from Narcotics to Ad Vice .

title: L.A. Confidential (film)
line_text: When you transfer out of Vice , you 'll be back on the show .

title: My Time, Your Time

title: My Time, Your Time
line_text: Well, I guess you called someone back?

line_text: My relationship is pretty serious too.

line_text: We have toothbrushes at each other's places.

title: My Time, Your Time
line_text: I don't want to say running it, but

title: Jean-Claude Van Johnson
line_text: JCVD sits in front of a large, lightbulb-encircled MAKEUP MIRROR.

title: Jean-Claude Van Johnson
line_text: Vanessa drops a BLACK FILE FOLDER in his lap, then steps around behind him, starts doing his hair.

title: Jean-Claude Van Johnson
line_text: JCVD opens the folder, studies the PHOTOGRAPHS inside: VIALS

title: Jean-Claude Van Johnson
line_text: FULL OF FLOURESCENT ORANGE LIQUID. DIRTY SYRINGES. DEAD BODIES  most of them either MURDERED or OD'ed in horrific fashion.

title: Jean-Claude Van Johnson
line_text: It's coming from somewhere in the city and spreading across Eastern Europe like the plague... only deadlier.

title: Jean-Claude Van Johnson
line_text: Your job is to find out who's making it and take the whole operation down...

title: Jean-Claude Van Johnson
line_text: JCVD's intimidated, but tries not to show it.

title: Jean-Claude Van Johnson
line_text: He hurriedly moves on to the next photo, which is of a

title: Jean-Claude Van Johnson
line_text: My early intel says that this may be the source of the Mimosa; I am going to get a closer look this morning while you are doing fight choreography.

title: Jean-Claude Van Johnson
line_text: If it checks out, I will have you in by the end of the week.

title: Jean-Claude Van Johnson
line_text: She's still got a soft spot for JC.

title: Jean-Claude Van Johnson
line_text: But I have moved on, JC... and you should too.

title: Jean-Claude Van Johnson
line_text: I don't want you to get hurt.

title: Jean-Claude Van Johnson
line_text: JCVD looks up, meets Vanessa's eyes in the mirror.

title: Jean-Claude Van Johnson
line_text: The trailer door SWINGS OPEN  shattering whatever developing moment may have been  and in walks LUIS, a YOUNG LATINO MAN covered head-to-toe in tattoos  face, neck, hands, you name it (don't name it).

title: Jean-Claude Van Johnson
line_text: He's as surprised to see JCVD as JCVD is to see him.

title: Jean-Claude Van Johnson
line_text: Star-struck, but he's a professional; he will roll with it.

title: Jean-Claude Van Johnson
line_text: He wanted to transition into something more stable; he runs nuclear material in and out of South Korea now.

title: Jean-Claude Van Johnson
line_text: JCVD looks Luis up and down.

title: Jean-Claude Van Johnson
line_text: Kid can't be more than twenty- three.

title: Jean-Claude Van Johnson
line_text: I spent nine years as a child soldier with the Zeta Cartel.

title: Jean-Claude Van Johnson
line_text: Top of my class at the Paul Mitchell Acadamy.

title: Jean-Claude Van Johnson
line_text: Plus a Beacon Award at PBA Beauty Week 2012.

title: Jean-Claude Van Johnson
line_text: Luis wheels an ENORMOUS ROLLING CASE from the back wall to JCVD's side.

title: Jean-Claude Van Johnson
line_text: He then lifts the heavy lid, revealing THE MOST IMPRESSIVE MAKEUP KIT EVER ASSEMBLED.

title: Jean-Claude Van Johnson
line_text: Seriously, there's a fucking Sephora up in this thing.

title: Jean-Claude Van Johnson
line_text: Luis holds up a single finger  there's more.

title: Jean-Claude Van Johnson
line_text: A simple twist of the lipstick (not a euphemism, he's actually twisting a tube of lipstick here), and a SECRET COMPARTMENT IS REVEALED.

title: Jean-Claude Van Johnson
line_text: What the fuck do you think?

title: Jean-Claude Van Johnson
line_text: THE COOLEST GUNS YOU'VE EVER SEEN. JCVD looks back up at Luis, a WIDE SMILE on his face.

title: Jean-Claude Van Johnson
line_text: A pleasure to meet you, Luis.

title: Glamorous
line_text: And we are inside as Venetia's tour briskly passes by.

title: Glamorous

line_text: And that is Lawrence Collins, the head of Product Development.

title: Glamorous

line_text: Ben looks back at the glass, and: the tour's gone.

title: The Good Guys

title: Gattaca
line_text: INT. GATTACA-MEZZANINE FLOOR. LATER IN THE DAY.

title: Gattaca
line_text: From above , the INVESTIGATOR and HUGO observe the final EMPLOYEE exit the testing lab .

title: Gattaca
line_text: LAMAR , following the employee out of the lab , throws a look of vindication to the two cops .

title: Gattaca
line_text: We do n't have the manpower .

title: Gattaca
line_text: From outside , if you have to .

title: Gattaca
line_text: I 'll take it out of your damn pension if you question my authority one more time !

title: Gattaca
line_text: The INVESTIGATOR turns his back on his subordinate and idly contemplates the nearby telescope .

title: Gattaca
line_text: Hugo resignedly relays the news to Director Josef who is standing some distance away .

title: Gattaca
line_text: Josef 's immediate reaction is to march towards the Investigator , Hugo trailing behind .

title: Gattaca
line_text: DIRECTOR JOSEF collects himself as he notices the Investigator 's hand on the telescope .

title: Gattaca
line_text: Would you care to look-in the telescope ?

title: Gattaca
line_text: One look through there and you would know why I ca n't possibly allow you to disrupt operations any further .

title: Gattaca
line_text: You 're so unconcerned that you have a killer in your midst .

title: Gattaca
line_text: Right now , your presence is creating more of a threat .

title: Gattaca
line_text: I do n't think you have any concept of what we do here -- how meticulous our preparations must be .

title: Gattaca
line_text: We are about to send twelve people through 140 million miles of blackness to rendezvous with an object the size of a house and the color of coal .

title: Gattaca
line_text: So it 's rather critical to point them in the right direction .

title: Gattaca
line_text: And we certainly do n't need you looking over our shoulders .

title: Gattaca
line_text: Besides , I do n't believe there is any evidence that the killer is amongst us .

title: Gattaca
line_text: I do n't see too many other dead bodies littering the place .

title: Gattaca
line_text: No , but since there are n't too many live ones tonight either , you wo n't mind us conducting one further sweep .

title: Gattaca
line_text: If he does not work here , then there should be no other trace of him .

title: Gattaca
line_text: I think you 'd better get some people out of bed , Detective .

title: Gattaca
line_text: In the meantime we can re-check his favorite haunt .

title: Gattaca
line_text: You see , Director , I prefer my microscope .

title: Panther (film)
line_text: Rounding a corner Cy spots SABU-yep , he 's still dealing .

title: Panther (film)
line_text: I swear , you got ta be a card-carrying member of the stupid revolution .

title: Panther (film)

line_text: Is she giving him the milk we gave her or selling it ?

title: City of Joy (film)
line_text: Aloka soothes Meeta as she hustles her , Poomina , and the baby out , then quickly begins to wipe Max 's face with a clean rag .

title: City of Joy (film)
line_text: This is n't something she 's accustomed to doing , but she 's doing it before she has time to think .

title: City of Joy (film)
line_text: Max finds himself conscious of her closeness to him .

title: City of Joy (film)
line_text: and then she becomes suddenly self-conscious and she backs off , ducks her head .

title: The Crazy Ones
line_text: SYDNEY ROBERTS, thirty-two, sits in front of a MONITOR in the bay area of Lewis, Roberts & Roberts, a modern, eclectic imaginarium passing itself off as an advertising agency.

title: The Crazy Ones
line_text: Gripped, even, as THE ICONIC APPLE "THINK DIFFERENT" COMMERCIAL PLAYS OUT.

title: The Crazy Ones
line_text: They are not fond of rules.

title: The Crazy Ones
line_text: And they have no respect for the status quo.

title: The Crazy Ones
line_text: REVEAL ZACH CROPPER, thirty-one, copywriter, the most beautiful man in the world.

title: The Crazy Ones
line_text: He's a cool breeze, he speaks so smoothly it's almost musical.

title: The Crazy Ones
line_text: I see you are watching your lucky video, sweet, and in this case justified, luck is a good thing to have today, take my hand, Sydney.

title: The Crazy Ones
line_text: Your father doesn't know the pitch.

title: The Crazy Ones
line_text: Sydney leaps up; Zach holds tight to her hand, nearly causing her arm to come out of its socket.

title: The Crazy Ones
line_text: I am not nearly done with my bad news, there's more.

title: The Crazy Ones
line_text: You know how I like to be conjugal on occasion.

title: The Crazy Ones
line_text: It's my way, often for the benefit of the agency, sometimes it's less philanthropic, anyway, the woman I was with last night -- lovely woman, I think you had quite like her -- she works in Account Management at Chiat.

title: The Crazy Ones
line_text: She told me Sam Peters, their CCO, met with McDonald's yesterday.

title: The Crazy Ones
line_text: The rumor is McDonald's is coming in this morning to fire us.

title: The Crazy Ones
line_text: Sydney charges off; Zach holds her hand, CLOTHESLINES

title: The Crazy Ones
line_text: I should have let go there.

title: Beauty and the Beast (Steinberg)
line_text: Elisabeth, in tears, sitting by Dorian's bedside.

title: Beauty and the Beast (Steinberg)
line_text: THREE PHYSICIANS, tending to a still-unconscious Dorian.

title: Beauty and the Beast (Steinberg)
line_text: Yanta Mho, sitting at the foot of the Emperor's sickbed like a dog mourning its owner.

title: Beauty and the Beast (Steinberg)
line_text: Cyril, standing off to the side, a PAIR OF SOLDIERS with him; it appears he was just giving them orders...

title: Beauty and the Beast (Steinberg)
line_text: But now, he's giving Grace a nasty glare.

title: Beauty and the Beast (Steinberg)
line_text: A tense beat-- no one is quite sure what to say...

title: Beauty and the Beast (Steinberg)
line_text: Grace starts towards her father's bed.

title: Beauty and the Beast (Steinberg)
line_text: What do you think you are doing?

title: Beauty and the Beast (Steinberg)
line_text: I have the antidote he needs.

title: Beauty and the Beast (Steinberg)
line_text: You may stay, I will need your help.

title: Beauty and the Beast (Steinberg)
line_text: You have committed the most serious of crimes, young lady--

title: Beauty and the Beast (Steinberg)
line_text: You should know, I can't stand it when you call me that.

title: Beauty and the Beast (Steinberg)
line_text: As Grace talks, she gives the NIGHTWEED to the physicians--

title: Beauty and the Beast (Steinberg)
line_text: Do you know what to do with this?

title: Beauty and the Beast (Steinberg)
line_text: But then looks to Cyril-- Doesn't know who he should be taking orders from.

title: Beauty and the Beast (Steinberg)
line_text: She knows full well what's going on here.

title: Beauty and the Beast (Steinberg)
line_text: You are in no position to give orders-- I am in charge here!

title: Beauty and the Beast (Steinberg)
line_text: When he wakes up, which of you wants to explain to him why you defied me?

title: Beauty and the Beast (Steinberg)
line_text: All except Elisabeth, Mara, the doctors, Cyril, Yanta Mho, and Garrick.

title: Beauty and the Beast (Steinberg)
line_text: And if he does not wake up...

title: Beauty and the Beast (Steinberg)
line_text: I will see to it you are charged with treason before you ever sit a day on the throne.

title: Beauty and the Beast (Steinberg)
line_text: The physicians set to work grinding up the nightweed.

title: Beauty and the Beast (Steinberg)
line_text: Elisabeth approaches Grace, her eyes red from crying.

title: Beauty and the Beast (Steinberg)
line_text: A look of unbearable guilt on her face.

title: Beauty and the Beast (Steinberg)
line_text: Elisabeth doesn't know what to say.

title: Beauty and the Beast (Steinberg)
line_text: Grace looks to her sister, sensing it's bullshit.

title: Beauty and the Beast (Steinberg)
line_text: Wanting her to tell the truth.

title: Beauty and the Beast (Steinberg)
line_text: Grace looks back to Yanta Mho.

title: Beauty and the Beast (Steinberg)
line_text: If he's taking the rap for this, then he's taking the rap for this...

title: Beauty and the Beast (Steinberg)
line_text: We will be discussing this later.

title: Beauty and the Beast (Steinberg)
line_text: Grace then steps away, moves back to Dorian.

title: Beauty and the Beast (Steinberg)
line_text: You shouldn't be talked to like one.

title: Beauty and the Beast (Steinberg)
line_text: Off Elisabeth, not quite sure what to make of this new turn in her relationship with Yanta Mho...

title: Beauty and the Beast (Steinberg)
line_text: ON THE PHYSICIAN, as he pours the nightweed solution into Dorian's mouth.

title: Beauty and the Beast (Steinberg)
line_text: Grace sits by the bedside, watching.

title: Beauty and the Beast (Steinberg)
line_text: The medicine goes down Dorian's throat...

title: Beauty and the Beast (Steinberg)
line_text: No response from Dorian at all.

title: Beauty and the Beast (Steinberg)
line_text: Subjects prepare to lose a king.

title: Beauty and the Beast (Steinberg)
line_text: Daughters prepare to lose their dad...

title: Beauty and the Beast (Steinberg)
line_text: Takes his face in her hands...

title: Beauty and the Beast (Steinberg)
line_text: Puts an arm around Grace to console her.

title: Beauty and the Beast (Steinberg)
line_text: But then, refusing to give up-- Grace pushes Mara away-- Gets in Dorian's face--

title: Beauty and the Beast (Steinberg)
line_text: Around the room, no one can watch Grace unravel like this.

title: Beauty and the Beast (Steinberg)
line_text: And just as they are sure this has just become a wake--

title: The Society
line_text: She tries to grab onto him  onto his shirt.

title: The Society
line_text: She TEARS at her own clothes.

line_text: He tries to stop her  calm her down.

line_text: No, just -- stop  you have to try  It doesn't help  EMILY

title: The Society
line_text: I need  my mom  I need

title: The Society
line_text: Grabs her hand  even as Emily squirms.

title: The Society
line_text: Luke can't take it any more  her pleading eyes.

title: The Society
line_text: He gets up and walks a few feet away.

title: The Society
line_text: Moose is by his side, immediately.

title: The Society
line_text: There are no fucking cobras here!

title: The Society
line_text: If this were yesterday  if we were home  but we are three hours from anywhere...

line_text: I have no idea what to do.

line_text: What the fuck does that mean?

title: The Society
line_text: But I made her do this.

title: The Society
line_text: What are -- you are giving up?

title: The Society
line_text: Luke, we are so fucking in over our heads

title: The Society
line_text: They surround her like a surgical team.

title: The Society
line_text: You have to tilt her head back

title: The Society
line_text: Put your fingers over her nose

title: The Society
line_text: (sobbing as she does it)  I am doing the best I can!

title: The Society
line_text: That's not where you do it.

title: The Society
line_text: She tries to put her fingers on her neck.

title: The Society
line_text: You are moving her too much!

title: The Society
line_text: Luke puts his head to her chest.

title: The Society
line_text: And he starts to pound on her chest.

title: The Society
line_text: You can't do that while I am doing this!

title: The Society
line_text: YOU TOLD ME TO DO IT!

title: The Society
line_text: NOW I'M TELLING YOU NOT TO!!

title: The Society
line_text: He pushes on her chest again and again.

title: The Society
line_text: She looks up at Moose, who just stands and watches.

title: The Society
line_text: We need to decide if we are going to bury her here or take her home.

title: The Society
line_text: Everything else is out of our hands.

title: Under the Bridge
line_text: INT. KATE AND MICHAEL'S HOUSE. KITCHEN - CONTINUOUS

line_text: Dan follows him, refusing to be ignored.

title: Under the Bridge
line_text: I love how you still think you know my wife better than I do...

title: Under the Bridge
line_text: She had a panic attack yesterday.

title: Under the Bridge
line_text: But he refuses to let Dan see it.

title: Under the Bridge
line_text: I said get out of my house.

line_text: Did you ever stop to think that maybe I am trying to protect you?

line_text: Get your head out of your ass!

line_text: Dan steps closer, changing the tone.

title: The Station
line_text: Ted addresses the station (Mia, Larry, Stan, and others).

title: The Station
line_text: We have been commanded to give this country the President it needs.

title: The Station
line_text: For most of you, this will be your first election op.

title: The Station
line_text: Trust me, they are a helluva lot of fun.

title: The Station
line_text: We did a ton of these babies back in the 70s.

title: The Station
line_text: I remember one time we ended up on a cigarette boat, off Tierra del Fuego, with a dead Argentine opposition leader.

title: The Station
line_text: And Kenny Wheaton...you guys ever work with Kenny?

title: The Station
line_text: Anyways, he takes a can of kerosene and a fishing net and --

title: The Station
line_text: Ted notices the room is watching him blank faced.

title: The Station
line_text: Ask me about it over drinks.

title: The Station
line_text: A title fades up on a projection screen: OPERATION: FANTASTIC.

title: The Station
line_text: Are we putting on a musical?

title: The Station
line_text: Langley likes op names to reflect positivity and optimism.

title: The Station
line_text: I thought the agency didn't do stuff like that anymore.

title: The Station
line_text: I don't know that I am comfortable with --

title: The Station
line_text: Suddenly, Ted launches at Stan and yanks him from the chair.

title: The Station
line_text: Ted swings his hand down and grabs Stan's balls.

title: The Station
line_text: He releases Stan then turns to the group.

title: The Station
line_text: Let me be clear: Operation Fantastic demands iron balls.

title: The Station
line_text: We are going "old fashioned" on this one.

title: The Station
line_text: That might mean buying a few people's votes or it might mean yanking out a dissenter's tongue just to set an example.

title: The Station
line_text: outside your comfort zone or "not where you are at" get the hell out.

title: The Station
line_text: Three people start to get up.

title: The Station
line_text: Everyone sinks back in their seats.

title: The Station
line_text: We are all in this together.

title: The Station
line_text: He then notices an empty seat near the back.

title: The Station
line_text: We push in on Stan, with a slight smirk.

title: Fatrick
line_text: INT. YOUNG PATRICK'S FAMILY'S HOUSE - NIGHT - PAST

title: Fatrick
line_text: Young Patrick, Arlene, Leslie and Karen (band-aids all over her legs) are having dinner.

title: Fatrick
line_text: Patrick isn't eating, just pushing food around on his plate.

title: Fatrick
line_text: Patrick, why aren't you eating your carrots?

title: Fatrick
line_text: I am not talking to you, Leslie!

title: Fatrick
line_text: My legs are on fire from razor burn!

title: Fatrick
line_text: Girls, can someone please tell me why your brother isn't eating??

title: Fatrick
line_text: Barbara Wu started it and now everyone at school's doing it!!

title: Fatrick
line_text: Barbara Wu is a straight-up hooker.

title: Fatrick
line_text: Why did you name me Patrick?

title: Fatrick
line_text: Why didn't you name me Gordon?

title: Fatrick
line_text: I don't even like that name, but you can't make 'fat' out of Gordon!

title: Fatrick
line_text: This is exactly what I told you would happen.

title: Fatrick
line_text: This is why you don't go to Denny's and order the entire menu!

title: Fatrick
line_text: Leslie and Karen both look at Arlene.

title: Fatrick
line_text: Can someone say something positive, please?

title: Fatrick
line_text: I am looking forward to going sailing with Cynthia this weekend.

title: Fatrick
line_text: I bet she knows her way around a boat, like an old salt...

title: Fatrick
line_text: By the way, how nice is it to eat without your Dad's chewing?

title: Wild Things
line_text: Sam steps inside , looks at the shower stall-an indistinct shape moves there in the steam .

title: Wild Things
line_text: San watches , then jerks open the shower door .

title: Wild Things
line_text: The steam clears-REVEALING a tall , athletic body , and now the face-Ray Duquette , grinning at Sam out of the swirling steam .

title: Wild Things
line_text: I was n't expecting you 'til tomorrow .

title: Wild Things
line_text: Ray turns off the water , steps out of the stall , wrapping himself in a towel .

title: Wild Things
line_text: There 's a fresh , raised scar across one shoulder and Ray winces a little as he tucks the towel about his waist .

title: Wild Things
line_text: He looks at himself in the mirror , touching the scar .

title: Wild Things
line_text: The bitch shot me , is what happened .

title: Wild Things
line_text: Sam shakes his head , walks back into the bedroom .

title: Wild Things
line_text: Hey , what did you want me to do , die ?

title: Wild Things
line_text: Well , shit , you 're the cop , they do n't teach you to disarm people , shoot them in the leg or something ?

title: Wild Things
line_text: You were n't supposed to kill her for Christ 's sake .

title: Wild Things
line_text: Now Ray just looks at Sam , his eyes narrowing .

title: Wild Things
line_text: Did you become squeamish about these things before or after you bludgeoned little Suzie Toller to death with a wine bottle ?

title: Wild Things
line_text: It could n't have worked out better .

title: Wild Things
line_text: I ca n't talk 'em out of it .

title: Wild Things
line_text: This thing worked out just like you said , only better .

title: Wild Things
line_text: Kelly was supposed to be framed , not killed .

title: Wild Things
line_text: What I 'm telling you is , I do n't like surprises .

title: Wild Things
line_text: Ray walks to a dresser where a bottle of champagne sits in a bucket of ice .

title: Wild Things
line_text: He opens the bottle , fills two glasses .

title: Wild Things

line_text: It was the biggest commercial failure in the history of Miramax films .

title: Jay and Silent Bob Strike Back
line_text: The film was roundly drubbed as a bad idea by the denizens of the Internet chat boards , and over the course of the next year , while they waited for the Quick Stop restraining order to expire , Jay and Silent Bob tracked them all down and beat the shit out of them .

title: Made for Each Other (1939 film)
line_text: INT. LIVING ROOM-MASON APARTMENT-CLOSE SHOT-AT TEA TABLE

title: Made for Each Other (1939 film)
line_text: CAMERA is on Mrs. Mason , Johnny 's mother .

title: Made for Each Other (1939 film)
line_text: And after I got the cinder out of Jane 's eye we talked for a little while and then we took a little walk around the Common .

title: Made for Each Other (1939 film)
line_text: CAMERA MOVES BACK to take in Johnny and Jane .

title: Made for Each Other (1939 film)
line_text: Jane is sipping her tea with exaggerated casualness .

title: Made for Each Other (1939 film)
line_text: And-er-We walked for quite some time .

title: Made for Each Other (1939 film)
line_text: And then we went over to Thompson 's Spa for a bite-

title: Made for Each Other (1939 film)
line_text: Rather an unconventional meeting , was n't it ?

title: Made for Each Other (1939 film)
line_text: There seems nothing else to say .

title: Made for Each Other (1939 film)
line_text: Mrs. Mason starts so violently she spills some tea .

title: Made for Each Other (1939 film)
line_text: Oh , now Mother , wait a minute .

title: Made for Each Other (1939 film)
line_text: Are you visiting relatives here in New York , my dear ?

title: Made for Each Other (1939 film)
line_text: Why , yes , Mother , we thought that as long as we were engaged-

title: Made for Each Other (1939 film)
line_text: Oh , I know how upset you must be , Mrs. Mason .

title: Made for Each Other (1939 film)
line_text: You know so little about me-and it all happened so suddenly-

title: Made for Each Other (1939 film)
line_text: Well I should think it was sudden !

title: Made for Each Other (1939 film)
line_text: What did your family have to say about it ?

title: Made for Each Other (1939 film)
line_text: (there is implied criticism in the syllable .)

title: Made for Each Other (1939 film)
line_text: Did n't John say something about your taking a course in journalism ?

title: Made for Each Other (1939 film)
line_text: Yes , but I gave it up after I met Johnny .

title: Made for Each Other (1939 film)
line_text: Yes-I 'm sort of a post graduate course .

title: Made for Each Other (1939 film)
line_text: Oh-My dear , if you have a talent for writing-.

title: Made for Each Other (1939 film)
line_text: Take my advice and develop it while you 're young .

title: Made for Each Other (1939 film)
line_text: One needs all one 's time and energy for a career .

title: Made for Each Other (1939 film)
line_text: Do n't you think marriage is a career in itself ?

title: Made for Each Other (1939 film)
line_text: That 's why one must n't rush into it pell-mell .

title: Made for Each Other (1939 film)
line_text: Marriage is a business-a very serious business .

title: Made for Each Other (1939 film)
line_text: A partnership in the strictest sense of the word .

title: Made for Each Other (1939 film)
line_text: There are so many things to learn .

title: Made for Each Other (1939 film)
line_text: Well , Jane 'll learn all of those-after we 're married .

title: Made for Each Other (1939 film)
line_text: I hope and pray that that day will not come for many years !

title: Made for Each Other (1939 film)
line_text: Well , Mother-What do you mean-do you mean we should n't-

title: Made for Each Other (1939 film)
line_text: There 's no reason for Jane to develop into a little household drudge .

title: Made for Each Other (1939 film)
line_text: Oh , I hope you understand I have nothing against Jane .

title: Made for Each Other (1939 film)
line_text: In fact , I like her-I like her very much .

title: Made for Each Other (1939 film)
line_text: Well , I 'm glad you do , Mother , because .

title: Made for Each Other (1939 film)
line_text: You remember a little while ago you asked Jane whether she 'd come to New York to visit relatives ?

title: Made for Each Other (1939 film)
line_text: Well , as a matter of fact , she has come to New York to visit relatives .

title: Made for Each Other (1939 film)
line_text: She 's visiting some right now-you see-

title: Made for Each Other (1939 film)
line_text: He ca n't finish-looks desperately at Jane .

title: Made for Each Other (1939 film)
line_text: Mrs. Mason stares at them uncomprehensively for an instant .

title: Made for Each Other (1939 film)
line_text: Her mouth opens and her hands go convulsively to her chest .

title: Made for Each Other (1939 film)
line_text: Now , Mother-everybody gets married sooner or later-

title: Made for Each Other (1939 film)
line_text: She rushes over and starts to chafe Mrs. Mason 's wrists .

title: Made for Each Other (1939 film)
line_text: Mrs. Mason is gasping for breath like a fish out of water .

title: Made for Each Other (1939 film)
line_text: Johnny hovers over her , agonized and scared .

title: Made for Each Other (1939 film)
line_text: Mother , where are the smelling salts ?

title: Made for Each Other (1939 film)
line_text: Mrs. Mason gestures weakly in the direction of the bathroom .

title: Made for Each Other (1939 film)
line_text: Jane vigorously chafes Mrs. Mason 's wrists .

title: The 100
line_text: EXT. EARTH - THE ENDLESS WOODS - NIGHT

title: The 100
line_text: CLOSE ON CLARKE, asleep on the ground near the others when her eyes suddenly snap open and fill with wonder.

title: The 100
line_text: As she slowly sits up, WE WIDEN TO REVEAL HER SURROUNDINGS:

title: The 100
line_text: Incredibly, the trees and flowers and ground are streaked with iridescent light.

title: The 100
line_text: The effect is surreal and spectacular.

title: The 100
line_text: A forest that glows in the dark.

title: The 100
line_text: Appropriately agog, Clarke stands and moves amid the trees.

title: The 100
line_text: The sound of the RUNNING RIVER adds to the splendor.

title: The 100
line_text: Finally, her guard is down and we see the wide-eyed, inquisitive, passionate girl beneath the emotional armor.

title: The 100
line_text: For the first time, she lets herself feel the wonder of being on Earth.

title: The 100
line_text: Only it's unlike the Earth she spent so much time dreaming about.

title: The 100
line_text: Her eyes wander to the stars, her mind to the Ark (or heaven) and her mother (or father), when she hears a low voice:

title: The 100
line_text: Startled, she whirls, reverie replaced by embarrassment as she sees him returning through the psychedelic trees.

title: The 100
line_text: Takes her a moment to react to the fact that he's carrying a cone fastened out of large leaves and filled with water.

title: The 100
line_text: Figured it was worth losing a finger or two.

title: The 100
line_text: He moves the cone to her lips.

title: The 100
line_text: She drinks again, deeply this time, letting it run down her face and neck.

title: The 100
line_text: When she's done, she has to look away, vibrating from all of it, forcing herself to refocus on the glowing trees...

title: The 100
line_text: You think it means we are all gonna grow two heads?

title: The 100
line_text: She gives him a look, then picks a neon leaf.

title: The 100
line_text: Incredibly, it dims as if being unplugged.

title: The 100
line_text: Finn clearly likes this side of her.

title: The 100
line_text: I will have to run some tests, but, right now, my operating theory is that bioluminescence is an adaptation.

title: The 100
line_text: Sort of a twist on photosynthesis.

title: The 100
line_text: Plants using sunlight to turn bad air into good air.

title: The 100
line_text: Woke up that day in science class.

title: The 100
line_text: With that, he strides back through the trees.

title: The 100
line_text: She follows, trying to shake her hormonal response to this guy.

title: The 100
line_text: He stops in a particularly surreal spot, squatting to point out something on the ground.

title: The 100
line_text: WE SEE THEM AS SHE DOES:

title: The 100
line_text: Hard to tell, but they could be simian.

title: The 100
line_text: A widely separated big toe is clear in some of them.

title: The 100
line_text: Plus, near as I can tell, whatever it is, it's walking on two feet.

title: The 100
line_text: According to everything I have read, there were no bipedal animals anywhere near here, certainly not monkeys.

title: The 100
line_text: You read anything about glow-in-the-dark forests or man- eating snakes?

title: The 100
line_text: She meets his stare, sees his point: anything is possible.

title: The 100
line_text: We sense that a kiss is imminent, or at least if he tried, that she had let him.

title: The 100
line_text: Instead, he reaches back down, fitting his hand into one of the tracks.

title: The 100
line_text: He does this to prove his point, but all Clarke sees are the FRESH HACK MARKS on his wristband.

title: The 100
line_text: Were you trying to take that off again?

title: The 100
line_text: I was thinking about the Ark.

title: The 100
line_text: There may be a way to turn one of these things into a two-way communication device.

title: The 100
line_text: She looks at him, once again reminded of her father.

title: The 100
line_text: 'Course, I will have to run some tests, but --

title: The 100
line_text: She SMACKS him playfully, LAUGHING again beneath the magical trees.

title: Cashmere Mafia
line_text: Richard and Dylan are seated across from CLIVE HUGHES, late forties, a florid, energetic Australian.

title: Cashmere Mafia
line_text: The home office in Melbourne's called for one of you to be raised up to U.S. Group Publisher.

title: Cashmere Mafia
line_text: Well, the other would be made redundant.

title: Cashmere Mafia
line_text: Both of them tense, focused on Hughes.

title: Cashmere Mafia
line_text: I have vetted both of you 'til I was cross-eyed and I still can't decide.

title: Cashmere Mafia
line_text: So we are going to play "Survivor: East 38th Street".

title: Cashmere Mafia
line_text: You have got Peter Johnson from Daimler-Chrysler in town this week.

title: Cashmere Mafia
line_text: Whoever closes the biggest block of his ad buy, stays; the other one's off the island.

title: Cashmere Mafia
line_text: Dylan and Richard glance at one another; sure as hell didn't see this coming.

title: Sleepless in Seattle

line_text: But she STOPS DEAD WHEN SHE SEES : SUZY who we remember from eighteen months ago , appearing at the gate to the marina-waving , smiling a mile wide-beckoning Sam and Jonah home like a military wife whose boys have just come back from the front .

title: Sleepless in Seattle
line_text: Sam and Jonah are overjoyed to see her .

title: Sleepless in Seattle
line_text: Jonah breaks into a run , nearly leaping into Suzy 's waiting arms-as Sam brings up the rear , picking up Jonah 's sodas which he dropped when he started running .

title: Sleepless in Seattle

title: Sleepless in Seattle
line_text: The scene in front of her is too horrible to bear .

title: Sleepless in Seattle
line_text: ANNIE 'S POV-GATE TO MARINA , Sam catches up .

title: Sleepless in Seattle
line_text: Suzy-no less beautiful and vivacious than she was before-tousles Jonah 's hair , kisses Sam and hugs them both .

title: Sleepless in Seattle
line_text: God , it 's wonderful to see you .

title: Sleepless in Seattle
line_text: He 's over at the boat show .

title: Sleepless in Seattle
line_text: ANNIE , There is such apparent warmth , and joy , and love about this homecoming that she forget where she is-in the middle of the street .

title: Sleepless in Seattle
line_text: A car HORN blares at her .

title: Sleepless in Seattle
line_text: all she can do is stare at the nightmare that has unfolded .

title: Sleepless in Seattle
line_text: She starts to back away-and that 's when she sees-A TAXICAB coming right at her , horn BLARING , tires SQUEALING .

title: Sleepless in Seattle
line_text: Annie starts to jump to the other lane but there 's a van bearing down from the opposite direction .

title: Sleepless in Seattle
line_text: She steps back to the middle line .

title: Sleepless in Seattle
line_text: The cab goes into a skid .

title: Sleepless in Seattle
line_text: Sam heard the noise and turns to see what 's going on .

title: Sleepless in Seattle
line_text: The cab comes SCREECHING right at the CAMERA .

title: Legion (2010 film)
