title: Legion (2010 film)
line_text: BOB HANSEN (late 40 's) , owner and proprietor of this fine roadside establishment , attempts to fix the old TV hanging in the corner above the counter by banging the shit out it .

title: Legion (2010 film)
line_text: The restaurant itself has the kind of grungy diner charm you 'd hope to find in a place last renovated in 1963 .

title: Legion (2010 film)
line_text: An old plastic Christmas tree strung with flickering lights and tinsel occupies a lonely corner .

title: Legion (2010 film)
line_text: Next to that , a faded diorama of the NATIVITY SCENE .

title: Legion (2010 film)

line_text: He deftly rolls an ENGRAVED SILVER ZIPPO back and forth over the nicotine stained fingers of his right hand .

title: Legion (2010 film)
line_text: You can tell just by looking at the man that he 's a beer drinker .

title: Legion (2010 film)
line_text: Behind the counter , a black man named PERCY WALKER (60 's) is cooking up a storm on the grill with spectacular one-handed dexterity .

title: Legion (2010 film)
line_text: You do get pretty good at this sort of thing when your other hand has long been replaced by a METAL HOOK .

line_text: Lord as my witness , Bob , one of these days that thing 's gon na hit you back .

line_text: We got a special relationship here .

line_text: The JUKEBOX on the other side of the diner starts up with the MERLE HAGGARD tune I 'M A LONESOME FUGITIVE .

title: Legion (2010 film)
line_text: A stunning looking sixteen-year-old GIRL with dyed-black hair and a piercing or three , is leaning seductively over the jukebox , swaying gently to the music .

title: Legion (2010 film)
line_text: The headband doubling as her mini-skirt reveals her knock-out figure in a way that really does n't leave much up to the imagination .

title: Legion (2010 film)
line_text: Watching the scintillating action from a booth across the diner is a conservatively dressed SUBURBAN COUPLE .

title: Legion (2010 film)
line_text: Really , how can she go out in public wearing that ?

title: Legion (2010 film)
line_text: Why do n't we just ask her ?

title: Legion (2010 film)
line_text: Your mother was wondering if you got dressed this morning with the specific intention of showing your ass off to the entire world ?

line_text: Yeah , that 's cuz I woke up hoping to get double teamed by a couple of meth head truckers in the bathroom of some desert shithole .

title: Legion (2010 film)
line_text: And with that she turns back to the jukebox .

title: Legion (2010 film)
line_text: Percy watches the exchange discreetly from behind the counter .

title: Legion (2010 film)
line_text: Howard turns back to his wife .

title: Legion (2010 film)
line_text: I feel satisfied with that answer .

title: Legion (2010 film)
line_text: I 'm being punished for something , I know it .

line_text: Look at you, you are hot.

title: Chasing Life
line_text: Wait, which one of us is the therapist here?

title: Chasing Life
line_text: Sara glances down at the loose, brightly-colored fabric that swallows up her whole tiny frame.

title: Chasing Life
line_text: Mom, don't take this the wrong way but it looks like it belongs on a donkey.

title: Little in Common
line_text: Minnie, Raquel and Nicole, all garishly made-up and sporting multi-colored hair extensions, giggle around the breakfast table.

title: Little in Common
line_text: Ellie fills Raquel's orange juice, manages a strained cheerfulness.

title: Little in Common
line_text: Raquel, be sure to tell your mom those make-over kits were a really fun idea.

title: Little in Common
line_text: Dennis enters swinging his car keys.

title: Little in Common
line_text: We are off to baseball practice.

title: Little in Common
line_text: Ellie angles Dennis away from the girls, lowers her voice.

title: Little in Common
line_text: Are you sure about this, Dennis?

title: Little in Common
line_text: We are not in San Jose any more.

title: Little in Common
line_text: They are psychotic about this sports stuff.

title: Little in Common
line_text: Even cheerleaders' moms kill each other.

title: Little in Common
line_text: Donovan enters wearing his mom's WIDE-BRIMMED GARDENING HAT.

title: Little in Common
line_text: Couldn't find a baseball hat, but this should keep the sun out of my eyes.

title: Little in Common
line_text: Dennis takes the hat off Donovan's head.

title: Little in Common
line_text: We will stop at a sporting goods store.

title: Little in Common
line_text: Dennis puts his hand on Donovan's shoulder, steers him toward the back door.

title: Little in Common
line_text: As they pass by the table, Minnie throws a fake punch to Donovan's groin.

title: Little in Common
line_text: He makes a valid point, honey.

title: Little in Common
line_text: As Donovan and Dennis head out the door, Ellie picks up a plate of bacon from the stove, takes it over to the girls.

title: Little in Common
line_text: Sewer rats may taste like pumpkin pie, but I had never know, cuz I wouldn't eat the filthy--

title: Little in Common
line_text: You watched Pulp Fiction out your window last night.

title: Little in Common
line_text: Minnie watches movies all the time from her window.

title: Little in Common
line_text: Ellie goes to her window, looks out.

title: Little in Common
line_text: She can see the giant inflatable screen in the Pacheco yard.

title: Danni Lowinski
line_text: Danni sits in front of a MALE PARTNER (late 40's, conservative) who looks over her resume.

title: Danni Lowinski
line_text: She is dressed in a suit, but it's a little short and tight.

title: Danni Lowinski
line_text: And I followed that class action suit you filed against Petra Pharmaceuticals and --

title: Danni Lowinski
line_text: I am not seeing any professional experience here...

title: Danni Lowinski
line_text: See, I used to be a hairdresser.

title: Danni Lowinski
line_text: Went to law school at night for seven years.

title: Danni Lowinski
line_text: Not the direct route, I know, but it shows I know what I want...

title: Impulse
line_text: These two are awkward in each other's presence.

title: Impulse
line_text: Jenna part of the popular crowd; Henry the ultimate outsider.

title: Impulse
line_text: Crappy pop music plays on the radio.

title: Impulse
line_text: I will be out of your hair soon...

title: Impulse
line_text: We never stay in the same place more than six months.

title: Impulse
line_text: Well, your mom's already beating my dad's record, so... only a matter of time before it ends, right?

title: Impulse
line_text: Thank god, I can't take much more of this music.

title: Impulse
line_text: They pull into the school parking lot.

title: Impulse
line_text: See a SCHOOL BUS pass with SPRAY-PAINTED GRAFFITI ON THE SIDE, BIG AND ORANGE.

title: Impulse
line_text: Jenna's eyes flit from the bus to Henry, knows it's her handiwork.

title: Impulse
line_text: The wall between them goes right back up.

title: Goliath
line_text: INT. LAW FIRM, CONFERENCE ROOM - MORNING

title: Goliath
line_text: Also seated, LEIGH CHEN, forties, Head of Human Resources, and GAVIN LISTER, fiftyish, Head of Security.

title: Goliath
line_text: Julie enters with Lucy; a deer in the headlights -- she immediately knows something's up.

title: Goliath
line_text: Cooper shoots her his version of a smile.

title: Goliath
line_text: Lucy looks to Julie; Julie is just staring at the floor.

title: Goliath
line_text: Cooper takes a sip of water.

title: Goliath
line_text: He enjoys seeing his prey squirm.

title: Goliath
line_text: But Lucy just stares him right in the eye.

title: Goliath
line_text: I am afraid it's not working out, Ms. Kittridge.

title: Goliath
line_text: By now, you know your key-pass has been de-activated.

title: Goliath
line_text: Your cell phone will be disconnected within--

title: Goliath
line_text: Now, were I to explain -- I won't -- I might say you were being discharged for violating your duty of loyalty and confidentiality to a firm client.

title: Goliath
line_text: For self-dealing and deception in order to secure outside compensation.

title: Goliath
line_text: For theft of proprietary information relating to the economic interests of the firm, disclosing privileged information --

title: Goliath
line_text: What the hell do you mean, self- dealing?

title: Goliath
line_text: You shopped a case against our own client to another lawyer.

title: Goliath
line_text: You had prefer I lay it off on your fucking too many junior partners in corporate?

title: Goliath
line_text: The firm takes credit cards or cash.

title: Goliath
line_text: It was the firm's money; money you spent on personal items, student loans, clothing, your car lease --

title: Goliath
line_text: The student loan payments and car was part of my signing bonus.

title: Goliath
line_text: To be paid back by you upon termination for cause.

title: Goliath
line_text: (hands Lucy an envelope) Notice of cancellation of health benefits, insurance, club memberships, and mortgage payments.

title: Goliath
line_text: You are calling in my home loan?

title: Goliath
line_text: Seems we also co-signed your mortgage.

title: The Salton Sea
line_text: Tanner and Garcetti ensconced in an alley diagonally across the street .

title: The Salton Sea
line_text: Garcetti pointing a LONG-RANGE PARABOLIC MICROPHONE at the burned out building .

title: The Salton Sea
line_text: He and Tanner wear earpieces , which are attached to the mike .

title: The Salton Sea
line_text: I guess I do n't have a hell of a lot of choice .

title: The Salton Sea
line_text: You 're in a very tenuous position on the food chain , hoss .

title: The Salton Sea
line_text: Garcetti removes his earpiece and turns to Tanner .

title: The Salton Sea
line_text: This could be the one we 're looking for .

title: A Gifted Man
line_text: EXT. HALSTEAD NEUROSURGICAL CENTER - PARKING LOT - DUSK

title: A Gifted Man
line_text: Michael, in scrubs, on a bench outside, stewing.

title: A Gifted Man
line_text: Rita comes out with a file, searching.

title: A Gifted Man
line_text: You didn't sign the surgical report.

title: A Gifted Man
line_text: No wonder you look so pleased.

title: A Gifted Man
line_text: She takes back the file and pen.

title: A Gifted Man
line_text: Luckily, I have a feeling there's a gift basket coming to cheer you up.

title: A Gifted Man
line_text: Michael hangs his head in his hands, hating himself.

title: A Gifted Man
line_text: She stops in front of him.

title: A Gifted Man
line_text: Doing the right thing for the wrong reason -- is it still virtuous?

title: A Gifted Man
line_text: There are people around (GARDENER, PARKING LOT ATTENDANT), so he doesn't respond.

title: A Gifted Man
line_text: You operated on the boy to get out of visiting your dying friend.

title: A Gifted Man
line_text: And I am sure you did a very good job.

title: A Gifted Man
line_text: I used to think it was strange, how uncomfortable you were with death.

title: A Gifted Man
line_text: Then I realized -- you like to believe you know everything and can fix anything.

title: A Gifted Man
line_text: But it won't be as hard as avoiding it.

title: A Gifted Man
line_text: I will go with you if you want.

title: The First
line_text: INT. VISTA HQ - BUILD FACILITY - DAY

title: The First
line_text: Lauren escorts Hagerty toward the large booster rocket, where Winthrop and Sayers are waiting with a photographer.

title: The First
line_text: Winthrop lights up at seeing Hagerty.

title: The First
line_text: Not everyday I shake hands with a man who's been to the moon.

title: The First
line_text: Just wish my son could be here with me.

title: The First
line_text: But if you want to study space, you make sacrifices.

title: The First
line_text: I had like to take a picture, if you don't mind - to send to him.

title: The First
line_text: As Hagerty and Winthrop walk toward the rocket--

title: The First
line_text: Maggie tells me I opened my trap too soon about you coming on.

title: The First
line_text: Well, sure as heck hope you say yes.

title: The First
line_text: I don't want to allocate all this money to build a ship that doesn't have the best skipper.

title: The First
line_text: Winthrop throws his arm around Hagerty with a big, toothy smile.

title: The First
line_text: So tell me - what was it like?

title: The First
line_text: The first time you set foot on the moon?

title: The First
line_text: What was your very first thought?

title: The First
line_text: If NASA spent its money right.

title: The First
line_text: I think what the Colonel is trying to say is--

title: The First
line_text: It's refreshing to hear the truth.

title: Pan Am
line_text: ...But you must be able to improvise, and use discretion at all times.

title: Pan Am
line_text: Make no mistake, we call it a Cold War for a reason.

title: Pan Am
line_text: Kate attempts to stay cool during this surreal moment.

title: Pan Am
line_text: Kate nods, spots Anderson's hat on the entry table and, on habit, picks it up for him -- then stops... a realization, a shiver.

title: The Jacket
line_text: STARKS can hardly keep his eyes off her when her CELL PHONE suddenly rings .

title: The Jacket
line_text: I was just thinking about you , too .

title: The Jacket
line_text: STARKS listens nervously to her conversation and the affection in her voice .

title: The Jacket
line_text: Listen , I got ta go , mom , 'cause I 'm late .

title: The Jacket
line_text: Happy New Year to you , too .

title: The Jacket
line_text: JACKIE hangs up and looks at Starks-feeling a little awkward after the call .

title: The Jacket
line_text: STARKS smiles back warmly at her ; he gets it more than she knows .

title: The Cape
line_text: EXT. ROOF - WAREHOUSE - PALM CITY - DAY

title: The Cape
line_text: THE CAPE and CHESS exchange blows on the warehouse roof.

title: The Cape
line_text: The Cape lifts Chess's body into the air with brutal KICKS to the ribs.

title: The Cape
line_text: He BACKHANDS Chess who topples onto the ground again.

title: The Cape
line_text: The chopper continues to HOVER overhead.

title: The Cape
line_text: A CONE OF FIRE rips a piece of the roof away.

title: The Cape
line_text: Another EXPLOSION spews debris into the air.

title: The Cape
line_text: I will find out who you are!

title: The Cape
line_text: I will find out who you are and kill everything you love!

title: The Cape
line_text: Another ERUPTION disintegrates most of the roof.

title: The Cape
line_text: The Cape has no choice, he backs away from Chess, throws his cloak around himself and VANISHES in a burst of smoke.

title: The Cape
line_text: WIDE AS: The warehouse PLUMES in a crescendo of flames.

title: The Cape
line_text: ...CHESS - his body smoking - clinging desperately to the rope ladder of the chopper as it swerves away into the sky.

title: Awakening
line_text: The Doctor has opened her blinds to let the morning in, but he only effect is to throw zebra patterns on her spooky walls, and the sunlight is no less unnerving than the darkness.

title: Awakening
line_text: To flee with your human friend?

title: Awakening
line_text: But we are obviously different, as well.

title: Awakening
line_text: You live as though you were only human.

title: Awakening
line_text: I will take a week off now and go to London with Matt, then come back here to wind up my cases.

title: Awakening
line_text: After that, I will be free.

title: Awakening
line_text: I will be with the man I love.

title: Awakening
line_text: Look, you can't blame me for wanting to get away from this.

title: Awakening
line_text: I don't blame anyone for anything.

title: Awakening
line_text: You are in denial about that.

title: Awakening
line_text: Go to London with this man who doesn't even know who you really are.

title: Awakening
line_text: With our people in such danger.

title: Awakening
line_text: I want to hear it from you.

title: Awakening
line_text: Some of us are hunting... and feeding.

title: Awakening
line_text: And it always leads to slaughter.

title: Awakening
line_text: You are thinking of your sister.

title: Awakening
line_text: She wouldn't give me a second thought.

title: Awakening
line_text: Whether she does or not, you have the same problem.

title: Awakening
line_text: And so you must not leave now.

title: Awakening
line_text: Because it might not be too late.

title: Awakening
line_text: If enough of us resist, this Awakening could die out.

title: Awakening
line_text: But if you turn your back on the struggle, you will never be the same.

title: Awakening
line_text: And off the CLOSE shot on her face, we HEAR...

title: The Gates
line_text: Coming out of a huddle, Brett lines up in the middle- linebacker position.

title: The Gates
line_text: Quarterback, RILEY, takes position, eyes Brett.

title: The Gates
line_text: Your girl hookin' up with the new guy?

title: The Gates
line_text: Brett turns, sees Andie standing close to Charlie, talking, laughing...

title: The Gates
line_text: She wants him for Mock Trial.

title: The Gates
line_text: Riley gives Brett and mocking wink -- and that does it.

title: The Gates
line_text: With the hike, Brett charges through the line, his breath growing more coarse and guttural with each step.

title: The Gates
line_text: Riley fakes the hand-off, drops back when out of nowhere, Brett SLAMS INTO HIM with an animalistic growl, knocking him several yards through the air.

title: The Gates
line_text: HEARING the HIT, Charlie and Andie turn and watch as COACHES

title: The Gates
line_text: and PLAYERS run to Riley's side.

title: The Gates
line_text: BACK ON BRETT -- who turns away, trying to gather himself as COACH approaches from behind.

title: The Gates
line_text: When Brett fails to turn, Coach grabs him by the helmet, spins him around to reveal his RIGHT EYE now has the PIERCING YELLOWISH COLOR of a WOLF.

title: The Gates
line_text: Then, much to our surprise, pulls him closer, whispers sternly --

title: The Gates
line_text: Brett quickly lowers his head, self-conscious.

title: The Gates
line_text: Coach pushes him off the field, and as he backs away, Brett throws a sideways glance back toward Andie and Charlie.

title: The Gates
line_text: ON ANDIE and CHARLIE -- stunned and confused...

title: The Gates
line_text: She turns to see her dad VINCENT, (40), handsome, but certainly not the "exotic" half of Andie.

title: The Gates
line_text: Come on, Andie, we are late.

title: The Gates
line_text: And as Andie heads off to the car --

title: Michaelangelo
line_text: The lover's virtue I prize most is ...

title: Michaelangelo
line_text: And the vice you had most willingly forgive?

title: Michaelangelo
line_text: The virtue I prize is Innocence.

title: Michaelangelo
line_text: Under the table, his hand touches Enrico's thigh.

title: Michaelangelo
line_text: And the vice you had forgive?

title: Michaelangelo
line_text: Enrico stares at the floor, SHOCKED, then painfully embarrassed.

title: Michaelangelo
line_text: Through the window, we see Salai wrapped in a cloak, pacing up and down to keep warm.

title: Michaelangelo
line_text: Now Stone Cutter, the hour grows late.

title: Michaelangelo
line_text: Have you given your father the happy news?

title: Hellbound: Hellraiser II
line_text: KIRSTY moves three or four steps into the room and then stops dead .

title: Hellbound: Hellraiser II
line_text: The door swings shut behind her .

title: Hellbound: Hellraiser II
line_text: KIRSTY 's eyes flick left and right , taking in the sickening details of the room 's contents , and then stare straight ahead , focusing on the figure in white which is turning around to face her .

title: Hellbound: Hellraiser II
line_text: JULIA completes her turn and looks at KIRSTY completely impassively for a moment .

title: Hellbound: Hellraiser II
line_text: Then her mouth opens up into a smile of welcome-but there is nothing but hate in her eyes .

title: Hellbound: Hellraiser II
line_text: How nice of you to drop in .

title: Hellbound: Hellraiser II
line_text: JULIA glances meaningfully at the dead thing that lies beside her feet and then back at KIRSTY .

title: Hellbound: Hellraiser II
line_text: You have surprisingly good taste in men .

title: Hellbound: Hellraiser II
line_text: KIRSTY 's fear and disgust are momentarily displaced by a furious rage as she realises what JULIA has done .

title: Hellbound: Hellraiser II
line_text: Her face erupts into anger and she screams out .

title: Hellbound: Hellraiser II
line_text: She flings herself across the room at JULIA even as she speaks .

title: Hellbound: Hellraiser II
line_text: JULIA is completely unphased by this attack and simply raises one arm .

title: Hellbound: Hellraiser II
line_text: She siezes the wrist of the arm that KIRSTY has raised into a clenched fist and effortlessly throws KIRSTY bodily back across the room .

title: Hellbound: Hellraiser II
line_text: We realise for the first time the immense physical strength that JULIA now possesses .

title: Hellbound: Hellraiser II
line_text: KIRSTY smashes into the door and falls to a sitting position against it .

title: Hellbound: Hellraiser II
line_text: She is shaken and slightly hurt enough not to get to her feet immediately but she stares at JULIA with undimmed hatred .

title: Hellbound: Hellraiser II
line_text: JULIA throws a look halfway between a smile and a sneer .

title: Hellbound: Hellraiser II
line_text: Oh , you can try it , you little bitch .

title: Hellbound: Hellraiser II
line_text: I 'd love you to try it .

title: Hellbound: Hellraiser II
line_text: But I 'm not just the woman I was .

title: Hellbound: Hellraiser II
line_text: What , you mean you 're something more than a whore with a vicious streak ?

title: Hellbound: Hellraiser II
line_text: I mean I 'm something more than human , you little shit !

title: Hellbound: Hellraiser II
line_text: JULIA snaps this first line but then holds her anger in check .

title: Hellbound: Hellraiser II
line_text: She shakes her head and an amused smile plays across her lips .

title: Hellbound: Hellraiser II
line_text: They did n't tell you , did they ?

title: Hellbound: Hellraiser II
line_text: I 'm afraid they 've changed the rules of the fairy tale ; I 'm no longer just the wicked step-mother .

title: Hellbound: Hellraiser II
line_text: The smile disappears and she delivers the next line with an utterly straight face .

title: Hellbound: Hellraiser II
line_text: It is , after all , the truth .

title: Hellbound: Hellraiser II
line_text: The hatred and the heat returns to her voice .

title: Hellbound: Hellraiser II
line_text: So come on ; Take your best shot , Snow White .

title: Hellbound: Hellraiser II
line_text: KIRSTY scrambles to her feet and again charges at JULIA .

title: Hellbound: Hellraiser II
line_text: JULIA steps forward to meet her advance and delivers a single back-handed swipe across KIRSTY 's face with such force that not only is the girl knocked off her feet but is actually knocked unconscious .

title: Hellbound: Hellraiser II
line_text: KIRSTY rolls onto her back and lies at JULIA 's feet .

title: Hellbound: Hellraiser II
line_text: JULIA stares down at the unconscious body .

title: Hellbound: Hellraiser II
line_text: When it was awake , it was KIRSTY and her attitude to it was based on personal enmity .

title: Hellbound: Hellraiser II
line_text: Now , it is simply another body and she judges it differently ; it is firm , full , healthy , and young .

title: Hellbound: Hellraiser II
line_text: We see the expression on her face change from hatred and triumph to pure appetite .

title: Hellbound: Hellraiser II
line_text: She licks her lips and her eyes glisten .

title: Hellbound: Hellraiser II
line_text: She begins to bend slightly towards it .

title: Hellbound: Hellraiser II
line_text: The door to the room opens .

title: Hellbound: Hellraiser II
line_text: JULIA straightens up and looks as MALAHIDE stands in the doorway .

title: Hellbound: Hellraiser II
line_text: A second later , and it is explained .

title: Hellbound: Hellraiser II
line_text: He leads TIFFANY into the room .

title: Conan the Barbarian (2011 film)
line_text: Carved out of solid black rock , both sides of the broad corridor are occasionally punctuated by thick steel doors , leading to prison cells .

title: Conan the Barbarian (2011 film)
line_text: Conan and Tamara emerge from a sewer drain , pushing their way to the floor of the hallway .

title: Conan the Barbarian (2011 film)
line_text: The heavy darkness presses in on Conan 's torch like a sentient , animate thing .

title: Conan the Barbarian (2011 film)
line_text: The floor of the corridor is lined with DEAD BODIES , in varying states of decay .

title: Conan the Barbarian (2011 film)
line_text: There are buckets , filled with entrails and feces , upended .

title: Conan the Barbarian (2011 film)
line_text: Tamara put her hand over her mouth .

title: Conan the Barbarian (2011 film)
line_text: He and Tamara begin to hear the sound of EERIE CHANTING .

title: Conan the Barbarian (2011 film)
line_text: Up ahead , the torch-lined dungeon plunges into darkness as the torches end .

title: Conan the Barbarian (2011 film)
line_text: Conan holds up his own torch , struggling to peer into the black void .

title: Conan the Barbarian (2011 film)
line_text: Conan takes a step forward when suddenly a POWERFUL WIND blows out his torch .

title: Conan the Barbarian (2011 film)
line_text: A moment later , there 's the sound of A GATE WHISTLING DOWN AND CRASHING INTO THE GROUND .

title: Conan the Barbarian (2011 film)
line_text: In the darkness , comes a DEEP , EARTHY CHUCKLE .

title: Conan the Barbarian (2011 film)
line_text: A HOST OF OIL LIGHTS SUDDENLY COME UP , revealing that the gate that closed behind them was actually just a door to a vast CAGE built around a massive PIT .

title: Cocaine Cowboys
line_text: Then turns back to EVERETT FREED, a twenty-year friend and colleague.

title: Cocaine Cowboys
line_text: It might take another world war to bring this city back from the dead.

title: Cocaine Cowboys
line_text: But let me ask you, Everett.

title: Cocaine Cowboys
line_text: Remember that PI you used to tail Becky?

title: Cocaine Cowboys
line_text: Cookie's turned out to be a slut like every other woman?

title: Cocaine Cowboys
line_text: I am asking cause of Bobby.

title: Cocaine Cowboys
line_text: He's cheating on my daughter, so I may have to kill him.

title: Cocaine Cowboys
line_text: But it's the money I can't figure out.

title: Cocaine Cowboys
line_text: His mother's a pathological spender and he covers her debts.

title: Cocaine Cowboys
line_text: We bought him and LuAnne the house, but he picks up private school tuition for Allie.

title: Cocaine Cowboys
line_text: Now I know what I pay the boy...

title: Cocaine Cowboys
line_text: Maybe he's not a good candidate for us after all.

title: Cocaine Cowboys
line_text: And he's the closest I have to a son, so I want him around.

title: Cocaine Cowboys
line_text: But we were vetted before we joined.

title: Cocaine Cowboys
line_text: Why not look in his underwear drawer a little?

title: Cocaine Cowboys
line_text: I will call you with the guy's name.

title: Cocaine Cowboys
line_text: Addresses the group in his commanding VOICE.

title: Cocaine Cowboys
line_text: If we could all gather for a minute...

title: Cocaine Cowboys
line_text: Corwin GESTURES Bobby to stand beside him.

title: Cocaine Cowboys
line_text: Drapes his arm on his shoulder.

title: Cocaine Cowboys
line_text: I am sure you already know why I hosted this gathering today...

title: Cocaine Cowboys
line_text: I wanted you all to finally meet my son- in-law, Robert Nickel.

title: Cocaine Cowboys
line_text: Everyone that knows him calls him 'Bobby.'

title: Cocaine Cowboys
line_text: So now he's both Bobby to all of you and... with your blessing... our newest candidate for membership.

title: Cocaine Cowboys
line_text: You get in with a hundred-percent vote, son, so start kissing ass.

title: Cocaine Cowboys
line_text: He STARES at the room of white, middle-aged faces completely unaware of the cultural earthquake headed their way.

title: Cocaine Cowboys
line_text: well, you have no idea what this means to me.

title: Limetown
line_text: Ron pulls back the flap to reveal a TEAM of men and women standing around discussing a schematic of the Limetown complex.

title: Limetown
line_text: Everyone has a coffee in hand.

title: Limetown
line_text: Ron moves to the schematic, setting down his mug.

title: Limetown
line_text: Ah folks, this is my partner, Sadia Latifi.

title: Limetown
line_text: Ron twirls his hand for her to take over...

title: Limetown
line_text: There are 24 of them stationed at outposts every 20 yards surrounding the facility, with a cluster of 6 at front gate.

title: Limetown
line_text: They are armed with Barrett .50 caliber rifles.

title: Limetown
line_text: They have refused any attempt at communication.

title: Limetown
line_text: We don't know yet if this is a hostage situation, but we have to treat as such.

title: Limetown
line_text: There are over 300 people inside that complex, including children.

title: Limetown
line_text: And listen, ifand I do mean ifwe need to go tactical, we will.

title: Limetown
line_text: But we are certainly not barging in on day three.

title: Limetown
line_text: We are not losing a single person on either side here, folks.

title: Limetown
line_text: A young officer, MARTY, rips open the tent flap.

title: Limetown
line_text: Ron takes a moment to process this before stepping outside.

title: Ghostbusters II
line_text: Dana is explaining the buggy incident to EGON SPENGLER , the soberly intellectual techno-wizard and former Ghostbuster , as he conducts an experiment assisted by a research team of graduate students , all of whom are Japanese , Chinese , or Korean .

title: Ghostbusters II
line_text: The device he is testing is a black box about the size of a Sony Watchman with both digital and graphic displays .

title: Ghostbusters II
line_text: ... and then the buggy just suddenly stopped dead in the middle of the street

title: Ghostbusters II
line_text: Did anyone else see this happen ?

title: Ghostbusters II
line_text: Believe me , I did n't imagine this .

title: Ghostbusters II
line_text: In science we always look for the simplest explanation .

title: Ghostbusters II
line_text: We 'll start with the negative calibration .

title: Ghostbusters II
line_text: He picks up the device and prepares to test it .

title: Ghostbusters II
line_text: What are you working on , Egon ?

title: Ghostbusters II
line_text: I 'm trying to determine whether human emotional states have a measurable effect on the psychomagnetheric energy field .

title: Ghostbusters II
line_text: It 's a theory Ray and I were working on when we had to dissolve Ghostbusters .

title: Ghostbusters II
line_text: An assistant draws a curtain revealing a large picture window , actually a two-way mirror , that looks into a small waiting room .

title: Ghostbusters II
line_text: Inside the waiting room they can see but not hear a youngish couple having a heated arguement .

title: Ghostbusters II
line_text: They think they 're here for marriage counseling .

title: Ghostbusters II
line_text: We 've kept them waiting for two hours and we 've been gradually increasing the temperature in the room .

title: Ghostbusters II
line_text: It 's up to 95 degrees at the moment .

title: Ghostbusters II
line_text: Now my assistant is going to enter and ask them if they 'd mind waiting another half-hour .

title: Ghostbusters II
line_text: As Spengler , Dana , and the research team watch , the assistant enters the waiting room and tells the couple about the new delay .

title: Ghostbusters II
line_text: They explode with anger both at him and each other while Spengler monitors them through the glass .

title: Ghostbusters II
line_text: After recording his readings , he returns to his Assistant .

title: Ghostbusters II
line_text: We 'll do the happiness index next .

title: Ghostbusters II
line_text: I 'd like to bring Ray in on your case , if it 's all right with you .

title: Ghostbusters II
line_text: Okay , whatever you think-but not Venkman .

title: Ghostbusters II
line_text: I think he was borderline for a while there .

title: Ghostbusters II
line_text: They move to another two-way mirror through which they can see a lovely little girl playing with a wonderful array of toys .

title: Ghostbusters II
line_text: Well , we did n't part on very good terms and we sort of lost track of each other when I got married .

title: Ghostbusters II
line_text: We 're ready for the affection test .

title: Ghostbusters II
line_text: I thought of calling him after my marriage ended , but-.

title: Ghostbusters II
line_text: Anyway , I appreciate you 're doing this , Egon

title: Ghostbusters II
line_text: They watch as another assistant enters the playroom with an adorable Cocker Spaniel puppy and gives it to the little girl .

title: Ghostbusters II
line_text: Spengler monitors her as she jumps for joy and hugs the little dog .

title: Ghostbusters II
line_text: This is my address and telephone number .

title: Ghostbusters II
line_text: Egon , I 'd rather you did n't mention any of this to Peter if you do n't mind .

title: Ghostbusters II
line_text: She shakes his hand and exits .

title: Ghostbusters II
line_text: Now let 's see how she reacts when we take away the puppy

title: For Justice
line_text: INT. CONFERENCE ROOM, RANDALL CITY HALL - DAY

title: For Justice
line_text: From the hallway, Nat sees Brandon and Lewis huddling - obviously not seeing eye to eye.

title: For Justice
line_text: Nat goes in, gets a refill on her coffee as -

title: For Justice
line_text: The other night, I saw how you tried to keep things from blowing up.

title: For Justice
line_text: You get that from your dad or your mom?

title: For Justice
line_text: People who know me know I don't play that game.

title: For Justice
line_text: Now you are talking about my work?

title: For Justice
line_text: Let me tell you what I do, what my colleagues do.

title: For Justice
line_text: You know how they say the arc of the moral universe is long, but it bends toward justice?

title: For Justice
line_text: Our job is to make sure it keeps bending.

title: For Justice
line_text: When you become a lawyer, it will be your job too.

title: For Justice
line_text: A law degree doesn't seem that important anymore.

title: For Justice
line_text: I am sorry to hear that.

title: For Justice
line_text: I lost my father when I was little.

title: For Justice
line_text: Different circumstances but a loss is a loss.

title: For Justice
line_text: You just can't make your whole life be about that anger.

title: For Justice
line_text: You have skills, Brandon, and those skills come with responsibilities.

title: For Justice
line_text: She gives him a moment, then takes her cup of coffee and leaves.

title: The Divide
line_text: INT. ADAM POWELL D.A. OFFICE - ONE WEEK LATER - AFTERNOON.

title: The Divide
line_text: Adam is working at his desk when Sonia pops in, urgently:

title: The Divide
line_text: She turns on his LCD Monitor to: JENNY BUTLER GIVING A PRESS

title: The Divide
line_text: The only eye witness to the Butler murders of 2001 has called a press conference.

title: The Divide
line_text: She alleges that convicted murderer Jared Bankowski's DNA is being re- tested for political party gain.

title: The Divide
line_text: Jenny is standing next to her lawyer, reading a statement.

title: The Divide
line_text: ...I lived in a nightmare since my father, my mother and my sister were taken from me...

title: Black-ish
line_text: INT. RELEVANT ADVERTISING - CONFERENCE ROOM - CONTINUOUS

title: Black-ish
line_text: DRE'S SMILING FACE, still daydreaming as Mr. Stevenson stands.

title: Black-ish
line_text: Alright guys, I am sure all of you have heard that I have an announcement.

title: Black-ish
line_text: No idea what it could be.

title: Black-ish
line_text: Myself along with the board have decided to up a new VP in the company.

title: Black-ish
line_text: Dre STANDS and starts a SOLO SLOW-CLAP.

title: Black-ish
line_text: Off Mr. Stevenson's GLARE, he sits.

title: Black-ish
line_text: Relevant's one of the fastest growing advertising companies in the world.

title: Black-ish
line_text: But the world's demos are changing and we want to be the leader of that change...

title: Black-ish
line_text: As Mr. Stevenson continues to talk, Dre eagerly, yet subtly, begins to GATHER HIS THINGS, STAND, and WALK from the "US" side of the table to the "THEM" side of the table.

title: Black-ish
line_text: Dre is now on the "THEM" side of the table, attempting to squeeze into an EMPTY CHAIR next to Josh.

title: Black-ish
line_text: If I could just squeeze in there--

title: Black-ish
line_text: And that's why, without any further ado, I had like everyone to give a warm congrats, to the VP of our new Urban Division, Andre Johnson!

title: Black-ish
line_text: Off this announcement Dre is STOPPED IN HIS TRACKS.

title: Black-ish
line_text: On Dre's shocked and confused face, we GO TO,

title: Chambers
line_text: EXT. COTTONWOOD HIGH SCHOOL - BLEACHERS - DAY

title: Chambers
line_text: Below the bleachers, TJ laces his shoes and takes off his shirt.

title: Chambers
line_text: Sasha approaches from behind through an overgrown field that's disguised as a track.

title: Chambers
line_text: She can't help but stare  her boy looks good.

title: Chambers
line_text: She puts her arms around him from behind, but spooks him, causing him to knock back into her

title: Chambers
line_text: Sorry, I just  you scared me.

title: Chambers
line_text: Sasha moves to kiss him when a nearby KID lights up a cigarette and TJ pulls back--

title: Chambers
line_text: My girl just had heart surgery.

title: Chambers
line_text: The Smoking Kid gives them an odd glance and starts to walk away, but Sasha stops him.

title: Chambers
line_text: She snatches the cigarette out of his mouth, takes a deep dramatic drag, and sensually exhales.

title: Chambers
line_text: The Smoking Kid grabs his cig back and exits.

title: Chambers
line_text: A little smoke isn't going to break my heart.

title: Chambers
line_text: And neither is you actually touching me again.

title: Chambers

title: Stay
line_text: The Brenners spill into the lobby -- the door closes behind them, shutting out the storm.

title: Stay
line_text: They are met with the eyes of two dozen other miserable people -- wrapped in winter clothing -- also escaping the storm.

title: Stay
line_text: We get the sense that none of these people are here by choice.

title: Stay
line_text: But were forced here like the Brenners.

title: Stay
line_text: An awkward moment as the crowd silently eyes the newcomers -- and then, just like that, they go back to minding their own business.

title: Stay
line_text: A Victorian era masterpiece -- a place that time forgot.

title: Stay
line_text: What do you mean they are not working?

title: Stay
line_text: Luke's attention shifts to a Hitchcock blonde at the counter, this is EVA DANIELS, 30s, and right now she's arguing with the concierge behind the front desk.

title: Stay
line_text: Storm must have knocked the lines down.

title: Stay
line_text: Eva walks away -- checks her cell phone for service -- runs a hand through her hair -- she's all nerves.

title: Stay
line_text: In her other hand we notice a tattered briefcase.

title: Stay
line_text: Doesn't fit her Saks and Barneys attire.

title: Stay
line_text: Whatever's inside is important to her.

title: Stay
line_text: He signs back, speaking as he does:

title: Stay
line_text: Ellie stares at a bathroom across the room.

title: Stay
line_text: She takes Ellie's hand and leads her across the room.

title: Stay
line_text: Luke makes his way to the front desk.

title: Stay
line_text: You guys have a restaurant in here?

title: Stay
line_text: We are working on getting the kitchen up and running.

title: Stay
line_text: Mason points toward the far end of the lobby.

title: Stay
line_text: Luke follows his crooked finger -- clocks the location of the kitchen and dining area.

title: Stay
line_text: Looks like you have your hands full.

title: Stay
line_text: Hell of a storm out there.

title: Stay
line_text: Mason just stares at Luke -- an uncomfortable stare.

title: Stay
line_text: We have plenty of rooms available.

title: Stay
line_text: Oh, thanks, but we aren't staying.

title: Stay
line_text: Luke drums his fingers on the counter and moves away.

title: Stay
line_text: He studies the faces of the others:

title: Stay
line_text: Two DETECTIVE looking types -- maybe U.S. Marshals -- guard a disheveled, handcuffed man -- their PRISONER.

title: Stay
line_text: Three TATTED-UP ROCKERS, two guys and a girl, sit with their instruments -- everything about them screams low-rent band that never made it.

title: Stay
line_text: The meek BUS DRIVER plays with a Zippo.

title: Stay
line_text: Brushes the greasy hair out of his face.

title: Stay
line_text: A YOUNG BOY sits alone holding a backpack.

title: Stay
line_text: His blue eyes watch the others in the lobby.

title: Stay
line_text: We can't help but feel for him.

title: Stay
line_text: Luke's eyes fall upon a serious looking man, FRANK HESS, and his teenage son, JAKE, who looks like the apple fell far from the tree and rolled into a Muse concert.

title: Stay
line_text: JAKE holds a Canon 5D, scanning through some videos.

title: Stay
line_text: These are just a few of the people waiting in the lobby.

title: Stay
line_text: We will get to know them all later.

title: The Losers (film)
line_text: The Corvette , pulling behind the still lowered REAR RAMP of the TRANSPORT PLANE !

title: The Losers (film)
line_text: Got ta admit , I always wondered how this would play out .

title: The Losers (film)
line_text: You do n't have a knife ?

title: The Losers (film)
line_text: Bit of as longshot for you .

title: The Losers (film)
line_text: But Clay does have a knife .

title: The Losers (film)
line_text: He PULLS IT and SLAMS IT into Roque 's belly !

title: The Losers (film)
line_text: For most men , that would be the end of the fight .

title: The Losers (film)
line_text: Roque gives Clay a bloody grin .

title: The Losers (film)
line_text: Now I really am gon na cut your head off .

title: The Losers (film)
line_text: And now it is FULLY ON .

title: The Losers (film)
line_text: The blades whip up and down-almost too fast to see Roque gets Clay with a left cross , then buries his knife in Clay 's shoulder .

title: The Losers (film)
line_text: Clay twists free , slashes at Roque .

title: The Losers (film)
line_text: Ten seconds in , the men separate again .

title: The Losers (film)
line_text: Clay sees Roque does n't have his knife .

title: The Losers (film)
line_text: Looks-realizing it 's still embedded in his own shoulder .

title: The Losers (film)
line_text: Pulls it out , TOSSES IT BACK TO ROQUE .

title: The Losers (film)
line_text: Then RUN AT EACH OTHER full tilt !

title: The Losers (film)
line_text: And pay attention , IT HAPPENS FAST : Clay goes low-coming up to grab Roque 's knife hand , which is arcing DOWNWARDS TOWARDS CLAY 'S THROAT-Clay manages to HALT THE HAND , blade inches from his Adam 's apple-and there 's a moment where Roque could overpower him and actually cut his head off .

title: The Losers (film)
line_text: But Clay THROWS HIS WEIGHT FORWARD and BREAKS ROQUE 'S RIGHT ARM !

title: The Losers (film)
line_text: And for the first time , Roque SCREAMS .

title: The Losers (film)
line_text: Which seems to make Clay happy .

title: The Losers (film)
line_text: So he BREAKS ROQUE 'S LEFT ARM too .

title: The Losers (film)
line_text: Roque falls to his knees , BROKEN , BLOODY , AND BEATEN .

title: The Losers (film)
line_text: Leaning out of the cockpit , DESERT EAGLE levelled at Clay .

title: The Losers (film)
line_text: The bullet slams into Clay 's abdomen and BLOWS HIM off his feet backwards-FLYING OUT OF THE PLANE-And landing on hood of THE CORVETTE , Clay SMASHES DOWN ON the windshield-Cougar pumps the brakes and spins the wheel-desperately trying to keep Clay from rolling off the hood .

title: The Losers (film)
line_text: THE PLANE TURNING AROUND at the end of the runway .

title: The Losers (film)
line_text: Beginning it 's final run to get up to speed .

title: The Losers (film)
line_text: THE CORVETTE , Now driving TOWARDS IT on a chicken-like collision course when WHOOSH !

title: The Losers (film)
line_text: WADE FLIES PAST ON HIS MOTORCYCLE !

title: The Losers (film)
line_text: Clay turns to Cougar through the spiderwebbed windshield :

title: The Losers (film)
line_text: Cougar passes Clay his SNIPER RIFLE and FLOORS IT .

title: The Losers (film)
line_text: VISUALIZE THIS-AT ONE END OF THE RUNWAY , the plane starting to take off .

title: The Losers (film)
line_text: AT THE OPPOSITE END , Wade 's motorcycle heading full speed at the approaching plane .

title: The Losers (film)
line_text: And then AISHA steps out INTO THE MIDDLE of the runway .

title: The Losers (film)
line_text: The ROCKET LAUNCHER clutched in her hands .

title: The Losers (film)
line_text: Aims at the plane , which is almost at lift speed .

title: The Losers (film)
line_text: ROQUE sees her from the cockpit .

title: The Losers (film)
line_text: She locks eyes with him and GRINS-FIRING into the LANDING GEAR of the plane AS .

title: The Losers (film)
line_text: THE CORVETTE PULLS EVEN WITH WADE .

title: The Losers (film)
line_text: Instead of shooting , Clay THROWS , Cougar 's RIFLE BETWEEN THE SPOKES of Wade 's FRONT TIRE , causing the bike to CATAPULT WADE OFF and FORWARD .

title: The Losers (film)
line_text: THROUGH THE AIR and into the RIGHT NUMBER TWO JET ENGINE of the now flying cargo plane .

title: The Losers (film)
line_text: Aisha , somehow safe on the ground , looking up at the escaping plane .

title: The Losers (film)
line_text: The big plane EXPLODES in a MONSTER FIREBALL-VA DOOOM !

title: The Losers (film)
line_text: Burning gas and iron and cash .

title: The Losers (film)
line_text: Clay stares at the sight before him .

title: The Losers (film)
line_text: Not to rain on everyone 's we killed all the bad guys parade , but we should probably get gone-legless Pooch has a Learjet all gassed up for us in the Hangar .

title: The Losers (film)
line_text: From the smashed up bike Wade was driving , WADE 'S CELL PHONE RINGS .

title: The Losers (film)
line_text: Clay gets off the hood of the Vette and Cougar and Aisha help him hobble over .

title: The Postman (film)
line_text: Old George sits hunched over a home-made shortwave radio with a joint in his mouth .

title: The Postman (film)
line_text: The Postman sits beside him , listening as STATIC pours from an old car SPEAKER .

title: The Postman (film)
line_text: Not a soul in seven years of trying .

title: The Postman (film)
line_text: The Postman steps to a telescope pointing up through a hole in the trailer ceiling .

title: The Postman (film)
line_text: Hey , do n't let the kids see that .

title: The Postman (film)
line_text: George nods and goes on playing with the dials-searching for a voice in the void .

title: The Postman (film)
line_text: The Postman focuses on the moon .

title: The Postman (film)
line_text: I helped design the Galileo space station .

title: The Postman (film)
line_text: I dream it 's orbiting Earth forever .

title: The Postman (film)
line_text: With a dozen human skeletons all grinning at each other .

title: The Postman (film)
line_text: There 's an urgent KNOCKING on the trailer door .

title: Gang Related

title: Americana

title: The Lost Boys

line_text: Where BRETT SCHUMACHER (40s, weight-room warrior gone to seed) lies in wait.

line_text: And as Lucy's face falls at the sight of a man she clearly despises, we MOVE TO...

title: Little Brother
line_text: Katie sitting on the edge of the bed.

title: Little Brother
line_text: Through a large picture window, she watches Justin and Sam THROWING THE FOOTBALL around in the backyard.

title: Little Brother
line_text: Tim sits down next to her.

title: Little Brother
line_text: Justin and Sam are having a great time.

line_text: He directs patterns, hits her with the pass.

line_text: First time he hasn't seemed like a criminal.

line_text: We hear the jangly opening strains of the actual Smiths and "This Charming Man."

title: Copycat (film)
line_text: The room is unattractive , over-furnished but not comfortably .

title: Copycat (film)
line_text: A WOMAN is sitting propped up in a double bed .

title: Copycat (film)
line_text: She is in her mid-thirties , but drained and pale , she looks older .

title: Copycat (film)
line_text: By her side is a NASTY LITTLE DOG , with ribbon bows in its fur .

title: Copycat (film)
line_text: Near the bed is a TV and video , on which a movie 's final credits are running .

title: Copycat (film)
line_text: THE WOMAN IS IMPATIENTLY PUSHING AN INTERCOM BUTTON PETER enters .

title: Copycat (film)
line_text: Younger than the woman , rather good-looking .

title: Copycat (film)
line_text: Boyish and nondescript except for a patch of white skin near his hairline .

title: Copycat (film)
line_text: He goes straight to TV and puts the tape on eject . '

title: Copycat (film)
line_text: Why do n't we save it for later ?

title: Copycat (film)
line_text: You know I do n't like to watch talk shows by myself .

title: Copycat (film)
line_text: He inserts the video she wants and pushes play . '

title: Copycat (film)
line_text: Then he approaches the bed , leans over his wife and gently pushes a lock of hair back from the forehead .

title: Copycat (film)
line_text: She ignores him , staring at the screen .

title: Copycat (film)
line_text: The NASTY LITTLE DOG BARES ITS TEETH AND SNAPS AT HIM .

title: Copycat (film)
line_text: You know she does n't like you to touch me .

title: Copycat (film)
line_text: If she says she 's hungry , she 's lying to you .

title: Copycat (film)
line_text: Why would I say I fed her if I did n't ?

title: Copycat (film)
line_text: That 's what I do n't know .

title: Copycat (film)
line_text: I ca n't understand why anyone would lie .

title: Copycat (film)
line_text: As he goes we can hear the Woman still talking to her dog over the TV soundtrack .

title: Copycat (film)
line_text: You would n't lie to Mummy , would you ?

title: Copycat (film)
line_text: Just to get Dad in trouble ?

title: Copycat (film)
line_text: HER VOICE FADES AWAY AS WE FOLLOW HIM down the stairs into a small , ill-lit and dreary living room , into a messy kitchen , then through a door leading to the basement .

title: Copycat (film)
line_text: He locks the basement door behind him .

title: Copycat (film)
line_text: THE BASEMENT is brightly lighted , full of high tech , gadgets and computers .

title: Copycat (film)
line_text: As he approaches the bottom stair , we see a small TV/video set attached to a wall .

title: Copycat (film)
line_text: On its screen , freeze-framed and silent , is a video of a PRETTY GIRL at an outdoor rock concert , smiling seductively .

title: Copycat (film)
line_text: PETER puts on a WHITE LAB COAT and then reaches over something to turn the video back on .

title: Copycat (film)
line_text: The CAMERA PANS DOWN to what he has leaned across .

title: Copycat (film)
line_text: It is the YOUNG GIRL from the concert .

title: Copycat (film)
line_text: She is strapped onto a table , her mouth taped shut .

title: Copycat (film)
line_text: A plastic bag covers her head , but not tightly .

title: Copycat (film)
line_text: She is being asphyxiated by slow degrees .

title: Copycat (film)
line_text: PETER looks at her , gently pushes the bag up far enough to repeat the tender gesture with her damp hair that he made toward his wife .

title: Copycat (film)
line_text: Did n't I promise I 'd come right back ?

title: Kevin From Work
line_text: Kevin and Audrey sit down in the booth with their drinks.

title: Kevin From Work
line_text: He stares at her for a beat, then downs his.

title: Kevin From Work
line_text: It's my goodbye party, I am saying goodbye... to everyone.

title: Kevin From Work
line_text: You know you can tell me stuff, right?

title: Kevin From Work
line_text: We have shared a crappy cubicle wall for three years, after all.

title: Kevin From Work
line_text: She touches his hand in a friendly, caring way.

title: Kevin From Work
line_text: He stares at her hand on his.

title: Kevin From Work
line_text: He swallows, takes a deep breath.

title: Kevin From Work
line_text: There is something I do want to tell you.

title: Kevin From Work
line_text: The BABY BIRD is back and perched on her shoulder.

title: Kevin From Work
line_text: Kevin looks in her eyes, seriously.

title: Kevin From Work
line_text: The baby bird cocks its head, interested.

title: Kevin From Work
line_text: Kevin's about to speak, when Brock comes back from the bathroom.

title: Kevin From Work
line_text: I just went in the sink.

title: Kevin From Work
line_text: He kisses Audrey-- that's a lot of tongue for "I am back from the bathroom."

title: Perfect Creature
line_text: We 're asking everyone to stay in their homes in the sections of Jamestown now under quarantine .

title: Perfect Creature
line_text: Armed , gas masked guards stand with their guns at the ready .

title: Perfect Creature
line_text: Fires burn , bodies lie on the streets .

title: Perfect Creature
line_text: There are reports of residents being shot trying to escape the quarantine zone .

title: Perfect Creature
line_text: They say the Queen has left the city .

title: Perfect Creature
line_text: A figure is stumbling towards us .

title: Perfect Creature
line_text: One of the guards fires and the figure drops .

title: Perfect Creature
line_text: Cut to Two soldiers , wearing crude Victorian containment suits , surveying a map .

title: Perfect Creature
line_text: We 've blocked off this section , and here , containing the Jamestown slums .

title: Perfect Creature
line_text: We see the soldier outlining the Quarantine zone , marked in red .

title: Dead Poets Society
line_text: Neil and Todd have walked into the dorm lobby .

title: Dead Poets Society
line_text: My parents wanted me here all along but my grades were n't good enough .

title: Dead Poets Society
line_text: I had to go to Balincrest to pull them up .

title: Dead Poets Society
line_text: Well , you 've won the booby prize .

title: Dead Poets Society
line_text: Do n't expect to like it here .

line_text: ... We are gonna get your ass.

line_text: A beat, then Tillman leans in, turns off the phone.

title: Breakout Kings

title: Persons Unknown
line_text: CLOSE ON: The bible lying on the floor amidst the debris.

title: Persons Unknown
line_text: Janet picks it up, opens it.

title: Persons Unknown
line_text: Janet is on her knees at the door, working the bookmark like a jimmy in the lock.

title: Persons Unknown
line_text: After a few tries, we hear a triumphant CLICK.

title: Persons Unknown
line_text: She grabs the handle and pulls.

title: Persons Unknown
line_text: Peering closer into the crack she sees a dead-bolt.

title: Persons Unknown
line_text: WHAT DO YOU WANT FROM ME?

title: Persons Unknown
line_text: She bites her tongue to the sound of feet coming down the hall outside.

title: Persons Unknown
line_text: They stop at her door, evidenced by the shadow sneaking under the bottom crack.

title: Persons Unknown
line_text: Janet moves away from the door quickly and quietly, reaching for anything she can use as a weapon.

title: Persons Unknown
line_text: The doorknob jiggles followed by more knocking.

title: Persons Unknown
line_text: Janet opens her mouth to answer but stops herself.

title: Persons Unknown
line_text: She doesn't know what to do, so she just waits.

title: Persons Unknown
line_text: Listen, I know you are in there.

title: Persons Unknown
line_text: When she finally goes to answer her voice is cut short by a loud BANG - someone throwing their full weight against the door.

title: Persons Unknown
line_text: With each one, Janet gets more and more scared, moving deeper and deeper into the corner of the room.

title: Persons Unknown
line_text: The door explodes inward, the jam splitting.

title: Persons Unknown
line_text: A SWEATING, WINDED, WILD-EYED MAN IN HIS 20's stands in the doorway.

title: Persons Unknown
line_text: Janet's eyes go wide with fear.

title: Persons Unknown
line_text: The madman comes right at us, hands outstretched.

title: Persons Unknown
line_text: The man grabs her by the shoulders.

title: Persons Unknown
line_text: He takes a few hits before he can restrain her, shaking her until she stops.

title: Persons Unknown
line_text: The wild-eyed man is only understandably so.

title: Persons Unknown
line_text: inspection we see a kind face.

title: Persons Unknown
line_text: I am not one of them.

title: Persons Unknown
line_text: I woke up five minutes ago.

title: Persons Unknown
line_text: Janet sees a large splinter is protruding from her palm.

title: Persons Unknown
line_text: Joe takes her hand and gently works it out.

title: Persons Unknown
line_text: How did you get out of your room?

title: Persons Unknown
line_text: Joe looks around the trashed room, finds the bible.

title: Persons Unknown
line_text: Opening it he reveals a key taped to the inside of the back cover.

title: Persons Unknown
line_text: Do you know why you are here?

title: Persons Unknown
line_text: Seems like an awful lot of trouble to go to.

title: Persons Unknown
line_text: Well what would he want with me?

title: Persons Unknown
line_text: Haven't been farther than your door.

title: Persons Unknown
line_text: What's the last thing you remember?

title: Persons Unknown
line_text: I was in Central Park and-

title: Persons Unknown
line_text: I was all the way in Portland.

title: Life Unexpected
line_text: INT. COURTHOUSE - COURTROOM - THE Next DAY (D3)

title: Life Unexpected
line_text: Cate sneaks into a relatively empty courtroom, where Lux stands in front of a middle-aged, tough JUDGE.

title: Life Unexpected
line_text: I figured it was a waste to pay a lawyer to tell you what I could for free.

title: Life Unexpected
line_text: As the Judge looks over her petition, Cate is surprised to see Baze in the back.

title: Life Unexpected
line_text: I see you turn sixteen... tomorrow.

title: Life Unexpected
line_text: Yes and I will be old enough for emancipation.

title: Life Unexpected
line_text: I can get my GED, get a job...

title: Life Unexpected
line_text: It's a hearing, not a hockey game.

title: Life Unexpected
line_text: Lux looks back at the noise and is surprised to see them both.

title: Life Unexpected
line_text: I have only been with Lux for a few months.

title: Life Unexpected
line_text: She tends to change hands often.

title: Life Unexpected
line_text: The seven different families who tried to take you in?

title: Life Unexpected
line_text: No, I mean, I  I wanted a good home.

title: Life Unexpected
line_text: The state of Washington just hasn't provided me with one.

title: Life Unexpected
line_text: So it's the state's fault now?

title: Life Unexpected
line_text: No, no, I am not saying that

title: Life Unexpected
line_text: Cate and Baze exchange worried looks.

title: Life Unexpected
line_text: So as of today, you have no permanent place of residence?

title: Life Unexpected
line_text: As soon as my petition is granted, there's a studio, not far from my school

title: Life Unexpected
line_text: You are going to afford an apartment?

title: Life Unexpected
line_text: I have three thousand dollars in the bank

title: Life Unexpected
line_text: And who will be co-signing your rental agreement?

title: Life Unexpected
line_text: The whole point of getting emancipated is that I won't need it co-signed.

title: Life Unexpected
line_text: No landlord is going to rent an apartment to a minor unless

title: Life Unexpected
line_text: Suddenly, Cate and Baze jump up simultaneously.

title: Life Unexpected
line_text: They look at each other, annoyed.

title: Life Unexpected
line_text: You gave her a ride, let me sign the thing.

title: Life Unexpected
line_text: They are just here as, urn... character witnesses.

title: Life Unexpected
line_text: Lux and I  we go way back.

title: Life Unexpected
line_text: I carried her for nine months  you want to bond, be attached by an umbilical chord.

title: Life Unexpected
line_text: You think she remembers any of that?

title: Life Unexpected
line_text: If she did, she had remember what a unaccountable bottom-feeder you were

title: Life Unexpected
line_text: So sue me for having dreams and goals I wanted to accomplish

title: Life Unexpected
line_text: To own a loser bar with a stupid name?

title: Life Unexpected
line_text: And sorry, we can't all be self-indulgent radio celebrities who ramble about crap no one cares about.

title: Life Unexpected
line_text: The Judge gestures to the Caseworker.

title: Life Unexpected
line_text: So... you own your own business... and you are a radio talk jockey.

title: Life Unexpected
line_text: I see here you both have steady incomes ... no criminal records... each in possession of a working vehicle...

title: Life Unexpected
line_text: I am going to be straight with you, young lady.

title: Life Unexpected
line_text: I am not granting you emancipation.

title: Life Unexpected
line_text: You have no income, no permanent residence, you filed for a fee waiver to cover your court costs.

title: Life Unexpected
line_text: If you can't even afford the cost to get emancipated, what are you going to do when you are?

title: Life Unexpected
line_text: However, I take seriously that you feel the foster system has failed you.

title: Life Unexpected
line_text: Now, as far as the state is concerned, Catherine Campbell and Nicholas Basile are still legally your parents...

title: Life Unexpected
line_text: Those signatures were neither witnessed nor notarized.

title: Life Unexpected
line_text: And from what I hear you obtained Mr. Basile's address illegally.

title: Life Unexpected
line_text: I prefer to think of it as being proactive.

title: The Graduate
line_text: Ben and Elaine enter the lobby and stand just inside the door .

title: The Graduate
line_text: They start in a few steps .

title: The Graduate
line_text: Listen , Elaine-it seems to me that there is n't a bar in here .

title: The Graduate
line_text: I mean-as far as I know .

line_text: ONE of the CAR PARKERS passes them on his way out .

line_text: The CAMERA PULLS BACK to a HIGH OVERHEAD SHOT revealing many people moving back and forth in the lobby , passing Ben and Elaine .

title: The Graduate
line_text: Let 's get out of here , Elaine .

title: Perfect Citizen
line_text: Deck's sitting alone at a table in the back -- but still getting stares.

title: Perfect Citizen
line_text: He ignores them, though, sipping at a beer, typing on his new cellphone...

title: Perfect Citizen
line_text: ...Where he sends a text to Tess: Hello.

title: Perfect Citizen
line_text: Tess texts back: What are you doing online?

title: Perfect Citizen
line_text: He pauses, then adds: My house, one hour?

title: Perfect Citizen
line_text: Tess: I will bring the wine.

title: Perfect Citizen
line_text: But as he's turning off his phone --

title: Perfect Citizen
line_text: I see you started without me...

title: Perfect Citizen
line_text: Deck looks up, as Paul eyes the three extra beers on the table.

title: Perfect Citizen
line_text: But as Paul reaches for one, Deck shakes his head.

title: Perfect Citizen
line_text: When I got up to pee, that guy in the boots may have spit in those.

title: Perfect Citizen
line_text: Look, even if Fran Davids wants to keep this fight alive -- I don't.

title: Perfect Citizen
line_text: I am ready for the rebuild we were talking about: being at this firm, with you, with Viv.

title: Perfect Citizen
line_text: Which is not to say I won't be a pain in your ass from time to time, but I promise you, I will make it worthwhile.

title: Perfect Citizen
line_text: Paul pulls out a piece of paper, hands it to Deck.

title: Perfect Citizen
line_text: She's coming after all of us now.

title: Perfect Citizen
line_text: And off Deck, knowing it's time to take off the gloves...

title: Haven
line_text: EXT. CLIFF BOTTOM - CRIME SCENE - DAY

title: Haven
line_text: Nathan watches as Audrey examines the body: it's the guy that was chased over the cliff.

title: Haven
line_text: Look all you want, but he's pretty dead and that tends not to change much.

title: Haven
line_text: Audrey looks up to see a walrus of a man, GEORGE WUORNOS (58), Haven Police Chief.

title: Haven
line_text: Chief, this is Special Agent Parker from the Bureau.

title: Haven
line_text: This one of those situations where you claim to be here to help but you are really just here to step on my toes?

title: Haven
line_text: Wuornos measures her for a beat...and nods.

title: Haven
line_text: The contusion on his head is wrong for a fall.

title: Haven
line_text: I think he was struck by something cylindrical, like a pipe.

title: Haven
line_text: THEN he fell -- or was pushed.

title: Haven
line_text: What if I told you my investigator had other ideas?

title: Haven
line_text: Then I had say you need a better investigator.

title: Haven
line_text: She thinks I should fire you.

title: Haven
line_text: But Nathan never looks at her, just at the Chief.

title: Haven
line_text: Guess that makes two of you, then.

title: Haven
line_text: Audrey takes it in: whatever is between them is intense, and barely hidden.

title: Haven
line_text: I was sent here to interview Snipes -- a friend of his escaped from Federal Prison yesterday.

title: Haven
line_text: Wouldn't waste a used tissue on that guy.

title: Haven
line_text: We don't know where he is.

title: Haven
line_text: But it seems just a little co-ink-i-dink that Snipes turns up dead right after his friend escapes from prison, don't you think?

title: Haven
line_text: Wuornos gives Audrey another unreadable look, then nods.

title: Haven
line_text: What I think is that you are going to need some local help, Agent Parker, and I had hate to make you dig out your toe-stomping shoes on my account.

title: Haven
line_text: Nathan here is working this murder anyway.

title: Haven
line_text: I am sure he had be happy to show you around.

title: Haven
line_text: Nathan looks like he had rather swallow glass -- but then again, Nathan usually looks that way.

title: Haven
line_text: I need to call this in.

title: Haven
line_text: I will meet you up there.

title: My Generation
line_text: EMBEDDED ABC NEWS FOOTAGE -- Rolly Marks and his unit are on patrol.

title: My Generation
line_text: This is not footage our documentary crew shot.

title: My Generation
line_text: Rather it is footage culled from a news report.

title: My Generation
line_text: That looks like a penis to me.

title: My Generation
line_text: We hear Hate to Say I Told You So, by the  Hives.

title: My Generation
line_text: The war reverses itself; troops withdraw from Iraq,

title: Skip Tracer
line_text: Skip pulls in and gets out.

title: Skip Tracer
line_text: He goes to the van, snaps a cell phone photo of the license plate.

title: Skip Tracer
line_text: He finds the door open and is rifling through the glove compartment looking for i.d.

title: Skip Tracer
line_text: when he's spotted by Gypsies emerging from a Dollar Store

title: Skip Tracer
line_text: with purchases  AN OLD GYPSY CRONE, a nicely-dressed GYPSY

title: Skip Tracer
line_text: MATRON, a Young Gypsy Mother with Child in Arms, and a Couple

title: Skip Tracer
line_text: My uncle has a van like this.

title: Skip Tracer
line_text: I am looking for the manual.

title: Skip Tracer
line_text: The Matron goes and gets into the driver's seat to start the van.

title: Skip Tracer
line_text: The Old Crone gets into the passenger seat.

title: Skip Tracer
line_text: I got names and addresses now, so unless an old man on Beethoven Street gets his money back or a new roof, I am calling my friends on the Gypsy detail.

title: Skip Tracer
line_text: May my own eyes go blind if your eyes don't fail you when you most need them!

title: Skip Tracer
line_text: The kids pile in and slam the door.

title: Skip Tracer
line_text: Skip heads to his car, but feels odd.

title: Skip Tracer
line_text: Reaches behind him and realizes his wallet's gone.

title: Skip Tracer
line_text: Panicked, he reaches in his sports coat, is relieved to find Con's envelope.

title: Skip Tracer
line_text: Swearing to himself, he runs to his car, throws the envelope on the dash and squeals out after the van.

title: Tron: Legacy
line_text: Rush and Mega gain footing at the entry point .

title: Tron: Legacy
line_text: They turn at the sound of DIGITAL SNARLING .

title: Tron: Legacy
line_text: Across the moat , a gut-wrenching sight : All four Cybavors pounce on Flynn , hurling him off the ledge , mauling him as they go down , dividing into eight-Plummeting toward the MOLTEN DATA far below .

title: Tron: Legacy
line_text: Plexor steps out of his corridor , relishing the view : Remains of fallen bodies FLASH into the inferno .

title: Tron: Legacy
line_text: Plexor sees Mega and Rush on the other side .

title: Tron: Legacy
line_text: Bridges instantly extend from outer square to CORE CUBE .

title: The Lincoln Lawyer
line_text: You got Hayley tonight, just calling to remind.

title: The Lincoln Lawyer
line_text: Because you think I will forget.

title: The Lincoln Lawyer
line_text: What can you tell me about Mary Holder?

title: The Lincoln Lawyer
line_text: She's called me to her chambers.

title: The Lincoln Lawyer
line_text: Why would she be calling you to chambers, Mickey?

title: The Lincoln Lawyer
line_text: I don't know, which is why I am asking.

title: The Lincoln Lawyer
line_text: What can you tell me about her?

title: The Lincoln Lawyer
line_text: I can tell you she has a bug up her ass the size of the legal canon of ethics, which makes me think you have done something.

title: Macgyver
line_text: 7 EXT. PALATIAL ESTATE ON THE WATER - EVENING

title: Macgyver
line_text: A little of this... a little of that.

title: Macgyver
line_text: During this he closes the car door, but not before we see the screwdriver sticking out of the ignition.

title: Macgyver
line_text: He moves to the rear of the Ferrari -- uses his handkerchief to inconspicuously collect soot from the tailpipe.

title: Macgyver
line_text: Thornton said we were going to need a fingerprint to access the safe.

title: Angie Tribeca
line_text: Dr. Scholls looks at the ransom note under a microscope.

title: Angie Tribeca
line_text: When I place it under the microscope...

title: Angie Tribeca
line_text: She places the note under the microscope.

title: Angie Tribeca
line_text: And when I take it away, it is immediately small again.

title: Angie Tribeca
line_text: The Old Lady from the park is being loaded into a cadaver locker.

title: Angie Tribeca
line_text: A dour faced bald headed man, DR. EDELWEISS, enters the lab in an elaborate motorized wheelchair.

title: Angie Tribeca
line_text: He controls the chair with a sophisticated joystick.

title: Angie Tribeca
line_text: He wears slightly tinted glasses, and his brow is deeply furrowed.

title: Angie Tribeca
line_text: As you can see, I clearly cannot shake your hand.

title: Angie Tribeca
line_text: This is the ransom note I was talking about.

title: Angie Tribeca
line_text: He motions to Scholls, who puts the note in a large glass box.

title: Angie Tribeca
line_text: About the size of a movie theater popcorn machine.

title: Angie Tribeca
line_text: Once closed, a UV light illuminates the inside of the box.

title: Angie Tribeca
line_text: Edelweiss maneuvers his chair over to the box.

title: Angie Tribeca
line_text: He casually stands up, and reaches down to another joystick on the side of the box.

title: Angie Tribeca
line_text: He uses the joystick to operate a mechanical claw.

title: Angie Tribeca
line_text: Much like a game at an arcade, he tries to pick up the note with the claw.

title: Angie Tribeca
line_text: The crane with the claw keeps missing.

title: Angie Tribeca
line_text: This continues for some time as the others look on.

title: Angie Tribeca
line_text: He grabs the note, but it slips from his grasp at the last minute.

title: Angie Tribeca
line_text: At one point, the claw grabs a here-to-for unseen stuffed penguin.

title: Angie Tribeca
line_text: The penguin is then dropped down a shoot.

title: Angie Tribeca
line_text: He is also able to grab a cheap toy helicopter, and a small stuffed snake.

title: Angie Tribeca
line_text: After several minutes he finally picks up the note.

title: Angie Tribeca
line_text: He looks to a video monitor of the note in the box.

title: Angie Tribeca
line_text: Immediately, the image of the ransom note comes into extreme close up.

title: Angie Tribeca
line_text: The letters that make up these words.

title: Angie Tribeca
line_text: You can't tell a story without words.

title: Angie Tribeca
line_text: You can if it's a picture book, or an interpretive dance.

title: Angie Tribeca
line_text: A painting sometimes tells a story...

title: Angie Tribeca
line_text: The harsh, haphazard way with which the "T" is crossed tells me that this is someone who is desperate.

title: Angie Tribeca
line_text: The round "B"s, and "D"s signify a person who is experiencing financial hardship.

title: Angie Tribeca
line_text: And the close space between the letters tells me that this is someone that has a lack of respect for authority.

title: Angie Tribeca
line_text: So this is some sort of desperate individual, a person who needs money, and is willing to blackmail the Mayor in order to get it?

title: Shelter
line_text: EXT. SHELTER BAY INN - COURTYARD - DAY

title: Shelter
line_text: Behind Helen, WORKERS exit with the TELEVISION that was removed from the fountain.

title: Shelter
line_text: There are no televisions at Shelter Bay.

title: Shelter
line_text: And for those who have brought them, as you can see, no television reception.

title: Shelter
line_text: There is no wifi or cell phone coverage.

title: Shelter
line_text: Our guests come here for the solitude.

title: Shelter
line_text: They come for a moment of peace.

title: Shelter
line_text: We ANGLE ON GENNA. She looks INCREDULOUS.

title: Shelter
line_text: Those of you who are returning understand what's expected of you.

title: Shelter
line_text: Those of you who are new will learn quickly or be replaced.

title: Shelter
line_text: After 45 years of service, this summer will be my last.

title: Shelter
line_text: There is a bit of a MURMUR among the staff.

title: Shelter
line_text: The Inn has recently been acquired by the Auberge Corporation.

title: Shelter
line_text: I will oversee the transition, but I will no longer be your Hotel Manager.

title: Shelter
line_text: That distinction now belongs to Ms. Grace Brancato.

title: Shelter
line_text: She searches for the words she has rehearsed, but no words come.

title: Shelter
line_text: It comes out a bit feeble.

title: Shelter
line_text: A BEAT of SILENCE follows, then a SUIT OF ARMOUR crashes into the nearby fountain.

title: Shelter
line_text: Grace recoils, but Helen doesn't even FLINCH.

title: Shelter
line_text: It should be an interesting summer.

title: Shelter
line_text: We take in the regal beauty of SHELTER BAY and we...

line_text: Ethan, Will, Charlotte, Mackenzie and Emma enter.

line_text: (Emma wears a blue dress and has her hair in a braid  this will be useful later.)

title: Untitled Schwartz & Wiener Project A
line_text: It looks like Teddy got the message.

title: Untitled Schwartz & Wiener Project A

title: Untitled Schwartz & Wiener Project A

title: Untitled Schwartz & Wiener Project A

title: Untitled Schwartz & Wiener Project A
line_text: Charlotte, I can always count on you.

title: Untitled Schwartz & Wiener Project A
line_text: Charlotte takes the drink and downs it.

title: Untitled Schwartz & Wiener Project A
line_text: Slow it down, this is a dinner for my daughter's good grades, not your mother's last wedding.

title: Untitled Schwartz & Wiener Project A
line_text: She always marries her cult leader.

title: Untitled Schwartz & Wiener Project A
line_text: It's cherry vodka and lime soda.

title: Untitled Schwartz & Wiener Project A
line_text: I call it a Polar Vortex.

title: Austin Powers: The Spy Who Shagged Me
Austin Powers: The Spy Who Shagged Me
line_text: The penthouse boardroom is adorned with Starbucks paraphernalia : large logo , clear canisters full of beans , and a large world map with a little logo everywhere there is a Starbucks .

title: Austin Powers: The Spy Who Shagged Me
line_text: Around a large table are Dr. Evil , Number Two (bandaged and lightly spotted with soot) , Frau , Scott and a couple of NEW HENCHMEN .

title: Austin Powers: The Spy Who Shagged Me
line_text: A Starbucks employee serves everyone steaming hot coffee products .

title: Austin Powers: The Spy Who Shagged Me
line_text: Dr. Evil , as the legitimate frontman of your organization , I seized upon the opportunity to invest in a small Seattle-based coffee company several years ago .

title: Austin Powers: The Spy Who Shagged Me
line_text: Today , Starbucks is a far-flung empire with 2000 outlets worldwide .

title: Austin Powers: The Spy Who Shagged Me
line_text: Oh good , Number Two , I do enjoy a good cuppa joe .

title: Austin Powers: The Spy Who Shagged Me
line_text: If I may continue , I believe if we shift our resources away from world domination and focus on providing premium quality coffee drinks , we can increase our gross profits fivefold .

title: Austin Powers: The Spy Who Shagged Me
line_text: Dr. Evil takes a sip of cappuccino , leaving a WHITE FROTHY MILK MUSTACHE on his upper lip .

title: Austin Powers: The Spy Who Shagged Me
Austin Powers: The Spy Who Shagged Me
line_text: Perhaps you 've confused me with someone who gives a shit .

title: Austin Powers: The Spy Who Shagged Me
line_text: Might I remind you that I run the show here ?

title: Austin Powers: The Spy Who Shagged Me
Austin Powers: The Spy Who Shagged Me
Austin Powers: The Spy Who Shagged Me
Austin Powers: The Spy Who Shagged Me
Austin Powers: The Spy Who Shagged Me
line_text: I will not tolerate your insolence !

title: Austin Powers: The Spy Who Shagged Me
Austin Powers: The Spy Who Shagged Me
line_text: FLASHBACK (FOOTAGE FROM FIRST MOVIE) Number Two disappears backwards into the fiery pit .

title: Smith
line_text: Tom's delivery truck pulls into the "No Parking".

title: Smith

title: Smith
line_text: Leans back into the cab, CLICKS a switch on the compact box we recognize from Shawn's workbench.

title: Smith
line_text: He grabs a random delivery box, starts briskly

title: Smith
line_text: We GLIDE up the grill and hood to find Jeff behind the wheel.

title: Smith
line_text: Digs out the assault rifle, grabs a mag, SNAPS it into the breech

line_text: Annie makes her way toward the alley.

title: Smith

title: Smith

title: Smith
line_text: Oh my god, I haven't seen you since graduation.

title: Smith
