title: The Strain
line_text: It's so cold in here, his FAINT BREATH is visible. His naked

title: The Strain
line_text: chest is criss-crossed by a pattern of surgical scars.

title: The Strain
line_text: FOOTSTEPS approach: Mr. Fitzwilliam and Eichhorst.

title: The Strain
line_text: Mr. Palmer, Herr Eichhorst wishes to pay his respects.

title: The Strain
line_text: You may notice how chilly it has gotten in here, Eichhorst.

title: The Strain
line_text: Twenty full degrees cooler than the rest of the building.

title: The Strain
line_text: But not too cold for you, I trust?

title: The Strain
line_text: His icy blue eyes and white-blond hair confer him an Aryan superiority.

title: The Strain
line_text: It can't be too cold for you -- can it?

title: The Strain
line_text: Palmer pushes buttons which elevate his bed and open the curtains behind it -- REVEALING A SPECTACULAR VIEW

title: The Strain
line_text: But to me this is vital.

title: The Strain
line_text: That is all we are, you know, no matter how rich, no matter how powerful --

title: The Strain
line_text: -- from the moment we are born, we are dying.

title: The Strain
line_text: He points at some JARS on a shelf.

title: The Strain
line_text: His own organs rest inside them, preserved in formaldehyde.

title: The Strain
line_text: And the four survivors have been found.

title: The Strain
line_text: Palmer grins icily yet with some regret.

title: The Strain
line_text: Throughout my life I have learned what it feels to cross a line -- to do things -- things that cannot be undone.

title: The Strain
line_text: That line -- it has been crossed now, hasn't it?

title: The Strain
line_text: Eichhorst nods and looks out at the nighttime city.

title: The Strain
line_text: I look out upon this island and I savor what is to come.

title: The Strain
line_text: I find it somewhat comforting that something as powerful as Him needs our help in doing something so simple: crossing the river.

title: The Strain
line_text: Even he is bound by rules...

title: The Strain
line_text: Hold on Palmer and Eichhorst... long enough for us to notice that breath steams out of Palmers mouth...

title: The Strain
line_text: I will never get used to...

title: The Strain
line_text: Yes, even I miss breathing sometimes.

title: Final Destination (film)
line_text: Tense , her eyes look left , then right .

title: Final Destination (film)
line_text: I do n't know where he is .

title: Final Destination (film)
line_text: WIDER , Agents Schreck and Weine stand before Clear in her garage .

title: Final Destination (film)
line_text: She studies the men before averting her eyes .

title: Final Destination (film)
line_text: Because I did n't believe him .

title: Final Destination (film)
line_text: Schreck 's eyes take a walk around the artwork in the garage , pausing on a piece of twisted metal from the crash .

title: Final Destination (film)
line_text: If he should contact you , it would be in the best interest of your own safety to contact us .

title: Final Destination (film)
line_text: Schreck pauses , once again eyeing the painting before moving out of the garage on their way to their car .

title: Final Destination (film)
line_text: CAMERA PUSHES IN ON CLEAR as she looks at the business card .

title: Rita
line_text: INT. CABBOTT ACADEMY -- TEACHERS' LOUNGE -- DAY

title: Rita
line_text: Rita enters, a little hungover from the night before, exchanges a look with Colin, glances at the coffee machine pleadingly, and sits down at a vacant table.

title: Rita
line_text: As Colin laughingly goes to make Rita a coffee, Nora comes dancing over to her.

title: Rita
line_text: Rita smiles, unable to dislike Nora.

title: Rita
line_text: You are probably excited to hear how my first day went.

title: Rita
line_text: I am sure I will be once I have coffee.

title: Rita
line_text: It went well, it went very well.

title: Rita
line_text: It was exciting, and educational, and interesting, and I don't think I have any questions.

title: Rita
line_text: No students in the teacher's lounge.

title: Rita
line_text: What do you do when the students throw stuff at you?

title: Rita
line_text: Hypothetically, what did they throw at you?

title: Rita
line_text: Say, a pencil case about this big with some really hard edges.

title: Rita
line_text: Then you pick up the pencil case.

title: Rita
line_text: And then you throw it back at the student's head.

title: Rita
line_text: Nora, if anybody throws stuff at you, you crack down on them immediately.

title: Rita
line_text: You show them who's in charge.

title: Rita
line_text: You don't actually throw it back at them because that would be illegal.

title: Rita
line_text: You remove them from the classroom, send them to Terrence and have their parents pick them up immediately.

title: Rita
line_text: And then their parents will find a way to blame it on you to Terrence while simultaneously shaming their child enough that it won't happen again.

title: Rita
line_text: Nora gazes at her as if she's some kind of super hero.

title: Rita
line_text: As you know, I am very into in Norse mythology.

title: Rita
line_text: In the Icelandic sagas the hero always has a bard.

title: Rita
line_text: I had like to be your bard.

title: Rita
line_text: Rita leaves and can't help smiling as she goes.

title: U Turn (1997 film)
line_text: BOBBY , depressed , is heading towards Harlin 's gas station , passing JENNY sitting on a corner drinking a soda , almost as if waiting for him .

title: U Turn (1997 film)
line_text: She runs to him , and follows him , as somewhere a POLICE RADIO crackles and buzzes .

title: U Turn (1997 film)
line_text: I just wanted to thank you .

title: U Turn (1997 film)
line_text: For defending my honor this afternoon .

title: U Turn (1997 film)
line_text: I hate to bust your bubble honey , but I was n't defending you .

title: U Turn (1997 film)
line_text: But you was going to fight for me .

title: U Turn (1997 film)
line_text: I was n't going to fight for you .

title: U Turn (1997 film)
line_text: I was just going to beat the shit out of your boyfriend .

title: U Turn (1997 film)
line_text: I mean , I let him take me out and stuff , but I ai n't spoken for .

title: U Turn (1997 film)
line_text: Get it through your head , little girl ; I 'm not going for you .

title: U Turn (1997 film)
line_text: If this Toby likes you , then if I were you I 'd marry him .

title: U Turn (1997 film)
line_text: You 're not going to get much better in this town .

title: U Turn (1997 film)
line_text: That 's what I thought until you came riding in .

title: U Turn (1997 film)
line_text: I saw your car over at the gas station .

title: U Turn (1997 film)
line_text: Want to take me for a ride ?

title: U Turn (1997 film)
line_text: Desert 's kind of lonely this time of day .

title: U Turn (1997 film)
line_text: Well , I 'm gon na be eighteen in two years , but that do n't mean you ca n't take me for a ride if you want .

title: U Turn (1997 film)
line_text: No , I do n't want to take you for a ride .

title: U Turn (1997 film)
line_text: Hey , you do n't think you can get $ 150 from your parents , could you ?

title: U Turn (1997 film)
line_text: From OFF CAMERA we hear TOBY .

title: U Turn (1997 film)
line_text: Toby moves menacingly up the street towards Bobby .

title: U Turn (1997 film)
line_text: I told you it was n't over , but you did n't listen .

title: U Turn (1997 film)
line_text: Now I find you sneakin ' around with my girl behind my back .

title: U Turn (1997 film)
line_text: I was n't sneaking around with your girl .

title: U Turn (1997 film)
line_text: We 're going to get in his fancy car and ride off and leave you behind .

title: U Turn (1997 film)
line_text: What the hell are you talking about ?

title: U Turn (1997 film)
line_text: I 'm gon na bust you up but good .

title: U Turn (1997 film)
line_text: I 'm gon na bust you into a million pieces and then .

title: U Turn (1997 film)
line_text: and then bust those pieces up , and then .

title: U Turn (1997 film)
line_text: and then spread them all around .

title: U Turn (1997 film)
line_text: That 's what I 'm gon na do .

title: U Turn (1997 film)
line_text: You do n't know what you 're dealing with , Mister .

title: U Turn (1997 film)
line_text: When you go off somebody gets hurt .

title: U Turn (1997 film)
line_text: Toby Tucker , it do n't matter to me if you beat him all up and knock out all his teeth and he 's just drooling and bleeding all over hisself , 'cause we love each other and we gon na run off , and I 'm gon na have his love child .

title: U Turn (1997 film)
line_text: You gon na pay for that , Mister .

title: U Turn (1997 film)
line_text: Toby and Bobby square off , sizing each other up and preparing for a violent confrontation .

title: U Turn (1997 film)
line_text: Just as the two are about to clash we hear the voice of SHERIFF POTTER from OFF CAMERA .

title: U Turn (1997 film)
line_text: The two men freeze in their tracks , as Potter drives up fast .

title: U Turn (1997 film)
line_text: Toby , I just came from your mother 's place .

title: U Turn (1997 film)
line_text: She says she ai n't seen you since this morning .

title: U Turn (1997 film)
line_text: Boy , I 'm not trying to hear nothing from you except that you 're heading home .

title: U Turn (1997 film)
line_text: Toby grabs Jenny by the wrist and literally pulls he along .

title: U Turn (1997 film)
line_text: As she goes she yells back to Bobby .

title: U Turn (1997 film)
line_text: Do n't go nowhere without me .

title: U Turn (1997 film)
line_text: I wan na have your love child .

title: U Turn (1997 film)
line_text: Toby points a vicious finger at Bobby .

title: U Turn (1997 film)
line_text: Toby and Jenny exit leaving Bobby and the Sheriff alone .

title: U Turn (1997 film)
line_text: Bobby would also like to exit fast .

title: U Turn (1997 film)
line_text: Seen you popping up a little bit of everywhere today .

title: U Turn (1997 film)
line_text: You 're not planning on staying are you ?

title: The Fosters
line_text: A modest house in a nondescript neighborhood.

title: The Fosters
line_text: A DENTED MUSTANG sits in the driveway.

title: The Fosters
line_text: Callie drops her backpack silently on the patchy grass, and signals to Brandon with a head nod.

title: The Fosters
line_text: He goes to the front door and KNOCKS.

title: The Fosters
line_text: Callie sneaks over to one of the windows on the side of the house and taps on it lightly.

title: The Fosters
line_text: A light turns on in the house.

title: The Fosters
line_text: Callie gets up, tries once more.

title: The Fosters
line_text: JIM PIERSON (40s, imposing) peers out through the screen.

title: The Fosters
line_text: Callie disappears around the back of the small bungalow.

title: The Fosters
line_text: I am looking for the, um, Metro?

title: The Fosters
line_text: The Metro's a few miles from here.

title: The Fosters
line_text: Over Pierson's shoulder, Brandon can see all the way to the back of the tiny house, where Callie slips in the kitchen door.

title: The Fosters
line_text: She creeps into the house as quietly as she can.

title: The Fosters
line_text: Well, you gotta go about six blocks -

title: The Fosters
line_text: Callie steps just a little too hard, making a small THUD.

title: The Fosters
line_text: What the hell are you doing in here?

title: The Fosters
line_text: I just want to see Jude.

title: The Fosters
line_text: Pierson grabs her by the arm.

title: The Fosters
line_text: You made a lot of trouble for me thelast time you were here.

title: The Fosters
line_text: Pierson whips around and shoves Brandon against the wall.

title: The Fosters
line_text: Look, I am sorry about your car.

title: The Fosters
line_text: I will pay to have it fixed.

title: The Fosters
line_text: I just want to talk to Jude, okay - please?

title: The Fosters
line_text: He grabs for her, but she slips past him.

title: The Fosters
line_text: Pierson opens a desk drawer and pulls out a gun.

title: The Fosters
line_text: Get the hell outta my house!

title: The Tourist (2010 film)
line_text: Frank sits alone with a blanket over his shoulders .

title: The Tourist (2010 film)
line_text: Most of the blood has been wiped from his wound and he has a rough bandage on his head .

title: The Tourist (2010 film)
line_text: From down the hallway a cheery stubble-faced POLICE OFFICER , DOMENICO (30 's , animated) , walks into the room where Frank is waiting .

title: The Tourist (2010 film)
line_text: Domenico laughs , talking on his cell phone as he enters .

title: The Tourist (2010 film)
line_text: You ca n't let them stay over , man .

title: The Tourist (2010 film)
line_text: You start cuddling and then she wants to borrow your car .

title: The Tourist (2010 film)
line_text: Hey , what are you doing in here ?

title: The Tourist (2010 film)
line_text: The officers told me to wait here .

title: The Tourist (2010 film)
line_text: I 've been sitting here for over two hours .

title: The Tourist (2010 film)
line_text: I think they forgot about you .

title: The Tourist (2010 film)
line_text: Domenico sits on the edge of a desk .

title: The Tourist (2010 film)
line_text: Domenico picks up Frank 's statement and glances at it .

title: The Tourist (2010 film)
line_text: Mr. Taylor , wow , you had quite a day .

title: The Tourist (2010 film)
line_text: We got chasing , we got shooting .

title: The Tourist (2010 film)
line_text: Domenico looks at mild-mannered Frank sitting there in his boxers .

title: The Tourist (2010 film)
line_text: You think I 'm crazy but it 's all true .

title: The Tourist (2010 film)
line_text: Maybe you 're crazy AND it 's true , my friend .

title: The Tourist (2010 film)
line_text: Domenico looks at Frank a little harder .

title: The Tourist (2010 film)
line_text: Decides this guy is not making all this up .

title: The Tourist (2010 film)
line_text: Okay , so who are these guys ?

title: The Tourist (2010 film)
line_text: They followed you from the Danieli ?

title: The Tourist (2010 film)
line_text: They pretended to be room service .

title: The Tourist (2010 film)
line_text: You do n't scopata one of their girlfriends or something ?

title: The Tourist (2010 film)
line_text: He consults a piece of paper .

title: The Tourist (2010 film)
line_text: In America the cops catch the crooks , not the victim .

title: The Tourist (2010 film)
line_text: Ha ha , we do that sometimes here , too .

title: The Tourist (2010 film)
line_text: How long you know Cara Mason ?

title: The Tourist (2010 film)
line_text: And you take her to the Danieli ?

title: The Tourist (2010 film)
line_text: That must have been good meeting , yes ?

title: The Tourist (2010 film)
line_text: The infectious grin again lights up Domenico 's face .

title: The Tourist (2010 film)
line_text: You lead an exciting life , Mr. Taylor .

title: The Tourist (2010 film)
line_text: Domenico picks up the phone and dials a number .

title: The Tourist (2010 film)
line_text: He talks in brisk Italian , listens again and replaces the receiver .

title: The Tourist (2010 film)
line_text: Signora Mason was staying with her husband last night .

title: The Tourist (2010 film)
line_text: I think maybe Signora Mason might know why these guys behave badly .

title: The Tourist (2010 film)
line_text: You got a phone number , mobile ?

title: The Tourist (2010 film)
line_text: She did n't give me one .

title: The Tourist (2010 film)
line_text: Frank stands and half-heartedly follows him to the doorway .

title: The Tourist (2010 film)
line_text: He spots something in the adjoining room ; a computer that has been left on .

title: The Tourist (2010 film)
line_text: He wanders over and looks at the screen .

title: The Tourist (2010 film)
line_text: An idea comes into Frank 's head .

title: The Tourist (2010 film)
line_text: He glances at the inscription on the WATCH .

title: The Tourist (2010 film)
line_text: He does a search for WANTED INTERNATIONAL CRIMINALS and types in the name : ALEXANDER PEARCE .

title: The Tourist (2010 film)
line_text: An immediate hit in the data base .

title: The Tourist (2010 film)
line_text: Alexander Pearce 's page fills the screen .

title: The Tourist (2010 film)
line_text: The caption reads : # 6 on INTERPOL 'S MOST WANTED LIST .

title: The Tourist (2010 film)
line_text: In place of a photograph there is just a black outline of a man 's head .

title: The Tourist (2010 film)
line_text: Frank is about to scan for more information when he hears Domenico returning .

title: The Tourist (2010 film)
line_text: He quickly steps back into the room where he was left .

title: The Tourist (2010 film)
line_text: DOMENICO enters carrying a garish SWEAT SUIT .

title: Damnation
line_text: Seth enters the newspaper office to the sound of a phone ringing.

title: Damnation
line_text: BURT BABBAGE (50s), the editor, picks up the phone.

title: Damnation
line_text: Seth walks over and sits across from the desk of D.L. SULLIVAN (20s).

title: Damnation
line_text: D.L is like a young Orson Welles: dapper and pretentious with his suit and pipe.

title: Damnation
line_text: Three or four other ELDERLY REPORTERS and EDITORS work at their nearby desks.

title: Damnation
line_text: D.L. doesn't look up from his typewriter.

title: Damnation
line_text: Do you have some kind of church event you had like us to cover?

title: Damnation
line_text: I am still trying to get a sense of the landscape here...

title: Damnation
line_text: I can help you with that.

title: Damnation
line_text: For the first time, he really takes in this preacher.

title: Damnation
line_text: But it's not the physical landscape I am concerned with, D.L. Sullivan.

title: Damnation
line_text: My eye is on the metaphysical one.

title: Damnation
line_text: Sam Riley, the leader of the farmer's revolt, was just shot in cold blood.

title: Damnation
line_text: I am sure the appropriate words will be found.

title: Damnation
line_text: A man's language is a map of his soul.

title: Damnation
line_text: All traced out in his words.

title: Damnation
line_text: The Holden Tribune is the word of public record here.

title: Damnation
line_text: D.L. looks around: the other reporters and editors are dead- eyed men in their 60s and 70s.

title: Damnation
line_text: So, for better or worse, it's also the map of this town's soul.

title: Damnation
line_text: And yet it refuses to report on the collective revolt of its local farmers.

title: Damnation
line_text: D.L. looks around and makes sure his editor, Burt Babbage, isn't listening in.

title: Damnation
line_text: Babbage isn't: he's still on the phone, though he eyes Seth.

title: Damnation
line_text: Those are dangerous words around here.

title: Damnation
line_text: And we must girlishly beware all dangerous little cocksucking words, musn't we?

title: Damnation
line_text: Befuddled, D.L. stares at this new preacher.

title: Damnation
line_text: Seth grabs a nearby newspaper and looks it over.

title: Damnation
line_text: Here stands the proud proprietor Archibald Weems.

title: Damnation
line_text: As we can see, the only emperor is the emperor of ice cream...

title: Damnation
line_text: D.L. Sullivan, you are presently in the brief interval of your only life.

title: Damnation
line_text: Is this how you are going to spend it?

title: Damnation
line_text: Doting on ice cream vendors and weather reports?

title: Damnation
line_text: To write banal thoughts is to construct a banal spirit.

title: Damnation
line_text: Babbage is a sturdy man of easy authority.

title: Damnation
line_text: Is there something we can help you with, Preacher?

title: Damnation
line_text: 'Let be be the finale of seem.

title: Damnation
line_text: The only emperor is the emperor of ice cream.'

title: Damnation
line_text: It's from a poem by Wallace Stevens.

title: Damnation
line_text: Well, as much as I enjoy this Parisian salon talk, we do have a paper to write.

title: Damnation
line_text: Yes, the battle between God and Mammon is often disguised as a mere matter of words.

title: Damnation
line_text: Your talent is a gift from God.

title: Damnation
line_text: It had be a sin to waste it on the devil's behalf.

title: Damnation
line_text: Babbage and Sullivan watch him go.

title: The Wedding Date
line_text: Kat stands in the car park behind the salon , furtively sucking on a cigarette as she pulls off an old nicotine patch .

title: The Wedding Date
line_text: Choking , she throws down the cigarette as the salon door opens and Bunny steps out .

title: The Wedding Date
line_text: What 's going on with you two ?

title: The Wedding Date
line_text: I was pretty hard on her last night .

title: The Wedding Date
line_text: There 's a reason I always tell that Tony Pee-Pants story , you know .

title: The Wedding Date
line_text: This is bigger than Tony Pee-Pants .

title: The Wedding Date
line_text: Before Tony , you and your sister were best friends .

title: The Wedding Date
line_text: I could n't split you up .

title: The Wedding Date
line_text: If your sister ate the spinach , you ate the spinach .

title: The Wedding Date
line_text: Anyway , when that boy came over , it was the first time you ever did anything without her .

title: The Wedding Date
line_text: And Amy was n't just jealous .

title: The Wedding Date
line_text: So she flirted with Tony , and you got mad and sent him away .

title: The Wedding Date

title: Genius
line_text: Einstein opens the door for Maric.

title: Genius
line_text: Two twin beds with tired sheets sit under a CROSS.

line_text: Einstein strides across the room to the dusty curtains...

title: Genius
line_text: ...and sweeps them open like a gameshow host revealing a prize.

title: Genius
line_text: Except this prize is a view of a WALL.

title: Genius
line_text: You have to look out at just the right angle, to the right of the church, past the shops and...there.

title: Genius
line_text: We can see a tiny sliver of Lake Como hundreds of yards away.

title: Genius
line_text: But I am unemployed and it was cheap.

title: Genius
line_text: Lucky for us, wealth has nothing to do with money.

title: Genius
line_text: Einstein turns and looks at Maric in the eyes.

title: Genius
line_text: That is the most beautiful thing anyone has ever said to me.

title: Genius
line_text: Her long hair falls over her eyes.

title: Genius
line_text: Einstein doesn't move, his eyes locked to her eyes.

title: Genius
line_text: Her dress falls to the floor.

title: Genius
line_text: She inhales and unclips her bra.

title: Genius
line_text: Einstein keeps staring into her eyes.

title: Genius
line_text: You, Mileva Maric, are the most beautiful creature I have ever seen.

title: Genius
line_text: They share hot breathes between their almost-touching lips.

title: Genius
line_text: Oh, well, come to think of it I --

title: Genius
line_text: Einstein pulls Maric in and kisses her with a yet unseen passion.

title: Genius
line_text: Einstein and Maric push the twin beds together and kiss.

title: Genius
line_text: You and Mileva Maric had an... unconventional relationship, yes?

title: Manifest
line_text: INT. OBSERVATION LOUNGE, CANCER CENTER - DAY - CONTINUOUS 44

title: Manifest
line_text: BEN AND GRACE sit side by side, observing Cal, flooded with a rare feeling.

title: Manifest
line_text: Ben in particular looks newly energized, his mind racing, somehow awakened.

title: Manifest
line_text: Grace on the other hand is visibly on edge.

title: Manifest
line_text: You are usually the optimist and I am doom and gloom, remember?

title: Manifest
line_text: His small attempt at humor hits the mark.

title: Manifest
line_text: Said the woman looking like she's about to toss her cookies.

title: Manifest
line_text: This attempt at humor, not so much.

title: Manifest
line_text: Welling up, Grace stares ahead, avoiding eye-contact with Ben even as she tells him

title: Manifest
line_text: I have so much to apologize to you for.

title: Manifest
line_text: A beat, as this lands on Ben.

title: Manifest
line_text: We don't have to get into this now.

title: Manifest
line_text: Tears streaming, she forces herself to face him, plows ahead.

title: Manifest
line_text: I spent every day of the last five years blaming you  not only for taking that later flight, but for making Cal so desperate for your attention that he wanted to stay with you.

title: Manifest
line_text: I only had maybe six months more with him and even that you took away from me.

title: Manifest
line_text: Ben, not one to delight in criticism, stiffens hearing this.

title: Manifest
line_text: But the thing is, now I realize, for him to be here, today...for Olive, who's been so shattered, lost...to have her twin alive...Cal had to be on that plane.

title: Manifest
line_text: Seeing that she's trembling, Ben holds her, regards his wife.

title: Manifest
line_text: What you have both been through....

title: Manifest
line_text: Those five simple words open the floodgates for Grace.

title: Manifest
line_text: She cries in his arms, Ben gently, silently consoling her.

title: Manifest
line_text: When you think about it, the only reason we were on that trip in the first place was because you insisted  and bribed me with sex.

title: Manifest
line_text: So if anyone saved Cal, I am pretty sure it was you.

title: Manifest
line_text: OFF Ben, Grace, finding their way back to each other

line_text: Herman's weathered, worn, stapled, stitched and steam- punked heart EXPLODES IN HIS CHEST.

title: Mockingbird Lane
line_text: and he tumbles backward, sliding down the cobbled slope of tiles and off the roof.

title: Mockingbird Lane

title: Silverado (film)

title: Silverado (film)
line_text: It 's an expansive place , busy now with gamblers , drinkers , and brightly-dressed saloon girls .

title: Silverado (film)
line_text: Paden walks up to stand at the bar .

title: Silverado (film)
line_text: The BARTENDER is busy at the far end of the bar .

title: Silverado (film)
line_text: Paden is patiently waiting to get his attention when he hears a woman 's voice behind him , on his side of the bar .

title: Silverado (film)
line_text: What can I do you for , stranger ?

title: Silverado (film)
line_text: Paden turns to face his interlocutor , but at first can not find her .

title: Silverado (film)
line_text: After a moment , though , he looks down to see a small woman in a velvet dress-STELLA .

title: Silverado (film)
line_text: She is already moving away toward the near end of the bar .

title: Silverado (film)
line_text: He watches her disappear around the end , then sees the top of her head appear behind the bar down there .

title: Silverado (film)
line_text: As she moves back toward him , she gets taller and taller , until she is facing him eye to eye across the bar .

title: Silverado (film)
line_text: As she reaches under the bar and produces bottle and glass , Paden leans over and peeks behind the bar .

title: Silverado (film)
line_text: A foot-wide ramp runs the length of it .

title: Silverado (film)
line_text: The world is what you make of it , friend .

title: Silverado (film)
line_text: If it does n't fit , you make alterations .

title: Silverado (film)
line_text: Stella sets up a glass for herself , and they shake hands .

title: Silverado (film)
line_text: Paden looks up at a carved ornamental star on the back wall , over the words The Midnight Star .

title: Silverado (film)
line_text: Are you the midnight star herself ?

title: Silverado (film)
line_text: I 'm always there , but I only shine at night .

title: Silverado (film)
line_text: A saloon girl-a lovely , young , black woman-RAE passes with some drinks .

title: Silverado (film)
line_text: Paden watches her go , then looks around the room .

title: Silverado (film)
line_text: My compliments to you , Miss Stella .

title: Silverado (film)
line_text: This is what I call a saloon .

title: Silverado (film)
line_text: That 's what I call it too .

title: Silverado (film)
line_text: And I know what I 'm talking about .

title: Silverado (film)
line_text: It 's the only place I 'm happy .

title: Silverado (film)
line_text: Their eyes meet for a moment , and a real connection is made .

title: Silverado (film)
line_text: You would n't be needing any help around here , would you ?

title: Silverado (film)
line_text: You see that fellow over there in the gray coat ?

title: Silverado (film)
line_text: Paden nods , and now we see him too : a big man in some gambler-like finery-KELLY .

title: Silverado (film)
line_text: He is leaning over a poker game .

title: Silverado (film)
line_text: Yeah , aside from being a loud-mouthed , lying cheat , he 's just the man I would have picked .

title: Silverado (film)
line_text: Why 'd you go into business with him ?

title: Silverado (film)
line_text: I do n't own this place .

title: Silverado (film)
line_text: The man who does stuck me with Kelly .

title: Silverado (film)
line_text: Stella nods toward the door , and Paden turns to look .

title: Silverado (film)
line_text: Cobb enters through the swinging doors .

title: Silverado (film)
line_text: He looks around with a proprietary air as he walks to the bar .

title: Silverado (film)
line_text: He is almost there before his gaze settles on Paden and Stella .

title: Silverado (film)
line_text: He stops in his tracks , and a big grin splits his face .

title: Silverado (film)
line_text: Two of my favorite people in the world , talking to each other .

title: Silverado (film)
line_text: Cobb moves up and puts an arm around Paden as he shakes his hand .

title: Silverado (film)
line_text: Stella is interested in this connection , but she does n't faze easily .

title: Silverado (film)
line_text: Stella , this is one of my oldest surviving friends .

title: Silverado (film)
line_text: Oh , yeah , you two are going to get along fine .

title: Silverado (film)
line_text: You got a lot in common .

title: Silverado (film)
line_text: Cobb looks across the room and yells .

title: Silverado (film)
line_text: You did n't come all this way just to pay me back that money , did you ?

title: Silverado (film)
line_text: Give the man a line of credit .

title: Silverado (film)
line_text: He already owes the house thirteen bucks .

title: Silverado (film)
line_text: Kelly casts a wary , appraising glance over Paden , nods , and moves off .

title: Silverado (film)
line_text: You got a place to stay ?

title: Silverado (film)
line_text: Stella , we still got an extra room out back , do n't we ?

title: Silverado (film)
line_text: It 's not in use at the moment .

title: Silverado (film)
line_text: Cobb comes around the end of the bar to stand next to Stella .

title: Silverado (film)
line_text: What brings you into my saloon ?

title: Seven Seconds

title: Rizzoli and Isles
line_text: Jane and Frost face Warren Hoyt.

title: Rizzoli and Isles
line_text: He lifts his shackled hands to indicate his throat as a GUARD reacts.

title: Rizzoli and Isles

title: Rizzoli and Isles
line_text: But I will visit every goddamn day if you tell me who your friend is.

title: Rizzoli and Isles
line_text: Who killed Dr. Yeager and where's his wife?

title: Rizzoli and Isles
line_text: Hoyt MOTIONS for the PRISON GUARD.

title: Rizzoli and Isles

title: Rizzoli and Isles

title: Rizzoli and Isles
line_text: Like a caged but still powerful lion, he deftly shuffles to the door.

title: Rizzoli and Isles
line_text: You are right -- my friend is out there.

title: The Mist
line_text: 9 INT. OLLIE'S HOUSE / DINING ROOM - MEANWHILE

title: The Mist
line_text: OLLIE GARF (16), an awkward emo teenager, is finishing his dinner.

title: The Mist
line_text: He is in dark clothes, eyeliner, doesn't match the well kept, conservative dining room.

title: The Mist
line_text: There's silence at the table, even if his parents, DENNIS GARF (45) and SANDY GARF (38) are sitting there as well.

title: The Mist
line_text: He finds the courage to say something -

title: The Mist
line_text: I am meeting Billy at the game.

title: The Mist
line_text: Dennis stops chewing for a second, then continues.

title: The Mist
line_text: Sandy just looks at her plate.

title: The Mist
line_text: Then Dennis gets up, takes his plate, leaves the room.

title: The Mist
line_text: Sandy and Ollie sit for a beat.

title: The Mist
line_text: You know your father can't hear you when you are wearing make up.

title: The Mist
line_text: Then Sandy gets up, leaves Ollie alone at the table.

title: Invaders from Mars (1986 film)

line_text: She 's still in her white nurse 's uniform-beautiful .

title: Invaders from Mars (1986 film)
line_text: Every young boy 's vision of a protector .

title: Invaders from Mars (1986 film)
line_text: Jimmy looks down at his house .

title: Invaders from Mars (1986 film)
line_text: At that moment , a blue AIR FORCE PICKUP pulls up in front of Jimmy 's house .

title: Invaders from Mars (1986 film)
line_text: He gasps and jerks his head down .

title: Invaders from Mars (1986 film)
line_text: He and Linda peek through the bushes .

title: Invaders from Mars (1986 film)
line_text: As they watch , TWO AIR FORCE MEN go and knock at the front door of the house .

title: Invaders from Mars (1986 film)
line_text: The door is opened by Dad .

title: Invaders from Mars (1986 film)
line_text: He talks with them awhile-then POINTS up the hill-seemingly directed at Jimmy and Linda , which makes them duck back down .

title: Invaders from Mars (1986 film)
line_text: The AIR FORCE MEN start up the hill .

title: Invaders from Mars (1986 film)
line_text: They have some sort of detector with them that Jimmy can see .

title: Invaders from Mars (1986 film)
line_text: They sweep the ground as they walk .

title: Invaders from Mars (1986 film)
line_text: Closer now to the crest of the hill .

title: Invaders from Mars (1986 film)
line_text: As Jimmy and Linda watch , the two Air Force MEN reach the crest of the hill-and go down to the sand PIT .

title: Invaders from Mars (1986 film)
line_text: They fan out-walking out onto the sand .

title: Invaders from Mars (1986 film)
line_text: Suddenly-as Jimmy and Linda look on-the GROUND OPENS UP beneath one of the men .

title: Invaders from Mars (1986 film)
line_text: A VORTEX OF SAND under his feet-PULLING him-swiftly and wordlessly-DOWN .

title: Invaders from Mars (1986 film)
line_text: Turns swiftly-gets the same surprised look on his face .

title: Invaders from Mars (1986 film)
line_text: The sand SMOOTHS OVER as though it had never been disturbed .

title: Invaders from Mars (1986 film)
line_text: Linda and Jimmy look at each other .

title: Invaders from Mars (1986 film)
line_text: Jimmy and Linda-RUN for the car .

title: Powerless
line_text: I just said to put us "Back on the tracks" which is also the title of my memoir that Doubleday just purchased for seven figures.

line_text: I feel like that all the time.

title: Huge

title: Huge

line_text: Will stares at the ground with intensity, riveted to Ian's every word but so uncomfortable that she can't look at him.

title: Huge
line_text: There was this kid-- Kyle Biederman.

title: Huge
line_text: He was like-- the fat guy.

title: Huge
line_text: And I like clung to that.

title: Huge
line_text: I would always look at him, and think-- at least I am not him.

title: Huge

line_text: IAN swallows, nervous, glances over to

title: Huge

title: Huge
line_text: I could see us both in the mirror.

title: Huge
line_text: And I was as fat as him.

title: Huge
line_text: Ian stops himself from saying more.

title: Huge
line_text: You don't have to say much, just tell us a little about what brought you to camp.

title: Huge
line_text: And how do you feel about that?

title: Huge
line_text: I am used to them being jerks.

title: Huge
line_text: Look, I am down with my fat.

title: Huge
line_text: Me and my fat are like-- BFF.

title: Huge
line_text: Who says fat has to be this

title: Huge
line_text: A few hundred years ago, this was the hottest look on the block.

title: Huge
line_text: In some parts of the world, it still is.

title: Huge
line_text: It's our culture that's screwed up, not us.

title: Huge
line_text: Amber whispers something to Caitlin that we don't hear.

title: Huge
line_text: I agree, it's hurtful to put pressure on people, to conform to a certain look.

title: Huge
line_text: But there's also the question of health.

title: Huge
line_text: You want to tell me she's here for her health?

title: Huge

line_text: There's obviously a lot of emotion here.

title: Huge
line_text: --I want you all to start keeping a journal.

title: Huge
line_text: It's important to get your thoughts and feelings out.

title: Huge
line_text: So really, we could not write in them and you wouldn't know.

title: Huge
line_text: Like all the choices you make.

title: Huge
line_text: So-- nobody's mentioned what it's like to go without your favorite foods.

title: NOS4A2
line_text: Chris tugs on a chain-pull LIGHT fixture -- it illuminates a dust-caked, unfinished basement.

line_text: Chris leads Vic to an old PIANO, crumbling in a corner.

title: NOS4A2
line_text: He plays a few CHORDS -- broken hammers, long out of tune. (re: the piano)

title: NOS4A2
line_text: Chris takes a MILK CRATE down from the top of the instrument.

title: NOS4A2
line_text: I wanted to show you these.

title: NOS4A2
line_text: Vic picks up a notebook, flips through it... page after page of music and lyrics.

title: NOS4A2
line_text: I wanted to be a composer when I was your age.

title: NOS4A2
line_text: Thought I had go to music school when I got out of the service.

title: NOS4A2
line_text: Vic can guess the end of this story.

title: NOS4A2
line_text: Your mom got pregnant, I had to get a job, I couldn't do it.

title: NOS4A2
line_text: You are young, brilliant, and you are unencumbered.

title: NOS4A2
line_text: Vic throws her arms around Chris, hugs him.

title: NOS4A2
line_text: I only have one piece of advice.

title: NOS4A2
line_text: Don't get married and don't have any kids.

title: NOS4A2
line_text: But when she hugs Chris again, he glances at his towel-wrapped hand.

title: Heartbeat
line_text: A19 INT. ST. MATTHEWS - PATIENT CORRIDOR - DAY (D2)

title: Heartbeat
line_text: Pierce flies down the corridor in bloody scrubs, fresh out of the OR, followed by two adoring Young Female Interns.

title: Heartbeat
line_text: An Orderly pushes Pierce's Patient on a gurney past him.

title: Heartbeat
line_text: The woman is still out from the anesthesia.

title: Heartbeat
line_text: The operation went well Elana; you are gonna be fine...

title: Heartbeat
line_text: Pierces squeezes her hand as the Orderly pushes the gurney past, just as...

title: Heartbeat
line_text: Alex bursts out from around the corner, her head follows Pierce's patient as the gurney is rolled past.

title: Heartbeat
line_text: She had a six centimeter mass in her pancreas, but since I have done a few of those, I think she will be okay.

title: Heartbeat
line_text: The adoring Female Interns nod, agreeing with their hero Pierce.

title: Heartbeat
line_text: Alex lets her head fall against Pierce's chest.

title: Heartbeat
line_text: My patient has been waiting three months to transplant.

title: Heartbeat
line_text: He remembers something and calls out.

title: Heartbeat
line_text: Hey, call your mom; she called after you left this morning.

title: Heartbeat
line_text: She wants to go to the benefit with us.

title: Heartbeat
line_text: Because she's convinced George Clooney is coming.

title: Heartbeat
line_text: I told her he never shows up for these things; so she's not coming.

title: Heartbeat
line_text: But she did invite me to Sunday dinner.

title: Heartbeat
line_text: Of course she did; my mother adores you...

title: Heartbeat
line_text: Slightly more than your mother likes me.

title: Heartbeat
line_text: She thinks I come from the wrong side of the tracks.

title: Heartbeat
line_text: Dr. Callahan passes, shoving a huge deli sandwich into his mouth.

title: Heartbeat
line_text: Dr. Pants, you desire me in your OR today?

title: Heartbeat
line_text: Yeah, yeah, yeah, Callahan; the minute I get a heart.

title: Heartbeat
line_text: I work best when I am ripe, Pants.

title: Heartbeat
line_text: ON CALLAHAN as he is about to round the corner of the corridor when a pair of large hands once again come down on his shoulders, startling Callahan, who almost trips, but as we reveal Forester he steadies Callahan, then passes by.

title: Heartbeat
line_text: She tries to leave, but Pierce

title: Heartbeat
line_text: You wanna get away this weekend?

title: Heartbeat
line_text: They can come with us-- Like a "family" vacation.

title: Heartbeat
line_text: In fact, if I moved the rest of my stuff into your place, we had already be spending the weekend together.

title: Heartbeat
line_text: Alex looks at Pierce; this is a conversation they have had before and one she wants to avoid.

title: Heartbeat
line_text: Aren't I a good thing; all the sex you want and you don't have to put a ring on my finger?

title: Heartbeat
line_text: He looks at her; their eyes meet.

title: Heartbeat
line_text: His smile makes her knees almost buckle.

title: Heartbeat
line_text: And what about what it could be--?

title: Heartbeat
line_text: The moment is disrupted when Pierce suddenly gets a text.

title: Heartbeat
line_text: Look who got saved by a gastric ulcer.

title: Heartbeat
line_text: Alex stares after him and whispers:

title: Heartbeat
line_text: Pierce runs down the corridor, but looks back at her, flashing a sexy smile.

title: Heartbeat
line_text: She smiles back, a hint of sadness in her eyes.

title: Judge Dredd (film)
line_text: The CAMERA discovers the Mega-City Council of Judges , in mid-session CHIEF JUST ICE FARGO , 70 , sits at an elevated position at a great BLACK TABLE .

title: Judge Dredd (film)
line_text: Other Judges sit on either side of him .

title: Judge Dredd (film)
line_text: Among them are JUDGE MCGRUDER , a woman in her 60 's , open minded but with an iron will ; JUDGE ESPOSITO , 50 's , thoughtful , accommodating ; JUDGE YAMAMOTO , 50 's , short-tempered , yet fair ; and JUDGE GRIFFIN , 60 , with a mind and body as honed as men half his age , his clean features can hide much .

title: Judge Dredd (film)

title: Judge Dredd (film)
line_text: Hold on , Judge McGruder-let 's not blame the messenger !

title: Judge Dredd (film)
line_text: - Griffin has been trying to get us to swallow his crime package for two years now and I still have INDIGESTION-

title: Judge Dredd (film)
line_text: We sense that the room is evenly divided .

title: Judge Dredd (film)

title: Judge Dredd (film)
line_text: Everyone quiets as quickly as schoolchildren .

title: Judge Dredd (film)
line_text: As presiding Justice , I only vote to break a tie .

title: Judge Dredd (film)
line_text: But I wish to address the question of Judge Griffin 's crime package .

title: Judge Dredd (film)
line_text: This entire body owes its very existence to you , Chief Justice .

title: Judge Dredd (film)
line_text: I ca n't imagine anyone having an objection .

title: Judge Dredd (film)
line_text: CAMERA sweeps towards Fargo , passing over the MAP of North America etched on the great DAIS .

title: Judge Dredd (film)
line_text: Only a few lights stand out on all the continent : MEGA-CITY ONE ; MEGA-CITY TWO ; TEXAS CITY ; and the ASPEN PENAL COLONY .

title: Judge Dredd (film)
line_text: All the rest is labeled THE CURSED EARTH .

title: Judge Dredd (film)
line_text: Fargo stands , eyes blazing with intelligence and intensity .

title: Judge Dredd (film)
line_text: we sense t h at we are observing a Lion in Winter .

title: Judge Dredd (film)
line_text: And the lion can still roar .

title: Judge Dredd (film)
line_text: This body is not the first assembly to think that more laws and fewer choices will bring peace and order .

title: Judge Dredd (film)
line_text: That delusion has been tried and failed before .

title: Judge Dredd (film)
line_text: If the citizens of Mega-City are demanding more control of their lives , that 's not a threat-it 's a signal !

title: Judge Dredd (film)
line_text: A signal to open the windows of our society and let it breathe-.

title: Judge Dredd (film)
line_text: Not to bolt the door and throw away the key !

title: Judge Dredd (film)
line_text: My fellow Judges , I was barely in my teens when I put on this badge .

title: Judge Dredd (film)
line_text: When the time comes for me to take it off .

title: Judge Dredd (film)
line_text: knowing that it stood for Freedom .

title: Judge Dredd (film)

title: Judge Dredd (film)
line_text: Once again , Chief Justice , you have served as a moral compass for all of us .

line_text: Mike , watching his young friend , takes a long drag on his smoke ; this time he 's going to say something .

title: Second Sight
line_text: gaze, sees -- it is Anna Landholt sitting in the booth.

line_text: Bashevis watches him for a beat, then exits.

title: Second Sight
line_text: Tanner steps up to Anna in the booth.

title: Second Sight
line_text: I am surprised to see you here.

title: Second Sight
line_text: This is where I first met Mark.

title: Second Sight
line_text: It's how I want to remember him.

title: Second Sight
line_text: (re: Tanner) Anna's seductive quality holds Tanner.

title: Second Sight
line_text: He doesn't move, his gaze locked on her.

title: Second Sight
line_text: He places his cell on the table.

title: Second Sight
line_text: Anna holds on the cell, ready to talk.

title: Second Sight
line_text: I want to know what happened to Mark... even if I am the one responsible.

title: Second Sight
line_text: How would you describe your relationship?

title: Second Sight
line_text: Anna grins, knows where he's going with this.

title: Second Sight
line_text: A wonderful person who entertained a college girl's curiosity.

title: Second Sight
line_text: Was she jealous of you and Mark?

title: Second Sight
line_text: She said you made a phone call to Mark during the bachelor party.

title: Second Sight
line_text: She put it somewhere between five and ten minutes.

title: Second Sight
line_text: I called to say I loved him.

title: Second Sight
line_text: She sips her drink, recites with a bitter snicker --

title: Second Sight
line_text: Where is the little girl when not awake?

title: Second Sight
line_text: Victorious and glorious in her dream state.

title: Second Sight
line_text: Did the sleepwalking begin after your sister died?

title: Second Sight
line_text: But I do remember that evening, waking up at the edge of the swamp on our estate, my father screaming my name, then seeing the police, an ambulance... and then the news that little Vida had drowned in the bathtub.

title: Second Sight
line_text: An externally beautiful woman with a fondness for gin and a deep resentment of motherhood.

title: Second Sight
line_text: I haven't seen her since she was released from prison.

title: Second Sight
line_text: But I do receive a somewhat disturbing birthday card every year.

title: Second Sight
line_text: Just got one for my 27th last week, in fact.

title: Second Sight
line_text: Maybe you will find her and we can have a nice Landholt family reunion.

title: Second Sight
line_text: She finishes her drink, motions to Jenny for another.

title: Second Sight
line_text: Fredrick has always treated me like something out of his beloved art collection -- a possession -- more than as a daughter.

title: Second Sight
line_text: I don't have many cuddly memories with daddy.

title: Second Sight
line_text: Jenny places Anna's drink down, goes back to the bar.

title: Second Sight
line_text: Anna holds on Jenny for a beat, comes back to Tanner.

title: Second Sight
line_text: Have you ever had a dream where something demonic enters your room and tries to suffocate you?

title: Second Sight
line_text: Tanner finds the question odd, but...

title: Second Sight
line_text: I started having the dream as a child... almost every night.

title: Second Sight
line_text: You understand pain and loneliness, Detective.

title: Second Sight
line_text: Tanner holds -- she's getting too close to something.

title: Second Sight
line_text: WE CUT TO: TANNER'S POV: Like how it happened with SCOUT, the world around Anna Landholt falls away.

title: Second Sight
line_text: She seems to move forward, away from the blurs of the background.

title: Second Sight
line_text: Her skin tone, the colors of her clothes and hair, all become super vivid.

title: Second Sight
line_text: In fact, I believe you see the world through your loneliness...

title: Second Sight
line_text: He gently pulls his hand away.

title: The Umbrella Academy

title: The Umbrella Academy

title: The Umbrella Academy

title: Class 11

title: Class 11

title: BONUS - Billy the Kid 1x02

title: Detour
line_text: Michael is sitting on the grass.

title: Detour
line_text: He is typing away feverishly on his laptop.

title: Detour
line_text: He looks up and sees Gabrielle, Professor Zaring's T.A. He quickly stands and races after her.

title: Detour
line_text: He uses his hands to frame his face like the SLIDER in the door.

title: Detour
line_text: And I know WHO you are.

title: Detour
line_text: Why would you assume that's a compliment?

title: Detour
line_text: Could you do me a favor?

title: Detour
line_text: Listen, I am gonna spare you the whole "you come into this school on an act of whimsy" speech.

title: Detour
line_text: I am not going to use the terms "making a mockery" or "special treatment" or mention those of us who have had to struggle to earn the right to be here or the deserving students you are supplanting by being here.

title: Detour
line_text: First of all, I had like to thank you for not using those phrases.

title: Detour
line_text: But, let me assure you, like all those ladies on The Bachelor, I am here for "the right reasons."

title: Detour
line_text: And I just want to be like anyone else.

title: Detour
line_text: A STUDENT FAN jumps in front of her, gushes at Michael.

title: Detour
line_text: Can I get a picture with you?

title: Detour
line_text: Get the clock tower in the background.

title: Detour
line_text: And if you tweet this, hashtag it #GETTIN'BACKINZARING'SCLASS, all caps, so it pops...

title: Detour
line_text: He quickly poses and chases after her.

title: Detour
line_text: Could you just get me in to talk to Professor Zaring?

title: Detour
line_text: I would do anything for you.

title: Detour
line_text: In Fact, I probably would have done anything for you anyway, I have a terrible weakness for girls with glasses and then you are a Ph.D. student, so like, forget about it, right...?

title: Detour
line_text: This act probably kills with the fangirls and the interns down at Radio Disney, so please keep it fresh for them.

title: Detour
line_text: Bottom line, you have missed both classes this week.

title: Detour
line_text: No one's ever gotten back in after that.

title: Detour
line_text: Okay, on ONE level that makes it more exciting.

title: Detour
line_text: But on another, it is simply not fair.

title: Detour
line_text: I am in the middle of composing a very strongly worded complaint.

title: Detour
line_text: And if forced to, I will send it to my faculty advisor.

title: Detour
line_text: I have one of those, right?

title: Detour
line_text: And I would LOVE to see you do that.

title: Detour
line_text: There's also a party in my dorm.

title: Detour
line_text: The girl throwing it is super organized.

title: Sleepy Hollow
line_text: Dunn indicates a pattern of CHARRED FOOTPRINTS leading from the entry to the rear exit.

line_text: Abbie trails behind, looks at the prints, then forensics zipping up Knapp in a body bag, then the BROKEN CHAINS on the ground...

title: Sleepy Hollow
line_text: Arson found burn marks in the floor in the shape of footprints, size 11, the intruder scorched the tile and wood wherever he stepped.

line_text: You saying the killer was on fire?

line_text: Looks like someone tore them down --

title: Sleepy Hollow
line_text: That ceiling's gotta be thirty feet off the ground -- no way someone could get up there.

line_text: This wasn't random -- he came here for Knapp.

line_text: As that LANDS, Abbie doesn't realize that out the door BEHIND HER... CRANE APPEARS, walking across the graveyard:

title: Sleepy Hollow
line_text: What the hell is he doing here?

line_text: Crane was in my custody when this happened, which means he's not the killer

title: Sleepy Hollow
line_text: Dunn, concerned for her, gestures to the rest of the team: everyone walk away.

title: Sleepy Hollow
line_text: They do, leaving Abbie and Mendez:

title: Sleepy Hollow
line_text: Sir, we have three DOA's and no viable leads.

title: Sleepy Hollow
line_text: Someone's on a killing spree and that man's our best chance of catching him --

title: Sleepy Hollow
line_text: That man needs a straight jacket, and you violated a direct order by bringing him here --

title: Sleepy Hollow
line_text: Maybe he is crazy -- or maybe, as you know, witnesses of a violent crime sometimes enter a dissociative state that breaks them from reality as an emotional response to trauma.

title: Sleepy Hollow
line_text: He saw something, something that might help us --

title: Sleepy Hollow
line_text: What are you suggesting, that we give the Founding Father a Glock and send him into the field with a pat on the back and a thumbs up?

title: Sleepy Hollow
line_text: I am suggesting he might recognize details we wouldn't even know to look for.

title: Sleepy Hollow
line_text: Forget the asylum, just take him back to his cell immediately, or you are suspended until further notice.

title: Sleepy Hollow
line_text: With that, he goes, leaving her there.

title: Sleepy Hollow
line_text: You are hanging yourself with this guy, Abbie, it's a big mistake.

title: Sleepy Hollow
line_text: What the hell are you doing?

title: Sleepy Hollow
line_text: And she exits, leaving Dunn to watch her go, concerned...

title: Sleepy Hollow
line_text: AT AN ORNATE HEADSTONE: Crane already there, eyes fixed.

title: Sleepy Hollow
line_text: I told you to stay in the car --

title: Sleepy Hollow
line_text: Yet as you know, I am insane, and therefore impervious to simple commands.

line_text: She follows his gaze to the NAME and INSCRIPTION...

title: Sleepy Hollow
line_text: and what she sees STUNS her: "Here lieth the duft of MATRON KATRINA CRANE, BURNT AS A WITCH..."

line_text: Abbie SWEEPS foliage off the bottom of the nameplate to reveal -- "...SURVIVED BY HER BELOVED SON THOMAS CRANE."

title: Sleepy Hollow
line_text: He just stares at the name, stunned, EMOTIONAL.

title: Sleepy Hollow
line_text: (eyes well; the first time he's said it out loud) ...

title: Sleepy Hollow
line_text: Crane, dying, in the church with Katrina:

title: Sleepy Hollow
line_text: Whatever secret you wished to tell me when I returned from the front...

title: Sleepy Hollow
line_text: Abbie's voice brings him back to PRESENT:

title: Sleepy Hollow
line_text: Abbie watches him suffer, unsure if she can console him without fully believing him.

title: Sleepy Hollow
line_text: C amon, we should both get a few hours of sleep.

title: Sleepy Hollow
line_text: I have been asleep for two centuries.

title: Sleepy Hollow
line_text: A lot of good it's done me.

title: Sleepy Hollow
line_text: What more do you need to believe me?

title: Sleepy Hollow
line_text: It doesn't matter what I believe.

title: Sleepy Hollow
line_text: How the hell am I supposed to explain it?

title: Sleepy Hollow
line_text: I have identified the killer, and he just happens to be the First Horseman of the

title: Sleepy Hollow
line_text: Apocalypse -- trust me, it's all in this dusty book we found in a cave library..."

title: Sleepy Hollow
line_text: You witnessed your partner's murder with your own eyes --

title: Sleepy Hollow
line_text: Even if I thought what I saw was possible, I will be... alone.

title: Sleepy Hollow
line_text: Arguing a case I don't understand, based on something I thought I saw, with evidence that makes no sense --

title: Sleepy Hollow
line_text: She starts moving toward the car again -- he REALIZES:

title: Sleepy Hollow
line_text: Something happened to you, didn't it ... something that's made you doubt your perceptions.

title: Sleepy Hollow
line_text: We have more in common than you think: I come from a world where we took our cues by looking someone in the eye.

title: Sleepy Hollow
line_text: I suspect it's what makes you a skilled investigator, but this act of controlling the unexplainable is a desperate one rooted in fear.

title: Sleepy Hollow
line_text: Perhaps that's why you are leaving this place --

title: Sleepy Hollow
line_text: Hey: I don't need to be psychoanalyzed or-- whatever your version of it is -- brain leeched -- by a man who thinks that only yesterday he was fighting for George Washington in the Revolutionary War.

title: Sleepy Hollow
line_text: He's hita NERVE. She arrives at the car, opens the door.

title: The Goodwin Games
line_text: Coney sits with GARY, the douchey 23-year-old club manager.

title: The Goodwin Games
line_text: Gary, please, you can't fire her.

title: The Goodwin Games
line_text: Sure, she has trouble with the whole

title: The Goodwin Games
line_text: you can't wave to Criss Angel if you are holding a tray full of drinks thing, but she's sweet and she's trying so hard.

title: The Goodwin Games
line_text: Why, given the choice, would I fire the 22-year-old with the ginormous cans?

title: The Goodwin Games
line_text: You, sir, have a ginormous heart.

title: The Goodwin Games
line_text: She starts listening to a voicemail, and looks shocked.

title: This Is 40

title: Observe and Report

title: Observe and Report

title: Dexter (episode)
line_text: It 's a beautiful , warm Sunday afternoon and the boat is anchored in the lazy bay .

title: Dexter (episode)
line_text: A bin filled with freshly caught RED SNAPPERS sits behind-HARRY (50 's) , Dexter 's foster father-a diamond in the rough , tough exterior , but soft at heart-pulls a flask out of his pants pocket , slowly unscrews the top , downs a slug of booze , then slips the flask back into his pants .

title: Dexter (episode)
line_text: YOUNG DEXTER (12) watches his father very carefully , then picks up a small bottle of milk , unscrews the top , takes a sip , screws the top back on , then tries to slip it into his pants-just like his father , but it does n't fit so he sets it aside .

title: Dexter (episode)
line_text: Harry stares into nothingness-then turns to his adopted son and says very softly , simply-

title: Dexter (episode)
line_text: You 're different , are n't you , Dexter ?

title: Dexter (episode)
line_text: Dexter swallows hard , looks nervously at his dad .

title: Dexter (episode)
line_text: That dog was a noisy little creep , Pop .

title: Dexter (episode)
line_text: He was barking all night and Mom could n't sleep and she 's very , very sick and that lousy dog was yapping at every leaf that blew down the sidewalk .

title: Dexter (episode)
line_text: There were a lot of bones in there , Dexter and .

title: Dexter (episode)
line_text: How long have you been doing this , son ?

title: Dexter (episode)
line_text: Dexter looks away then looks back into his father 's eyes .

title: Dexter (episode)
line_text: About a year and a half .

title: Dexter (episode)
line_text: Harry stares at little Dexter , then slowly drapes his arm around his son and pulls him close .

title: Dexter (episode)
line_text: And as they stare into the river water , we 're suddenly-

title: Cobb (film)
line_text: Like an out of control bobsled-Cobb races and Stump hangs on for his life .

title: Cobb (film)
line_text: After World War Two , General Patton asked me for an autograph-he said he patterned himself after me !

title: Cobb (film)
line_text: 'Cause I 'm trying to have a good grip on things when this car goes over the next cliff !

title: Cobb (film)
line_text: I ai n't ready to die yet !

title: Cobb (film)
line_text: Cobb 's tone changes suddenly-he questions Stump with-out guile or anger , as if his answer is obvious .

title: Cobb (film)
line_text: Cobb stares at Stump , waiting for an answer , and forgets about the road .

title: Cobb (film)
line_text: Stump looks up in fear and points at the road .

title: Cobb (film)
line_text: Cobb swerves wildly back onto the road , such as it exists in the blizzard .

title: Cobb (film)
line_text: I said I 'm not ready to die .

title: Cobb (film)
line_text: But you 're not listening to me !

title: Cobb (film)
line_text: I may have every God damn disease known to man but I am never going to check into a hospital because I am alive and I am going to get laid in Reno !

title: Cobb (film)
line_text: You 're gon na get laid , too , Stumpy !

title: Cobb (film)
line_text: Maybe I do n't wanta get laid !

title: Cobb (film)
line_text: We 're in the middle of a .

title: Cobb (film)
line_text: Is that why you do n't wanta get laid in Reno ?

title: Cobb (film)
line_text: 'Cause you 're feeling loyal to a woman you 're divorcing ?

title: Cobb (film)
line_text: Is that why you used to wine and dine that little brunette who had an office across the courtyard from you in Santa Barbara ?

title: Cobb (film)
line_text: What do you know about her ?!

title: Cobb (film)
line_text: I know where the bodies are buried .

title: Cobb (film)
line_text: Hey , no need to defend yourself .

title: Cobb (film)
line_text: When it comes to women I 'm a total shit-the difference is , Stumpy , that I know I 'm a shit .

title: Cobb (film)
line_text: And that part about me being a shit with women ?

title: Cobb (film)
line_text: That ai n't gon na be in the book .

title: Cobb (film)
line_text: I got ta put your family in my book .

title: Cobb (film)
line_text: And nothing about my ex-wives or children are gon na be in it .

title: Soundtrack
line_text: Sam drives down alleyways, main avenues, side streets, looking for Barry.

title: Soundtrack
line_text: And then he screeches to a stop, because in an alley he sees Barry walking, like nothing in the world is wrong.

title: Soundtrack
line_text: He reverses the car fast, yells out the window:

line_text: Barry jumps as Sam leaps out of the car.

title: Emily Owens, MD

title: Emily Owens, MD
line_text: To reveal Cassandra and Emily watching this interaction from behind the window.

line_text: Okay, that look on your face?

title: Emily Owens, MD
line_text: That's the reason I didn't tell anyone in high school.

title: Emily Owens, MD
line_text: And just because I had a sick brother doesn't mean I am not a bitch.

title: Emily Owens, MD
line_text: Despite themselves, the girls share a smile.

title: Reckless
line_text: Efficient one-bag business travelers locked in a passive-aggressive death match with families laden like Sherpas.

title: Reckless
line_text: In the line we find DAVID RITTER (late 20's).

title: Reckless
line_text: He's good- looking, pleasant, if a bit guarded.

title: Reckless
line_text: He puts his shoes, cell phone, keys, belt in a bin with an almost practiced meticulousness -- as if he spent last night laying in bed rehearsing every move... which he did.

title: Reckless
line_text: David unzips his computer bag and lays it flat on the conveyor belt.

title: Reckless
line_text: Computer out of the bag, sir.

title: Reckless
line_text: All computers need to be out of their cases.

title: Reckless
line_text: I am an engineer, I know how this machine works.

title: Reckless
line_text: It's not that David is OCD or crazy or obstinate.

title: Reckless
line_text: He actually does know how things work.

title: Reckless
line_text: It's a point of pride with him.

title: Reckless
line_text: And it irritates him when other people don't.

title: Reckless
line_text: Do I need to ask you to step out of line?

title: Reckless
line_text: David's debating whether this is a fight worth having when we suddenly hear the sound of Karen Carpenter singing "Close to You" coming from the x-ray machine.

title: Reckless
line_text: He's met by the dull, implacable stare of the TSA guy.

title: Reckless
line_text: As David hurriedly pulls his computer from its case, Karen Carpenter takes us to:

title: Alphaville
line_text: Tashjian is parked behind his desk doing paperwork as a highly agitated Steven goes on and on in a verbal spew.

title: Alphaville
line_text: Sarah - WHO SPORTS A BRUISE ON THE SIDE OF HER FACE AND WILL FOR THE REST OF THE EPISODE - is off to one side.

title: Alphaville
line_text: We have to do something, and we have to do it now!

title: Alphaville
line_text: This has to look like spontaneous community action.

title: Alphaville
line_text: The people are on our side, and the politicians have to know that.

title: Alphaville
line_text: Histrionics aside, what is it that you actually want?

title: Alphaville
line_text: I want to call attention to what's going on.

title: Alphaville
line_text: I want to raise money for a defense fund for David...

title: Alphaville
line_text: If you want money why don't you call Lina?

title: Alphaville
line_text: Have your tried getting Lina on the phone lately?

title: Alphaville
line_text: We need to make a statement and get media attention.

title: Alphaville
line_text: They pulled David off the street for nothing, next time they could pull me!

title: Alphaville
line_text: What would the world do without your little cable show, and what would you do with all that publicity?

title: Alphaville
line_text: You make serious money off the backs of artists.

title: Alphaville
line_text: You should be the first one to help out.

title: Alphaville
line_text: Tashjian stares at Steven for a moment, then casually looks down to some papers he was reading as if Steven is no longer even present.

title: Alphaville
line_text: As though there were great effort involved, Nicky returns his attention to Steven.

title: Alphaville
line_text: And this is worthy of my time and attention why?

title: Alphaville
line_text: The event is yours, whatever press there is leads with your name...

title: Alphaville
line_text: And nobody else could put something like this together.

title: Alphaville
line_text: Not in a couple of days.

title: Alphaville
line_text: Satisfied that the event is sufficiently about him, Tashjian screams to Sarah literally startling her.

title: Alphaville
line_text: Do I have to fucking think for you, too?

title: Pretty Little Liars - The Perfectionists
line_text: INT. ALISON'S OFFICE - B.H.U. - BACK TO PRESENT (N3)

line_text: She can't rat out Granger or the deal will be off and #Nova will be exposed.

line_text: Maybe you should talk to Granger about it.

line_text: Ali looks for another way in.

line_text: The authorities are still looking for your dad?

line_text: A man smart enough to embezzle millions of dollars from his clients isn't going to be found.

title: Kafka (film)
line_text: Kafka is in another section of the building , finding his way through a department he 's vaguely unfamiliar with .

title: Kafka (film)
line_text: He searches out a particular person-a strikingly beautiful woman with flaming hair and wild eyes .

title: Kafka (film)
line_text: GABRIELA looks around from a file cabinet .

title: Kafka (film)
line_text: I 'm Kafka-I work upstairs in Accident-

line_text: You 're a friend of Eduard Raban 's .

title: Kafka (film)
line_text: Oh-well , I thought he once mentioned-

line_text: He follows her to a counter where someone stamps the document she thrusts forward without even glancing at her or it .

title: Kafka (film)
line_text: I 'm sorry , but I just wondered-

title: Kafka (film)
line_text: Excuse me , I have to copy this for Central Docketing by 2:30 .

title: Kafka (film)
line_text: Kafka watches her go-then notices some smarmy young clerks giggling over what they suppose was a romantic rebuff .

title: Havoc
line_text: EXT. TENNIS COURTS - AFTERNOON - LATER THAT DAY

title: Havoc
line_text: Jay stretches with Colin, who is dressed in 70's TENNIS GEAR, short shorts and headband, like he's in a Wes Anderson movie.

title: Havoc
line_text: Okay, little jog to warm up.

title: Havoc
line_text: Hang on, I am allergic to grass.

title: Havoc
line_text: In case we ever get near grass.

title: Havoc
line_text: Jay starts lightly jogging around the court with Colin.

title: Havoc
line_text: Colin gets halfway around and stops, hands on knees, breathing hard.

title: Havoc
line_text: -- Jay hits a ball to Colin.

title: Havoc
line_text: He flinches as it bounces off of him.

title: Havoc
line_text: He swats at it like he's trying to kill a fly.

title: Havoc
line_text: -- Jay shows Colin how to hit a ball.

title: Havoc
line_text: -- Close on Colin on his back on the court, breathing hard.

title: Havoc
line_text: I have a question about something while I am resting.

title: Havoc
line_text: How do you start talking to women?

title: Havoc
line_text: You just walk up and say hi.

title: Havoc
line_text: Because when I see Darcy, I get all, I can't make thoughts come out.

title: Havoc
line_text: If you train really hard, you can ask me anything you want.

title: Havoc
line_text: Do you want to touch Darcy Silverberg's boobs or do you want to die a virgin?

title: Havoc
line_text: What do boobs have to do with virginity?

title: Havoc
line_text: I am supposed to put it in the boobs, too?!

title: Havoc
line_text: -- Colin struggles to do one push-up as Jay yells at him.

title: Havoc
line_text: -- A ball machine fires balls at a scared Colin.

title: Havoc
line_text: -- Colin swings and finally connects with a ball.

title: Havoc
line_text: It flies over the fence, home run.

title: The Finest
line_text: 15 EXT. MYNX ROOFTOP CLUB - MANHATTAN - NIGHT

title: The Finest
line_text: A high-end club with a 360 degree view of the Midtown skyline.

title: The Finest
line_text: Waiters and Waitresses serve appetizers and drinks.

title: The Finest
line_text: Lena, stunning in designer black and showing off her Tina-Turner- fit legs is joined by her fashionably-dressed sisters, Anise and Nicole  who currently sports a butterfly bandage on her cheek.

title: The Finest
line_text: The Kendrick Clan  family, friends and colleagues have gathered to celebrate Lena's promotion.

title: The Finest
line_text: ELLA, in uniform and on duty, JOINS THE PARTY via FACE TIME FROM

title: The Finest
line_text: Three champagne glasses, oozing foam, raised for a toast.

title: The Finest
line_text: Veasey Holmes Sisters/Queens 2nd revised Network Draft 1/18/189.

title: The Finest
line_text: First African-American female to achieve that title.

title: The Finest
line_text: We are all so proud of you.

title: The Finest
line_text: Just knew Ms. Thang had something to say.

title: The Finest
line_text: To my big sister, who appreciates the finer things in life.

title: The Finest
line_text: If not for her expensive taste and fat paycheck we had all be at Al's Pizzeria.

title: The Finest
line_text: And here's to all the perks, cuz my girl's the boss.

title: The Finest
line_text: Lena smiles and shakes her head.

title: The Finest
line_text: How much has Anise had to drink?

title: Carnival Row
line_text: Woosh - she BLOWS OUT THE CANDLE - and but a moment later comes the SOUND of the door opening behind her.

title: Carnival Row
line_text: She turns to regard the frazzled figure that's just stepped into her shop.

title: Carnival Row
line_text: The Haruspex's face registers mild surprise.

title: Carnival Row
line_text: As if maybe it wasn't a Pix she was expecting but someone else.

title: Carnival Row
line_text: She affects as conversational a tone as she can manage.

title: Carnival Row
line_text: My Mistress would have this refilled.

title: Carnival Row
line_text: She steps closer and proffers the Haruspex the vial.

title: Carnival Row
line_text: Who sniffs it and grunts with recognition.

title: Carnival Row
line_text: I trust your Mistress knows what she's trifling with...

title: Carnival Row
line_text: The Haruspex waves the question off and shuffles to the counter, starts gathering various bottles, jars and vials.

title: Carnival Row
line_text: As she works, she uses the opportunity to study Vignette further.

title: Carnival Row
line_text: Said casually, as if just making conversation.

title: Carnival Row
line_text: Didn't realize my accent was that conspicuous...

title: Carnival Row
line_text: The Haruspex probes as she continues working, masking her intent with feigned chattiness.

title: Carnival Row
line_text: Tell me - why did you come?

title: Carnival Row
line_text: Why does anyone - to stay alive.

title: Carnival Row
line_text: But you are not just anyone.

title: Carnival Row
line_text: Is this the part where you try to sell me something?

title: Carnival Row
line_text: I had rather a strong stomach.

title: Carnival Row
line_text: Perhaps there's more in store for you here than you know.

title: Carnival Row
line_text: Vignette shrugs, she's not the sort to buy into false hope.

title: Carnival Row
line_text: Vignette hands her the two guilders Imogen provided her.

title: Carnival Row
line_text: The Haruspex makes change, comes around from behind the counter.

title: Carnival Row
line_text: She places her HAND TO VIGNETTE'S BACK and gently guides her toward the door, deftly using her razor-sharp fingernail to SNIP A LOCK OF HAIR without Vignette feeling a thing.

title: Carnival Row
line_text: Said with a friendly lilt as she closes the door behind her.

title: Carnival Row
line_text: Clutching her prize, the old witch allows herself a small smile of satisfaction...

title: Juicy Stories
line_text: A New York City showroom; grown-up and professional.

title: Juicy Stories
line_text: Sleek silver racks display clothing from "up and coming" designers.

title: Juicy Stories
line_text: CELIA and CLEO, (40's) in business attire are behind a desk.

title: Juicy Stories
line_text: The doors burst open and Pam and Gela enter wearing matching BRIGHTLY COLORED Juicy T-shirts, tennis skirts and knee socks with high heels.

title: Juicy Stories
line_text: They are pushing a cheap WHEELING RACK hung with many, many garment bags.

title: Juicy Stories
line_text: They are excited... and a little out of breath.

title: Juicy Stories
line_text: I am shocked we made it - but we did.

title: Juicy Stories
line_text: We pushed this all the way from Los Angeles - - not really

title: Juicy Stories
line_text: but, it felt like it - going all the way from the hotel to Seventh avenue.

title: Juicy Stories
line_text: I don't know how you survive in New York without a car.

title: Juicy Stories
line_text: Cleo and Celia are quite stunned by their entrance.

title: Juicy Stories
line_text: I am going to have to call you back.

title: Juicy Stories
line_text: I am Pam, and this is Gela.

title: Juicy Stories
line_text: You girls look exactly like you sounded on the phone.

title: Juicy Stories
line_text: We are super psyched you agreed to work with us.

title: Juicy Stories
line_text: Well, we usually represent more established designers, but your enthusiasm sold us.

title: Juicy Stories
line_text: I know, I know, we are like crazy phone stalkers.

title: Juicy Stories
line_text: What was it, like, ten calls?

title: Juicy Stories

title: Minority Report

title: Minority Report
line_text: No wonder you are not in the database.

title: Minority Report

title: Minority Report

title: 50-50 (2011 film)
line_text: Adam and Seth are seated in a semi-circle with a half dozen middle aged men and women .

title: 50-50 (2011 film)
line_text: At the front of the group is the LAUGHTER THERAPIST (50)-a short man with a long greying pony tail and a thick beard .

title: 50-50 (2011 film)
line_text: All eyes are closed except for Seth and Adam 's .

title: 50-50 (2011 film)
line_text: Before we begin I 'd like to introduce Adam and Seth , our two newest giggle gurus .

title: 50-50 (2011 film)
line_text: Adam and Seth look around paranoid .

title: 50-50 (2011 film)
line_text: Seth and Adam laugh along with the others .

title: 50-50 (2011 film)
line_text: Now what you 'll soon discover is the true miracle and gift of laughter .

title: 50-50 (2011 film)
line_text: Learning to laugh at ourselves and others through non-judgemental means is far more effective than any prescription drug , or , rehabilitation center .

title: 50-50 (2011 film)
line_text: You see , when we laugh , our bodies release endorphins that not only support the immune system , but also release deeply stored emotional pain , and give us a fresh new outlook on life .

title: 50-50 (2011 film)
line_text: The Laugh Therapist opens his eyes and stares intensely at Adam and then Seth .

title: 50-50 (2011 film)
line_text: We do n't tell jokes here , we tell the truth-and we laugh at that truth .

title: 50-50 (2011 film)
line_text: The Laughter Therapist closes his eyes .

title: 50-50 (2011 film)
line_text: Adam , why do n't you tell us what brings you here ?

title: 50-50 (2011 film)
line_text: Adam looks around in fear of saying the wrong thing .

title: 50-50 (2011 film)
line_text: We 're all friends here in the Laughter Pagoda .
