title: The Expanse
line_text: INT. MAIN CAGE ELEVATOR - MINUTES LATER

title: The Expanse
line_text: Battered -- everything in this ship is.

title: The Expanse
line_text: Holden rides down, sipping that coffee with hatred.

title: The Expanse
line_text: Chief Engineer NAOMI NAGATA (30), and her right-hand AMOS BURTON (24), step on.

title: The Expanse
line_text: Both wear overalls covered in old hydraulic fluid, but that's where the similarities end.

title: The Expanse
line_text: Naomi is exceptionally lithe, well over six feet tall, with startling pale blue eyes -- the identifying marks of "Belters".

title: The Expanse
line_text: Her ocean of black curls (African genes mixed with her Asian predominance way back when) are tied into a tail.

title: The Expanse
line_text: ( "Belters": the term for humans born in reduced gravity on the asteroid-belt colonies.

title: The Expanse
line_text: Hence many of them have elongated body forms, but ALL have a distinct cerulean eye color  the result of a dearth of natural sunlight. )

title: The Expanse
line_text: Amos, who looks part Boy Scout, part mugger, is Earth-born, short, and stocky as a Marine.

title: The Expanse
line_text: He wears a pin on his overalls -- a smiley face with devil horns.

title: The Expanse
line_text: Just follow the reek of whiskey.

title: The Expanse
line_text: Amos shrugs, as Naomi holds up a comms-unit screen at him.

title: The Expanse
line_text: Holden looks suspiciously at the phone-sized device.

title: The Expanse
line_text: You were at the officers meeting.

title: The Expanse
line_text: She sighs with an accompanying hand-flip gesture signaling casual disgust (the hand gestures are a cultural trait of Belters, left over from the days of space suits with poor comms).

title: The Expanse
line_text: A petition to overhaul this rust- bucket before it breaks apart.

title: The Expanse
line_text: If Naomi says it will, you can take it to the bank --

title: The Expanse
line_text: Listen kids, I have been here a bit longer than you.

title: The Expanse
line_text: It's way cheaper for the company to settle up with a few widows, than to overhaul this old barge.

title: The Expanse
line_text: Besides, the 'Cant' is a legend for her scars.

title: The Expanse
line_text: She's seen it all -- and she will see it all again before she's done.

title: The Expanse
line_text: The elevator sputters, and Holden messes with the control panel.

title: The Expanse
line_text: She bangs on the panel once, in just the right spot, and the elevator instantly returns to life.

title: The Expanse
line_text: ...you must tell me the amazing story of how you managed to become a second officer.

title: The Expanse
line_text: He smiles and steps through the gaping doors.

title: Star Trek: The Motion Picture

line_text: Menacing and yet strangely beautiful , both at the same time .

title: Star Trek: The Motion Picture

title: Star Trek: The Motion Picture
line_text: All digest the dimensions , as : ANGLE ON THE BRIDGE ELEVATOR DOORS opening to admit McCoy and Chekov , whose face and hands are taut with plastiskin applications .

title: Star Trek: The Motion Picture
line_text: Seeing the object on the viewer (O.S. at this ANGLE) , Chekov 's eyes open with wide astonishment .

title: Star Trek: The Motion Picture
line_text: He crosses quickly to his weapons-defense station , his eyes on the viewer .

title: Star Trek: The Motion Picture
line_text: McCoy , eyes also fixed on the sight , moves to Kirk 's side .

title: Star Trek: The Motion Picture
line_text: It could hold a crew of tens of thousands !

title: Star Trek: The Motion Picture
line_text: Or just one thousand , ten miles tall .

title: Star Trek: The Motion Picture
line_text: ACROSS KIRK TO SPOCK (This will be the first time we 've seen Spock dislay-ing a definite reaction , almost an emotion .)

title: Star Trek: The Motion Picture
line_text: So engrossed is Spock in the main viewer IMAGE that he appears not to have heard Kirk , whose AD LIBS a sharp Mr. Spock !

title: Star Trek: The Motion Picture
line_text: Spock looks absently at Kirk an instant , then :

title: Star Trek: The Motion Picture
line_text: That vessel is generating a forcefield measurably greater than the radiation of the Earth 's sun .

title: Star Trek: The Motion Picture
line_text: Transmit image of the Alien to Starfleet ; advise we are attempting further communication .

title: Star Trek: The Motion Picture
line_text: Unable to make contact with Starfleet .

title: Star Trek: The Motion Picture
line_text: Our transmissions out of the Cloud are being reflected back .

title: Star Trek: The Motion Picture
line_text: Distance to object now seventy-thousand kilometers .

title: Star Trek: The Motion Picture
line_text: We 're closing in on it rapidly , Captain .

title: Star Trek: The Motion Picture
line_text: Concern reflected on the faces of others too .

title: Bionic Woman

line_text: Bjorn is shocked...but still calm enough to draw out his hunting knife.

title: The Vikings
line_text: Bjorn...this is my dear friend Floki.

title: The Vikings
line_text: FLOKI rips off his mask, and grins.

title: The Vikings
line_text: He has a strange, mischievous, almost ageless face, ugly but animated, with bright, piercing eyes.

title: The Vikings
line_text: You have your father's eyes - unfortunately.

title: The Vikings
line_text: It means he will be like you.

title: The Vikings
line_text: And therefore he will want to do better than you.

line_text: And you will hate him for it.

line_text: How can you tell that by just looking at my face?

title: The Vikings
line_text: I can tell which trees will make the best planks just by looking at them.

title: The Vikings
line_text: I can look inside the tree.

title: The Vikings
line_text: Bjorn stares around at the deeply-forested hill they are on.

title: The Vikings
line_text: So - you could tell which of these trees would make the best planks for a ship?

title: The Vikings
line_text: Floki grins...then abruptly walks off the path, and into the trees.

title: The Vikings
line_text: For their POV - and from ours - all the trees look the same, virtually identical.

title: The Vikings
line_text: But Floki stares at them with a strange, bewitching intensity....touching the trunks of some of them, laying his cheek against the bark, staring up at the uppermost branches.

title: The Vikings
line_text: Whatever amusement Bjorn might derive from seeing a man staring at trees is quickly confounded by the aura of spiritual intensity which surrounds Floki.

title: The Vikings
line_text: It's not possible to laugh at the way he examines the bark of tress, or caresses them, or simply just looks at them.

title: The Vikings
line_text: He indicates a tree - to the others, just like the rest of the trees...and yet.

title: The Vikings
line_text: Inside this tree are two almost perfect planks.

title: The Vikings
line_text: They will bend, then curve, like a woman's body, from the thigh to the back.

title: The Vikings
line_text: When I split the tree I will find them.

title: The Vikings
line_text: Do you think I am joking?

line_text: to reassure you in this your time of motherly concern .

title: Changeling (film)

title: Changeling (film)

title: Blade: Trinity
line_text: Dr. Vance-you 're a psychiatrist and a biochemist , is n't that right ?

title: Blade: Trinity
line_text: I 've long believed that in order to achieve true health , we have to reconcile the body and the mind .

title: Blade: Trinity
line_text: Of course that also requires letting go of a lot of our old notions and superstitions , which is what my work is all about .

title: Blade: Trinity
line_text: How do you account for the fascination with things that go bump in the night ?

title: Blade: Trinity
line_text: Movies , books , videogames-seems like we ca n't get enough of our boogeymen ?

title: Blade: Trinity
line_text: Vance leans forward , skillfully playing to the cameras .

title: Blade: Trinity
line_text: Monsters provide a means for us to transfer our more primal and darker urges into something external .

title: Blade: Trinity
line_text: In the case of vampires , you 're dealing with taboo issues like predatory rage and sexual sadism .

title: Blade: Trinity
line_text: These are scary subjects for people to own up to .

title: Blade: Trinity
line_text: So we pass the buck to someone else ?

title: Blade: Trinity
line_text: Historically , people suffering from medical conditions have always been our psychological scapegoats .

title: Blade: Trinity
line_text: In the Middle Ages schizophrenia was often attributed to demonic possession .

title: Blade: Trinity
line_text: Well , there 's a hereditary blood disease known as porphyria that has symptoms remarkably similar to the classic vampiric traits .

title: Blade: Trinity
line_text: People suffering from this disease are anemic , they become sensitive to sunlight , they ca n't tolerate garlic-

title: Blade: Trinity
line_text: Which is too bad , since my doctor tells me that 's good for the heart .

title: Blade: Trinity
line_text: What 's your take on all the recent rumors we 've been hearing about vampires ?

title: Blade: Trinity
line_text: The only vampires I 'm worried about are the ones passing the bar exam .

title: Blade: Trinity
line_text: Seriously , if vampires existed , do n't you think we 'd be on to them by now ?

title: Blade: Trinity
line_text: The truth is , our streets have never been safer .

title: Blade: Trinity
line_text: Homicides , assaults-violent crime is down across the board .

title: Blade: Trinity
line_text: If people want to be concerned , they should focus on criminals like Blade .

title: Blade: Trinity
line_text: He 's a sociopath we 've been pursuing .

title: Blade: Trinity
line_text: Blade is a very disturbed individual .

title: Blade: Trinity
line_text: Even the name he 's chosen for himself is troubling .

title: Blade: Trinity
line_text: According to witnesses , he operates under the belief that a vast conspiracy of vampires live amongst us .

title: Blade: Trinity
line_text: You have to look at the psychiatric underpinnings here .

title: Blade: Trinity
line_text: What does a person like Blade really want ?

title: Blade: Trinity
line_text: Odds are , he 's really trying to work out some kind of inner trauma .

title: Blade: Trinity
line_text: He thinks he 's slaying monsters , but he 's really trying to murder aspects of himself .

title: Blade: Trinity
line_text: The sound of GUNFIRE pre-laps over from the next scene as we-CUT TO :

title: Jurassic Park III
line_text: EXT. EXCAVATION BASE CAMP, PT. PECK LAKE, MT-DAY

title: Jurassic Park III
line_text: CLOSE ON a man 's hand , carefully scraping the stone away from a dinosaur fossil .

title: Jurassic Park III
line_text: We follow his hand back as he wipes off his sweaty brow , revealing him to be BILLY BRENNAN , 25 , an associate professor and site manager .

title: Jurassic Park III
line_text: Looking past him , we see CHERYL , 21 , a junior at junior of State .

title: Jurassic Park III
line_text: She 's one of a dozen COLLEGE STUDENTS working at the site , and the one most smitten with her supervisor .

title: Jurassic Park III
line_text: I do n't think I 'm doing this right .

title: Jurassic Park III
line_text: He scoots over , lying down beside her .

title: Jurassic Park III
line_text: See , just take it little at a time .

title: Jurassic Park III
line_text: She 's not listening , just watching his eyelashes .

title: Jurassic Park III
line_text: I can never tell what 's bone and what 's rock .

title: Jurassic Park III
line_text: The calcium in the bones is replaced during fossilization .

title: Jurassic Park III
line_text: But you can feel the difference .

title: Jurassic Park III
line_text: He runs her bare fingers over the two different patches , showing her .

title: Jurassic Park III
line_text: After a pause , she runs her finger along his stubbly chin .

title: Jurassic Park III
line_text: Billy may not have started this flirtation , but he 's not ending it either .

title: Jurassic Park III
line_text: It 's then that a SHADOW falls across them .

title: Jurassic Park III
line_text: Grant has just returned , a bag over his shoulder .

title: Boiler Room (film)
line_text: So tell me about your family .

title: Boiler Room (film)
line_text: My dad 's the mess , but that 's not very interesting conversation .

title: Boiler Room (film)
line_text: Now I 'm taking care of her .

title: Boiler Room (film)
line_text: She 's been sick for a while now .

title: Boiler Room (film)
line_text: It makes her so happy that I make this salary so I can support us .

title: Boiler Room (film)
line_text: Rather not talk about my father either .

title: Boiler Room (film)
line_text: Boy , I 'm so glad we had this conversation .

title: Boiler Room (film)
line_text: I really feel like I 've gained this insight into your life .

title: Boiler Room (film)
line_text: What do you want to hear ?

title: Boiler Room (film)
line_text: Tell me a story about your dad .

title: Boiler Room (film)
line_text: Well I have so many great ones .

title: Boiler Room (film)
line_text: I just got this new bike .

title: Boiler Room (film)
line_text: So I 'm skidding out in this puddle-Starsky & Hutch style .

title: Boiler Room (film)
line_text: My foot slips , and the pedal spins around hard enough to break my leg .

title: Boiler Room (film)
line_text: But I do n't fall off the bike .

title: Boiler Room (film)
line_text: I keep coasting down this hill .

title: Boiler Room (film)
line_text: So finally I get scared and I jump off .

title: Boiler Room (film)
line_text: Fell right behind a parked car .

title: Boiler Room (film)
line_text: Laid there for half an hour .

title: Boiler Room (film)
line_text: Finally , I hear my father screaming my name from up the block .

title: Boiler Room (film)
line_text: I was so happy that he was coming to get me .

title: Boiler Room (film)
line_text: He comes around the car and sees me lying there .

title: Boiler Room (film)
line_text: There 's blood everywhere and the bone is sticking out straight through my skin .

title: Boiler Room (film)
line_text: I looked up at him , and for the first time in my life I saw how much he loved me .

title: Boiler Room (film)
line_text: It hurt him to see me in that much pain .

title: Boiler Room (film)
line_text: and slaps me across the face .

title: Boiler Room (film)
line_text: Maybe he was mad at me for making him that helpless , or it was the only thing he could think of .

title: Boiler Room (film)
line_text: I do n't really care anymore .

title: Boiler Room (film)
line_text: What I remember now is the look on his face when he first saw me .

title: Boiler Room (film)
line_text: Debbie leans over and kisses him deeply .

title: Weekends at Bellevue
line_text: Ellie is sitting alone on a dock in front of her childhood home, a blanket wrapped around her.

title: Weekends at Bellevue
line_text: She holds an ice pack to a bloody gash on her head, incurred in the ambulance jump.

title: Weekends at Bellevue
line_text: A 25-year-old man, TOM, approaches the front steps.

title: Weekends at Bellevue
line_text: The cops are looking for you.

title: The Beast
line_text: Filled with cheap, well-used toys and games.

title: The Beast
line_text: Demarest works a jigsaw puzzle with Zoey Baker, 8, adorable.

title: The Beast
line_text: Zoey, do you have any questions before you meet your birth mother?

title: The Beast
line_text: Why did she give me away?

title: The Beast
line_text: Linda was very young when she had you.

title: The Beast
line_text: She did what she thought was best for you.

title: The Beast
line_text: She wants to see me now 'cause I can make her better.

title: The Beast
line_text: Preston enters with Linda, who wears a colorful scarf.

title: The Beast
line_text: You are more beautiful than I imagined.

title: The Beast
line_text: Remember we talked about how I need to take cells out of your bone to give to her?

title: The Beast
line_text: A little, but this one will be in your back.

title: The Beast
line_text: I don't want to do it.

title: The Beast
line_text: Zoey, if you don't, your birth mommy won't get better.

title: The Beast
line_text: She runs for the door, Preston grabs her hand.

title: The Beast
line_text: She's very nice, just talk to her.

title: The Beast
line_text: I am glad she gave me away.

title: The Beast
line_text: He takes her by the shoulders, emphasizing --

title: The Beast
line_text: If you don't do this, she will die.

title: The Beast
line_text: Linda puts her hand on Preston's arm.

title: The Beast
line_text: Zoey pulls loose, runs out the door.

title: The Beast
line_text: I need to talk to her parents.

title: The Beast
line_text: Zoey doesn't want to do it.

title: The Beast
line_text: I need to make her understand.

title: The Beast
line_text: Tyler sticks his head in the room, informs him --

title: Constantine (film)
line_text: So when one of them gets a little cocky , peddles their influence or hijacks a soul-I deport their scaly ass right back to Hell .

title: Constantine (film)
line_text: I do n't get them all but maybe enough to insure my retirement .

title: Constantine (film)
line_text: Sounds like you 're trying to buy your way into Heaven .

title: Constantine (film)
line_text: Well , what would you do if you were sentenced to a prison where half the inmates were put there by you ?

title: Constantine (film)
line_text: Not a serene image at all .

title: Constantine (film)
line_text: I mean many go to Hell , why were you able to escape ?

title: Constantine (film)
line_text: God has a plan for all of us .

title: Constantine (film)
line_text: Moment is lost when her CELLULAR RINGS .

title: Constantine (film)
line_text: The cop in her reacts , flips it open .

title: The Last Days of Ptolemy Grey
line_text: INT. NIECIE'S HOUSE, SITTING ROOM - CONTINUOUS

title: The Last Days of Ptolemy Grey
The Last Days of Ptolemy Grey
line_text: Nina is languishing on a settee with her children sitting next to her.

title: The Last Days of Ptolemy Grey
The Last Days of Ptolemy Grey
line_text: Robyn looks and then comes in taking Ptolemy in tow.

title: The Last Days of Ptolemy Grey
The Last Days of Ptolemy Grey
line_text: Nina rises to her feet feeling real grief.

title: The Last Days of Ptolemy Grey
line_text: She tries to embrace Robyn but the girl is halfhearted returning the hug.

title: The Last Days of Ptolemy Grey
The Last Days of Ptolemy Grey
The Last Days of Ptolemy Grey
line_text: Reggie told me so much about you.

title: The Last Days of Ptolemy Grey
line_text: Nina hugs Ptolemy who is always ready for an embrace.

title: The Last Days of Ptolemy Grey
The Last Days of Ptolemy Grey
line_text: Nina starts crying again and returns to the settee.

title: The Last Days of Ptolemy Grey
line_text: Ptolemy is watching the poor sad children.

title: The Last Days of Ptolemy Grey
line_text: They little kids like me and Maude Petit back in Burdette.

title: The Last Days of Ptolemy Grey
Heroes
line_text: Ethan enters, looks up to see Stella rifling through the drawers of the night stand by the bed where her father lay dying.

title: Heroes
line_text: I need you to come with me someplace.

title: Heroes
line_text: She grabs some VIALS and stuffs them into her purse.

title: Heroes
line_text: He's more confident and determined than we have ever seen him.

title: Heroes
line_text: Look, I can't work for your father anymore.

title: Heroes
line_text: I can't, I need to make some changes in my life.

title: Heroes
line_text: I can't keep living for other people.

title: Heroes
line_text: I need to spread my wings, you know?

title: Heroes
line_text: We will talk about this later!

title: Heroes
line_text: Right now I need you to come with me.

title: Heroes
line_text: You are a nurse, you can give a shot.

title: Heroes
line_text: But she doesn't answer, as she strides towards the door.

title: Heroes
line_text: Off Ethan, wondering what he's getting into

title: Prodigy Bully
line_text: Why don't we all take a deep breath and remember why we are here?

title: Prodigy Bully
line_text: When have you not been, Angela?

title: Prodigy Bully
line_text: And I am happy to finally see someone smack someone else in the face.

title: I, Robot (film)
line_text: Spooner and Calvin enter the MAINFRAME of U.S. Robotics .

title: I, Robot (film)
line_text: This is the nerve center of the whole operation .

title: I, Robot (film)
line_text: Walls lined with COMPUTERS , SCREENS , and thousands of CONTROLS .

title: I, Robot (film)
line_text: VICTOR appears on a wall-sized SCREEN broken up into beehive-like components .

title: I, Robot (film)
line_text: I will now play you the last thirty-two seconds of Dr. Hogenmiller 's life .

title: I, Robot (film)
line_text: The elevator opens and DOCTOR HOGENMILLER steps into the metal corridor .

title: I, Robot (film)
line_text: Spooner watches the lab doors open to admit him .

title: I, Robot (film)
line_text: The doors slide closed behind him .

title: I, Robot (film)
line_text: The cameras , still trained on the corridor .

title: I, Robot (film)
line_text: Dr. Hogenmiller did not permit cameras to observe him while working .

title: I, Robot (film)
line_text: That was only within the last year .

title: I, Robot (film)
line_text: So we can throw paranoia into the mix .

title: I, Robot (film)
line_text: POLICE OFFICERS appear and force open the doors .

title: I, Robot (film)
line_text: Now TECHNICIANS appear and rush through in a blur .

title: I, Robot (film)
line_text: I hate to be a stickler .

title: I, Robot (film)
line_text: On screen , we see Spooner and Calvin enter the lab .

title: I, Robot (film)
line_text: But do n't killers usually have to enter and exit the scene of a crime ?

title: I, Robot (film)
line_text: Spooner turns away from the footage .

title: I, Robot (film)
line_text: Unless they 've always been there-and never left .

title: I, Robot (film)
line_text: You think the murderer was in the lab the entire time ?

title: I, Robot (film)
line_text: If I 'm right , it 's still there .

title: I, Robot (film)
line_text: Spooner turns back to the screens .

title: I, Robot (film)
line_text: The IMAGE paused at the exact moment the MECHANICAL GUARD rolled in front of the lab door .

title: Betwixt
line_text: Celine's father, MICHAEL HALSTEAD (40's), looks up from his newspaper as Celine enters.

title: Betwixt
line_text: Her mother VANESSA sets down a plate of breakfast.

title: Betwixt
line_text: She grabs a slice of toast off the plate, kisses both parents.

title: Betwixt
line_text: She rushes out the door, leaving Vanessa to stare ruefully at the untouched eggs.

title: Four Stars
line_text: General Rodgriguez is in the kitchen with a NAVAL OFFICER as the ARMY/NAVY FOOTBALL BROADCAST plays.

title: Four Stars
line_text: Rodriguez hands the officer a BOTTLE OF SCOTCH.

title: Four Stars
line_text: Probably too refined for a Navy man, but a bet is a bet.

title: Four Stars
line_text: Look forward to beating you again next year, General.

title: Four Stars
line_text: Rodriguez laughs as the Naval Officer exits, but his smile disappears when General Buckley enters the room.

title: Four Stars
line_text: That's fifteen in a row we have dropped to Navy.

title: Four Stars
line_text: Our O line hasn't looked this bad since you were playing.

title: Four Stars
line_text: My staff tells me you want to do a presser in advance of Wilson's hearings.

title: Four Stars
line_text: If we don't get out in front of it we will be sitting with our thumbs up our asses while Wilson grandstands for the cameras.

title: Four Stars
line_text: There's nothing to get out in front of.

title: Four Stars
line_text: It was a bad strike - we hit those doctors.

title: Four Stars
line_text: But I don't see how either one of us did anything we ought to be afraid to answer for.

title: Four Stars
line_text: We made the right call based on the intel we had at the time.

title: Four Stars
line_text: All our reliable sources were in agreement.

title: Four Stars
line_text: I see no reason to mention Zayid.

title: Four Stars
line_text: The Pakistanis vetted him, not us.

title: Four Stars
line_text: Don't try to coach my testimony.

title: Four Stars
line_text: I am not asking you to shade the truth.

title: Four Stars
line_text: God knows you had never do that.

title: Four Stars
line_text: It hangs there for a moment.

title: Four Stars
line_text: My point is you might want to think long and hard about what we open up on national television.

title: Four Stars
line_text: Look, I know with Hank stepping down at the end of the year you are on the short list for Chairman.

title: Four Stars
line_text: I know what the truth is.

title: Four Stars
line_text: You always think you do, don't you?

title: Four Stars
line_text: Maybe it's about Tim, or maybe not, but Buckley's had enough.
